academiae cantabrig oxon praeclaris luminibus ac ornamentis coeteriſque sacrae theologiae candidatis ſincerioris literaturae studioſis gratiam ſalutem christo iesv siquanto amoris ſtudio vtramque academiam perſequor tanto honoris teſtimonio adornare ea poſſem ʋiri clariſsimi certè quidem hoc qualecunque opus meum veſtro praeſertim nomini inſcriptum uſque adeò excellens ſingulare fuiſſet ut nec ad conciliandam gratiam cujuſquam nec ad veniam deprecandam praefatione aliquâ indigeret quo tamen ſi quaefortè vobis occurrant ut ſunt ſanè plurima nullo hactenùs ex noſtris partibus authore praevio medium prolata veſtrae perſpicacitatis erit quanti momenti illa fuerint dijudicare quorum duntaxat apex aliquot ſaltem attingere operaepretium eſſe duxi sacramento euchariſtiae reſp chriſtiana nihil unquàm ſublimius nihil ſanctius habuit atque augustius quo chriſtiani quodammodò chriſtum ipſum transformamur hujus inſtitutionem frontiſpicio libri ex aliorum placitis missam appello quam vocem aliquis fortaſsis omiſſam nimis velit quin estotu bono animo quiſquis e pius zelôtes papiſticae miſſae exoſor vehemens etenim nomen miſſa ſecum omen ſuum apportat quod cum à dimittendis ijs qui eucharistiae participes eſſe nolunt ortum ſuum traxit romanam miſſam planè ingulat quae veluti amaſios ſuos spectatores meros omnibus lenocinijs ad ſe allicit atque invitat ac ſi illo uno theatrico ſpectaculo religio ipſa chriſtiana ferè tota conſisteret quos tamen antiquitas catholica apud graecos 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 apud latino diſcedere iuſsit perſiſtentes ut homines praefractos impudentes graviter acerbéque invecta eſt haec de operis titulo praefari mihi libuit nè isthoc vocabulo miſſae veluti ipſo veſtibulo impegiſſe videar ex parte operis primâ quam practicam dicimus conſtat inſtitutionis chriſti canones decem per tridentinos canones romana miſſa perfringi jugiter violari ſed maiori nè impudentiâ impietate difficile eſt dicere nam depravationibus iſtis patrocinandis mille annorum conſuetudini univerſali anteponunt ſequioris aetatis diutiſsimè ſcilicet retentam ut aiunt trecentorum annorum modernae eccleſiae romanae en ſapientioris uſum contrarium deindè praeceptum praximque apoſtolicam à pontifice rom abrogari poſſe garriunt quin adverſus exemplum chriſti multis retrò ſeculis vel ab ipſis rom pontificibus ſanctè religioſe que obſervatum obtendunt conſuetudinem contrariam habendam eſſe pro lege hoc parum eſt quià quamvis de contrario praecepto chriſti conſtaret nihilominùs ius ipſum divinum à pontifice romano relaxari poſſe ieſuita blaſphemo ore pronunciat sequitur par altera quam dogmaticam nominamus multa membra ſe diffundens ità tamen ut horum verborum chriſti hoc est corpvs mevm c expoſitioni literali myſterij romani de eucharistia mole tota nitatur quanquàm dùm iſtis explicandis adverſarij noſtri tridentinorum patrum ſpiritu afflati tropum omnem ab eiſdem longè exulare iubent ipſi tamen quae eſt vertigo mera tropos ſex velint nolint coguntur agnoſcere porrò una particula hoc totius controverſiae cardo vertitur de qua cum quaeritur quid ea propriè deſignet pontificij doctores duas eaſ que contrarias opiniones diſtrahuntur alij enim per hoc chriſti corpus denotari volunt alij ad aliud quod ipſi commenti ſunt individuum vagum pronomen illud referunt ità ut utri que andabatarum à ſe invicèm vapulent dùm hi priorem ſententiam prorſùs abſurdam illi poſteriorem abſurditatum plenam non dicunt modò verúm etiam ſolidis argumentis evincunt iam igitur hoc uno fundamento ipſorum pontificiorum contradictionibus ut olim turris babel diruto que dejecto alia de tranſſubſtantiatione de corporali christi praeſentia coniunctioneque cum corporibus communicantium de propriè dicto sacrificio de divina deni que adoratione ſuperſtructa portentoſa dogma omnia corruere labefactari neceſſe est de ſingulis ſi placet pauca delibemus primo loco tranſ • ubſtantiationis non dogma modò ſed vox ipſa multò aliter quàm piſces novitate ſua foetent ecquid habent quod opponant nonnihil nempè patres antiqui inquiunt de converſione hujus sacramenti verba facientes transformationis tranſitionis tranſmutationis tranſelementationis vocabula frequenter uſurpârunt unde ipſiſsimam ſuam tranſſubſtantiationem dilucidè probarigens romana clamitat vociferatur cum tamen adverſarios noſtros minimè lateat eoſdem sanctos patres parilibertate ſermonis iudicij que ſynceritate eaſdem vox ſingulas ad alias converſiones transtuliſſe ut exempli gratiâ nunc verbi praedicati auditorem nunc corporis chriſti eccleſiam nunc hominis chriſtiani chriſtū nūc deni que corporum chriſtianorum ipſam chriſti carnem ʋndè ſequitur quâ ratione praeclari isti diſputatores unam duntaxat tranſſubſtantiationem aſtruere conantur eâdem ex ipſa lege parium ô homines miſerè faſcinatos alioſ que miſerrimè faſcinantes quatuor alias tenentur admittere membro tertio partis dogmaticae quaeſtio de corporali praeſentia chriſti euchariſtia agitatur quae que hùc pertinent omnia ad hoc unum caput reducuntur quid ſit illud quod iuxta christi inſtitutionem iam dicitur corpus meum hoc catholica eccleſia per multa ſecula ab apoſtolicis uſ que temporibus nullum aliud eſſe credidit quàm quod à b virgine natum unum uno loco definitum ſeu circumſcriptum organicum quo que demùm senſuum omnium abſolutiſsimâ integritate juxtà gloriae perfectione cumulatiſsimâ praeditum quod romanenſes carbonarijs ſuis diſcipulis obtrudunt deus bone quale corpus quàm minimè illud mevm primò id enim natura tranſſubſtantiationis neceſſariò exigit corpus quale piſtores pinſunt ex pane confectum mox corpus nam que hoc diſcontinuitas locorum per ſe poſtulat multiplex quale geryonis illud fuiſſe fingitur poſt corpus quià non definitivè loco quale eſſe nullum poteſt infinitum dein corpus quia totum qualibet parte locus quale quis vix ſomniare poteſt paraphyſicum inſuper corpus ut ipſi aiunt omni movendi ſentiendi intelligendique facultate deſtitutum id eſt coecum ſurdum exanime corpus deni que nullis non ſordibus cuiuſvis ſterquilinij locorum quae honeſtè nominari non poſſunt inhonestiſsimorum obnoxium qualia opinionum portenta ut omninò haeretica veteres patres ſemper execrati ſunt ʋerùm enimverò diverſarum aetatum ſubrancidas hiſtorias ſi numeremus tredecim proferunt quibus memoria de veriſsimae carnis veriſsimique ſanguinis chriſti euchariſtia apparentiâ veriſsimâ lectoribus commendatur quibus miraculis tanquàm dei testimonijs omni exceptione majoribus adverſarij nostri mirificè gloriantur dici vix poteſt quantoperè miſeros mortales hâc una perſuaſione ſua dementarunt cùm tamen haec veriſsima ſcilicet ſi ponderentur vaniſsima eſſe ſingula apparebunt quem finem bonis illis hiſtoricis valedicentes rectà scholas petimus exploraturi scholaſtici eandem inſanirent inſaniam hi tantum abest ut iſtis legendarijs fidem aſſenſionemve praebeant ut eiuſmodi apparitionibus vel veram carnem chriſti vel omninò veram carnem ineſſe auſint non pernegare modò verumetiam contrariam hanc ſuam ſententiam exquiſitis rationibus defendere quanquam quid horum probatione opus eſt quandoquidem nemoferè eſt tàm muccoſis naribus modò non ſenſus ſuos prorſus obstruat cui non ſuboleat imò qui non ea legendo planè odoretur perſentiſcat fabulas à maleferiatis hominibus aniliter eſſe confictas quarto corporali ſua ut vocant chriſti conjunctione cum corporibus communicantium nihil aliud cernere licet quam capernaiticam quandam ſtupiditatem quoties pontificios audimus antiquas ſuas canere cantilenas ſe nimirùm dentibus terere gutturibus deglutire hoc eſt ut no quidem interpretamur verè devorare atque inſuper hominum viſceribus permiſcere imo tàm canum murium que nec non viliſsimi cujuſ que animalis inteſtinis quàm vllius etiam ſanctiſsimi viri qui illius particeps eſſe poteſt quis deinceps miretur fuiſſe olim qui philoſophos ſe dicerent qui aſſerebant nivem ſibi atram videri coelum conſiſtere terram motione ſuâ eâ que perpetuâ rotari hoſce ſcopulos praetervecti contentionum labyrinthum dilabimur de sacrificio miſſae tot amphibologijs verborum involucris tot opinionum antilogijs ceu viarum anfractibus ſinuoſi maeandris undique implicitam ut abſ que commoda aliqua distinctione difficiles imo impoſsibiles habeat explicatus eò que magi quòd apud veteres patres ut quod re eſt liberè fateamur de sacrificio corporis christi eucharistia incruento frequens eſt mentio quae dici vix potest quantopere quorundam alioqui doctorum hominum ingenia exercuerint torſerint vexaverint aut econtrà quam jactantèr pontificiy de ea ſe oſtentent cum tamen hic nodus uno hoc diſtinctionis quaſi cuneo facilè diſcindatur corpus chriſti dupliciter ſumitur velut subjectum celebrationis euchariſticae velut objectum ejus si subjectivè accipiatur pro eo cui externa accidentia inſunt tùm non poteſt non corporalem praeſentiam christi deſignare ſin verò objectivè tantùm habitâ relatione ad chriſti corpus vel ut olim cruce pendentis vel ut nunc coelo regnantis praeſentiam duntaxat symbolicam declarat quoniam objectum licet rei cruentae ut scaena ipſum eſt tamen incruentum id quod ſex argumenta ex veterum patrum teſtimonijs deprompta dilucidè demonſtrant eadem igitur diſtinctione quivis poterit ità prorſùs 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ut non habeant quod contrà muſsitent quid quod praetereà etiam romana miſſa grandis sacrilegij rea arguitur ad extremum extremae nefandae idolomaniae rom 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ipſum quae eſt sacramenti eucharistiae divina adoratio medium protrahitur ubi id quod adorant poſſe eſſe adhuc panem propter ferè infinitos defectus ipſi adverſarij ultrò concedunt no non poſſe illud non panem eſſe juxta ʋeterum ſententiam ex rationibus circiter ſexdecim evicimus que etiam quas adorandi formula ceu pretextus excuſationis ergò ſibi tanquàm larva induxerunt illis detraximus ut vultus eorum deformes horridi que appareant uſ que eò ut illi idololatricâ impietate ethnicos aequare excuſationis verò futilitate longè ſuperare videantur quid tandem tota ferè miſſae defenſio manicheorum eunomianorum marcionitarum eutychianorum aliorum que multorum haerefibus ſcatet paſsim ut poſtrema noſtra synopſi veluti ſpeculo contemplari quivis poſsit dùm iſta literis conſigno oſtenſae ſunt mibi inter alias theſes duae quas iſaacus caſaubonus▪ 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 adverſarijs ſuis propriâ manu ſcriptis poſt ſe reliquit prima iuſta cauſa eſt inquit cur tranſſubſtantiatio rejiciatur ut evitentur abſurda altera haec est veteres nunquam dixerunt deſtrui symbola ſed ſemper de signis locuti ſunt quaſi de ipſa quae quàm verae ſunt juxta veterum ſententiam ad cauſam nostram oppidò neceſſariae noſtri muneris erit ſuo loco copioſè oſtendere priuſquàm verò perorare mihi liceat vos orandi eſtis viri ornatiſsimi ut de adverſariorum nostrorum iniquitate de meoquè erga vos ſtudio ac benevolentia nonnihil attexam bellarmino alano maldonato alijſ que romanae miſſae aſſerioribus ſuum ut par eſt ingenij acumen exactum perſpicax ingenium omnium de • que tàm humanae quàm divinae literaturae accuratam cognitionem facitè tribuimus ità tamen vt ijs dùm noſtros theologos criminantur veritatem dum ſuas opiniones defendunt conſtantiam dùm patres patres crepant obiectant inculcant fidem modeſtiam que defideremus ʋt nihil de eorum iuramentis dicamus quibus ſe obſtrinxerunt non ſine aliqua notâ periurij quod synopſis noſtra secunda ſatis ſuper que declarat ad noſtram quod attinet sacratiſsimā euchariſtiam quia à miniſtro elementa conſecrantur benedicuntur non minùs sacramenta ſunt quàm eſt aqua baptiſmatis quae tamen iſtis non pudet probris ſuis contaminare dum partem alteram merum piſtoris panem alteram oenopolae vinū nudū appellant nequitèr deindè ut alias eorū calumnias praetervolem quòd eorum de corporali chriſti praeſentiâ eucharistiâ fanaticam opinionem tanquàm impoſsibilem propter implicitam contradictionem oppugnamus illi quaſi hoc eſſet dei omnipotentiae detrahere no impotentèr debacchantur si cui lubeat ſingulas operis huius sectiones percurrere vix aliquam incidet aut obiectionem adverſariorum proſua miſſa aut reſponſionem aut deni que scripturae expoſitionem quam non facilè obſervet ab alijs pontificijs doctoribus aut luculentâ ratione ſolutam enervatam exploſam aut deni que quod maius eſt per receptas eccleſiae romanae doctrinas oppugnatam nae illa praeclara eſt iſtorum hominum conſtantia qui ſi minùs viribus nostris ſuâ tamen imbecillitate diſſentione vincuntur que ſuccumbunt praetereà de pontificiorum doctorum verſutia obſtinacia que ſatis queri vix poſſumus verſutia eorum cernitur cùm rebus alijs tûm praecipuè abutendis veterum patrum testimoniis ſive per falſas editiones tranſlationeſ que ea depravando ſive novo excogitato commento illudendo ſiue deni que adverſis frontibus oppugnando quorum omnium exempla plurima libri ſinguli ſequentes vobis exhibent obſtinaciae verò eorum ſpecimen nullum poteſt eſſe illustrius quàm quod altera synopſi noſtra videre est ex ʋeterum ſententijs facta collatione euchariſtiae cum baptiſmate illi ad ſua dogma ſtabilienda de praeſentia corporali corporis christi euchariſtia ipſiuſ que adeò adoratione latreutica obijciunt nobis patres negâſſe euchariſtiam eſſe nudum panem no reponimus eoſdem patres paritèr negâſſe baptiſmate eſſe aquam nudam opponunt veteres euchariſtiam sacrificium vocâſſe no rurſùs baptiſma quoque sacrificium nominant illi apud patres euchariſtia sacramentum terribile venerabile dicitur regerimus no à patribus moneri homines ad baptiſma utpote quod venerandum ſit cûm tremore accedere pergimus dein per ſexdecim 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 par pari referimus quod adverſariorum noſtrorum niſi animos obſirment conſcientias mordeat lancinet ſed manu tamen medicâ ut ſanet eant igitur antagonistae nostri cum de antiquitate agitur no ut ſolent novatores appellitent nunquàm tamen efficiet quin ipſi ut praeclarè olim clariſs vir ioſephus scaliger ʋeteratores habeantur redeo ad vos tandem digniſsimi viri quorum intimos animorum conceptus audire mihi videor quibus quoad poſsim liceat occurrendu eſſe • duxi prim loco fateor equidem iamdiú iſt uſmodi polemicis negotijs exercuiſſe calamum non quòd neſciverim à detractione neminem eſſe immunem niſi qui nihil ſcriberet ſed quòd abundè noverim pro ſalute patriae proquè patria ſalutis que adeò pro fidei ſynceritate nullum non laborem eſſe ſubeundum secundò multos alios multo majore cum profectu munere hoc defungi poſſe agnoſco veruntamen quatenùs praeſtare quicquam valeam illud auguſtini aures mihi vellicat animum que ſtimulat qui mendacium docet inquit qui veritatem tacet uterque reus eſt alter qui • prodeſſe non vult alter quia nocere deſiderat nec profectò hanc romulei ſtabuli cùm purgandi non datur exagitandi provinciam miſſatica alio animo ſuſcepi quàm ut omnes quibus veritas cordi eſt intelligant no anglicanae eccleſiae alumnos cauſam nactos eſſe divinis literis conſentientem maximè catholicae antiquitatis ſuffragijs comprobatam mille omnis ordinis martyrum ſanguine teſtatam imò etiam addendum eſt enim cuiuſvis chriſtiani ſi fieri poſſet vel mille mortibus obſignandam praetereà romanae eccleſiae tyrunculis omiſsis anteſignanos ipſos libentiùs aggredior duplici ratione adductus quià primò profligatis illi non poſſunt conſiſtere deindè ut clariùs conſtet illam eccleſiam quadrare illud chriſti si lumen quod te tenebrae ipſae tenebrae quantae quos tamen dûm argumentis proſequor non probris inſector quià hoc altero certaminis genere vincere vinci eſt nam praeclarè olim artaxerxes rex militi hostem convitijs proſcindenti non ut maledicas te alo inquit ſed ut pugnes cur verò vobis potiſsimùm meas lucubrationes dedicarem plurimae cauſae impulerunt antiquitùs plurimi dicebantur epiſcopi catholicae ſive vniverſalis eccleſiae non ſolùm quòd catholicam tenerent fidem ſed etiam quòd ſuam pro incolumitate eccleſiae ʋniverſalis curam scriptis laboribus teſtarentur egone igitur ut non illud ſtudium ergà utramque vniverſitatem profitear meum quod ipſi ut ità dicam vniverſalitati debeam huc accedit nam quidni fidorum amicorum literis fidem habeam quòd cum vos opus noſtrum aliud tribus abhinc annis publici iuris factum non vulgari animorum vestrorum ſignificatione approbâſſe intellexerim hoc que quod nunc ad umbilicū perduxi non minori cum deſiderio expectâſſe quorum illud grandem romanae ecclesiae impostvram detexit hoc romanae missae idolomaniam tanquàm immane monſtrum confodicat non committendum putavi ut non grati animi meum hoc teſtimonium vobis referrem quid quòd cauſae ipſius neceſsitas quoque id à exigere videbatur quae profectò hac cauſa homines academicos nihil minùs quàm academicos scepticos eſſe ſinet nè quis veſtrûm quod deteſtabile omen deus obruat rom artolatriam prolabatur quò vel alijs ſcandalo majeſtati divinae odio ſibi ipſi deni que certo exitio eſſe poſsit poſtremò hanc ſpem adducor nunquàm defuturos ex utra que academia viros plurimos theologici juris conſultiſſ omnibuſ que armis inſtructiſsimos non modò ad hujuſce cauſae patrocinium ſustinendum verumetiam ad mataeologiam omnem romanenſium expugnandam pergite igitur ô macti antiqua prudentia veritate pergite inquam amantiſsimum veſtri diligite quod rectius noveritis impertite precibus vestris adjuvate chriſto jeſu valete qui vos conſervet gloriam gratiae ſuae amen tho coven lichff advertiſement romiſh prieſts ieſuites engliſh seminary concerning neceſsity enſuing treatiſe alſo author sincerity adverſaries unconſcionable dealing allegation author grace peace trueth christ iesvs among controverſies held againſt romiſh religion none ever hot draw proteſtants violently fier theſe two firſt denying romane church catholike church without salvation ſecond affirme romiſh adoration sacrament altar idolatrous therefore eſpecially vndertaken diſcuſſion theſe queſtions ſeeing auguſtine truly ſaid puniſhment cauſe maketh martyr might fully appeare world whether proteſtants enduring fierie triall cauſes indeed heretickes true martyr conſequently whether perſecutors iuſt executioner perſons condemned rather damnable murtherers faithfull servant chriſt doubt firſt hath verified title booke prove doctrine neceſsity ſalvation romiſh church grand impostvre ſecond according promiſe preſent vnto make good many demonſtrations romiſh masse maſſe rather gulfe many superſtitious sacrilegious idolatrous poſitions practiſes becauſe name romane church commonly uſed ſelfe powerfull enchantment ſtupifie every romiſh diſciple ſtrike deafe dumbe may may neither heare utter thing conference concerning maſſe controverſie religion proteſtants defence never ſo divine trueth ancient time univerſall conſent neceſſary beleefe therefore held requiſite firſt place diſcover falſhood former article church would publiſh abomination maſſe end idolatrie scripture often termed ſpirituall adulterie romiſh church playeth bawd patronizing idolatry outted romiſh maſſe strumpet might eaſily either reformed wholly abandoned may ſatisfie neceſſity tractate next muſt ſet owne deluſorie trick anſwering anſwering bookes written againſt eſpecially ſuch beene obſerved mine owne experience one ſtangle booke birth ſo dealt mr breereley long ſince letter writ unto mee prevent publiſhing anſwere againſt firſt edition apologie ſent ſecond edition thereof anſwered might ought beene ſent twelvemonth ſooner purpoſely reſerved delivered untill day see proteſtants appeale beginning anſwere called appeale publiſhed certifying credulous reader epiſtle hee received scottiſh doctor cenſuring latine apology fond falſe promiſing anſwere printed gratz austria ſhould publiſhed michaelmas following whereas beene twenty vrging ſame proofes authority father wiſely concealing beene confuted faſhoods diſcouered maſter fiſher ſingling appeale explanation gaue teſtimonie gelaſius condemning manichee concerning opinion iuſultation booke 1 c 3 § 7 proued ſerueth nothing rather make themſelues ridiculous laſt moſt baſe deuelliſh gullerie falſe imputation falſhoods alleaging author fine ſleight maſter parſons man ſubtile • inuention elegant expreſſion obſeruation dextrous acute politike perſwaſiue application time anſwere ſome treatiſes written againſt romiſh blacke art aequiuocation mentall reſeruation poſitions fomenting rebellion wit bookes mitigation sober reckoning doth commonly leaue principall obiections reaſons falleth verball skirmiſhes concerning falſe allegation turning ironicall counſaile earneſt audacter fortiter calumniare c chargeth mee leſſe fiftie falſifications ſpunged booke entituled encounter retorted ſame imputation falſhood upon himſelfe intereſt forty may ſeeme verifie cognizance owne brotherhood romiſh prieſts quodlibet faſtened ſleeue calling quinteſſence coggerie mine owne integritie may iuſtifie mee howſoever one error may happen miſalleaging one author yet erred much yet never againſt conſcience heereof many witneſſes one within witneſſe moſt domeſticall yet leaſt partiall good thouſands mine owne conſcience ſecond god greater conſcience third ſort witneſſes ſuch ſtand mee even beene converſant mee peruſall examination author teſtimonies mee alleaged men ſingular learning iudgement teſtifie much endeared themſelves vnto mee happened ſhew mee leaſt errour thing hee ſhall ſay non poſſum errare muſt man hee ſay nolo errare hating erre chriſtian man laſt witneſſe integritie may bookes greateſt adverſaries mr parſons mr brereley whoſe many ſcores falſhoods beene laid ſo open publiſhed ſixteene yeares paſt two bookes one called encounter againſt foreman appeale againſt ſecond yet hath one appeared romiſh seminary vindicating heerein theſe advertiſements may eaſily conceive confidence may proceede worke wherein diſplayed layd open diſcuſſing theſe eight word chriſt inſtitution bleſſed sacrament euchariſt hee blessed brake gave saying take eate drinke ten romiſh prevarication tranſgreſſions afterwards following bookes reveiled ſtupendious paradox sacrilegiouſnes idolatrie masse together notorious obſtinacies ſome fewe overture periuries great summe may afterwards manifeſted ſwearing article new romane faith manifold hereſies defender thereof alſo indirect ſiniſter obiecting anſwering teſtimonies ancient father tranſgreſsions canon lord chriſt inſtitution romiſh maſſe ii booke manifeſteth palpable falſhood romiſh expoſition chriſts word inſtitution body iii booke diſcovereth novelty indeed nullity romiſh article tranſubſtantiation proveth continuance ſubſtance bread conſecration iv booke reveileth manifold contradiction romiſh defence corporall preſence christ body sacrament conſequently neceſſary impoſsibilitie thereof without impeachment omnipotencie god yea aduancement thereof together diſcovery falſhood thirteen hiſtories relating ſo many apparition true fleſh true blood chriſt euchariſt alſo ſhewing determination generall councell nice upon point corporall preſence v booke noteth threefold capernaiticall conceit romiſh pretended corporall manner eating swallowing g • treceiving chriſts fleſh vi booke diſplayeth manifold groſſe sacrilegiouſnes romiſh maſſe vpon profeſsion proper properly propitious sacrifice therein vii booke proveth abhominabledouble idolatrouſnes romiſh maſſe well formall materiall viii booke beſides three synopſes summarie comprehenſions firſt superſtitiouſnes secondly sacriledge thirdly idolatrie romiſh maſſe declareth diverſe periuries obſtinacies defender alſo many notorious hereſies defence thereof institvtion sacrament bleſſed body blood christ c firſt booke concerning actiue part chriſt inſtitution eucharist ten romiſh transgression thereof chap originall word masse nothing advantageth romiſh maſse sect diver romiſh nomen antiquiſſimum miſſa quod quidem fides chriſtiana profitetur ex hebraica vel chaldaica nomenclatura acceptum eſſe videtur miſſah e ſpontanea oblatio conueniens inſtituto sacrificio baron cardin anno 34 num 59 eſt hebraicum tolet ieſ cardin inſtruct sacerd li 2 c 4 quidam vt reulin alcian xaintes pintus pamelius exiſtimant eſſe hebraicum azor y reporteth inſt moral par 1 li 10 ca 18 doctor would haue word masse firſt firſt primitiue impoſition vſe thereof diuine secondly time ancient chriſt thirdly ſignification moſt religious deriued ſay hebrew word miſſah ſignifieth oblation sacrifice euen higheſt homage performed vnto god proue may call sacrifice masse challenge haue theſe doctor taught teſtimonie following margin ſo large conſent owne doctor prooued ſo cleare euidence deliuered author ſo eminent eſtimation owne church muſt little leſſen credit doctor noted neotericks haue vainely laboured vnder word masse falſely impoſe vpon reader opinion romiſh sacrificing maſſe word masse primitiue ſignification thereof doth properly belong vnto proteſtants iuſtly condemneth romiſh manner maſſe sect ii word masse miſſa à miſſione dictum eſt quoniam catechumeni • â ſuſceptâ foras de eccleſia emitterentur vt ritibus paganorum dici conſueuerat ilicet quod per syncopen idem eſt ac ire catechumenorum alia peractis ſacris miſsâ completâ binius place aforecited eſſe à dimiſſione per • te miſſa eſt tenet alcuin amalar fortunat durant quo ſuprà forenamed author confeſſe word latine doe hold commeth ite miſſa eſt • iubebantur exire catechumeni poenitentes vt qui nondum ad communicandum praeparauerant caſſaud conſult art 24 alſo tract de ſolit miſſa p 217 others see hereafter chap 2 § 5 point diſcuſſed diſmiſſing whole congregation receiuing sacrament ite miſſa eſt vſed ſecond place see binius aboue confeſſion ieſuites others authoritie councels father canonlaw schoolemen latine liturgy therefore ſo called latine phraſe miſſa est eſpecially becauſe companie catechumeniſts thoſe prepared communicate celebrating sacrament hearing goſpell sermon diſmiſſed ſuffered ſtay commanded depart furthermore ieſ maldonate iſidore moſt ancient author liturgy compelled confeſſe alij ut iſidorus de diuin offic dixerunt miſſam appellatam eſſe quaſi dimiſſionem à dimittendis catechumenis antequam sacrificium inchoaretur quā ſententiam colligo eſſe veriſſimam ex antiquiſs authoribus—clamabat enim diaconus poſt cōcionem catechumeni exeunto et qui communicare non poſſunt vt conſtat ex omnibus liturgijs vbi non poteſt nomen miſſae accipi pro sacrificio maldon ieſ lib dc 7 sacram tract de euch § primum p 335 moſt true meaning antiquity cuſtome exempting ſuch perſons euery religiouſly according teſtimonie micrologus ſaying microl de eccl obſeruat c 1 propter hoc certe dicitur miſſa quoniam mittendi ſunt foràs qui non participant sacrificio vel communione sanctum teſte caſſand altare ubi veſtimenta pro lectis caſaub exerc 16 baron leſt might obiect neceſſity repreſentation aqua quae fluxit è corpore chriſti bonauent q 3 11 cleares thus dicendum quòd per aquam illam non ſignatur aqua iſta nec è conuerſo ſed aqua illa aquam baptiſmatis ſignat againe concerning difference 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 plaine although azymes vſed chriſt paſchal feaſt yet occaſionally reaſon re videtur eſſe indifferens ſe ſed ità vt peccatum ſit homini graeco contra morem mandatum ſuae eccleſiae azymo no latina eccleſia niſi azymo ſine ſcelere non facimus alan card l 1 de euch cap • 2 pag 267 error eſt dicere alterutrum panem ſiue azymum ſiue fermentatum eſſe ſimplici • er de neceſſitate sacramenti hac vel illa eccleſia tàm graecis quam latinis licet conſuetudinem ſuae eccleſiae ſequi suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 44 § 3 p 523 fermentato confici poſſe eccleſia latina docet nam azymus panis fermentato non ſubſtantia ſed qualitate differt salmeron ieſ 9 tra 12 p 75 chriſtus dicitur panem accepiſſe ex quo intelligitur quemvis panem proprie dictum eſſe poſſe materiam euchariſtiae ſiue azymum ſiue fermentatum ianſen epiſc concord c 131 p 899 maior par theologorum docet non eſſe aquam de neceſſitate sacramenti—opinio illa cypriani quod • inet ad modum loquendi—quod ad rem attiner non catholicae eccleſi • fortaſſe etiam nec cypriani bel l 4 de euch c 11 § quinto leauened bread mr brerely lit tract 4 § 6 p 413 ebionite taught • nleavened bread neceſſary church commanded conſecration made leauened bread giant eſſence sacrament owne nature indifferent onely ſo farre bee obſerved command firſt part doe concerning likewiſe ſaying 1 cor 11 25 doe yee often c whereof owne doctor aſwell ieſuites thers haue rightly hoc facite alter ſenſus eſt facite viz quod feci—chriſtus accepit panem gratias egit benedixit c idipſum que praecepit diſcipulis eorumque ſucceſſoribus sacerdotibus barrad ieſ tom 4 lib 3 cap 6 pag 82 col 2 ſence hee alſo embraceth although hee excludeth ſecond illud hoc facite poſuit poſt datum sacramentum ut intelligeremus iu •• •• e dominum ut ſub c bellar l 4 de euch c 25 § reſp mirab idem hoc facite illud • bet vt totam actionem chriſti • mitemur ib c 13 § quod illa—pronomen hoc non tantum ad ſumptionem ſed ad omnia quae mox chriſtus feciſſe dicitur refertur mandat n facere quod ipſe fecit nempè accipere panem gratias agere • anſen epiſc concord c 131 p 903 againe bellar videtur • n ſententia iohannis à lovanio valde probabilis qui docet verba domini hoc facite apud lucam ad omnia referri id eſt ad id quod fecit chriſtus id quod egerunt apoſtoli ut ſit ſenſus id quod nunc agimus ego dùm conſecro porrigo vos dùm accipitis c frequentate vſ que ad mundi conſummationem profert n idem author veteres pa • re qui illa verba modò referunt ad chriſti actionem cyp • l 2 epiſt 3 damaſ l 4 de fide c 14 modò ad actionem diſcipulorum vt baſil reg mor 21 cyril alex l 11 ioh c 58 thus far bellar l 4 de euch c 25 § videtur—hoc facite praeceptum hoc non poteſt referri ad ea quae verbis antecedentibus ipſa narratione inſtitutionis habentur viz thoſe circumſtances goe hee tooke bread c nam ea vi eſt pronominis demonſtratiui hoc verbi facite ut praeceptum quod duobus verbis continetur ad ea tantum actiones referatur quas tum praeſentia chriſtus vel faciebat velfaciendas ſignificabat quae quid em actiones continentur ipſa narratione inſtitutionis quae incipit ab illis verbis accipiens panem greg valent ieſ tract de vſu alterius ſpec euch c 2 § id manifeſtè—hoc facite ex tribus euangeliſtis ex paulo 1 cor 11 conſtat chriſtum ſumptionem vini ſuo facto praeceptione eccleſiae commendaſſe alan card de euch c 10 p 255 hoc facite pertinet ad totam actionem euchariſticam à chriſto factam tàm à presbyteris quàm à plebe faciendam hoc probatur ex cyrillo l 12 ioh c 58 ex baſil moral reg 21 c 3 idem alan ib c 36 p 646 hoc facite idem habet paulus 1 cor 11 qui narrat id ipſum dici circa calicem ea omnia complectens quae dicuntur de poculo accipiendo c quod lucas complexus eſt dicens similiter calicem ianſen concord c 131 p 905 durand l 4 c 1 ſame minde calling institution chriſt officium miſſae non dicit hoc dicite ſed hoc facite quia mandat facere quod ipſe fecit ſc accipere panem gratias agere conſecrare sumere dare caietan card lucam pag 304 fine determined large conſent wordes doe haue relation aforeſaid act euen according • dgement ancient father excepting time celebration supper together u coenan tibus autem illis poſtquam coenanit non neceſſe eſt huiuſmodi sacramenti celebrationem aut coena praecedat aut conſequatur nam chriſtus ante coenauerat non ut exemplum praeberet fecit ſed neceſſariò quia opo • tebat vetera sacramenta prius implere quàm noua inſtituere id eſt agnum paſchalem priùs edere quàm corpus ſanguinem ſu • dare agnus autem non alio tempore quàm coenae edi poterat maldon ieſ mat 26 ſuper illa verba coenantibus autem c ſay put example occaſion paſſeouer commanded obſerved thus challenge command chriſt thus directly copiouſly acknowledged beſt diuines romane church muſt need challenge ſides anſwerable performance vpon examination whereof appeare vnto euery conſcience man profeſſors namely whether proteſtants romaniſts true catholike executor obſeruers laſt teſtament teſtator ieſus becauſe church muſt neceſſarily bee eſteemed loyall legitimate spouſe christ doth preciſely obey command celeſtiall bridegroome wee purpoſe apply ſelues buſines enquiring actiue particular chriſt hath giuen charge vnto church theſe expreſſe wordes doe wee diſcouer diſcuſſe point point ten transgression preuarications againſt command chriſt doe practiſed church rome day romane maſſe sect ii vvee liſt quarrell church lighter matter albeit owne caſſander forbeareth complaine panis oblatas quae nunc ad imaginem nummorum ad tenuiſſimam leuiſſimam forman veri panis ſpecie alienam redactae ſunt per contemptum ab ordinis rom expoſitore vocari minutia nummulariarum oblatarum quae panis vocabulo indignae ſunt propter quas eccleſiaſticum officium eiuſ que religio per omnem modum confunditur caſſand liturg ſol • 6 bread ſuch extreame thinneſſe lightneſſe may ſeeme vnworthy name bread whereas chriſt vſed solid tough bread glutinoſus ſaith panis azymus glutinoſus erat frangebatur ſiue manu ſiuè cultro lorin ieſ act 2 v 42 § indicat ieſuit broken hand cut knife neuertheleſſe becauſe ſubſtance bread therefore contend accident ſhadowes wee inſiſt vpon word inſtitution firſt tranſgreſſion church rome contradicting chriſt canon collected theſe word blessed apparet ex euangeliſtis paulo inde eſt quòd eccleſia latina pro eodem accipiens vox ſimul conjunxit idem ibid pag 76 illud verbum benedictionis eſt forma eius sacramenti idem eſt benedicere uti verbis conſecrationis ad elementa propoſita alan l 1 de euch ca 15 p 294 et catechiſmus trident dicit idem eſſe benedicere conſecrare re propoſi • idem ibid dixit paulus calix benedictionis • ui benedicimus e cui benedicendo sacerdotes conſecrant altari ut exponit b remigius salmeron ieſ quo ſup see alſo ianſ concor c 131 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 idem valere vide 1 cor 14 v 16 17 marc 8 v 6 7 mat 15 36 owne iudgements one ſhould ſaid hee bleſſed giuing thankes word bleſſing doth imply conſecration sacrament contrary canon romane maſſe wherein ſhee expoſition hath changed chriſts manner conſecration canon romiſh maſſe attributeth property power conſecration sacrament vnto repetition theſe word chriſt body blood c iudgement communis ſententia eſt non ſolùm theologorum recentiorum led etiam veterum patrum chriſtum conſecráſſe verbis hoc eſt corpus meum hic eſt ſanguis meus bellar l 4 de euch c 13 § quod attinet—probatur ex conc florentino conc trident ſeſſ 13 cap 1 barrad ieſ tom 4 l 3 c 4 alſo suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 58 sect 1 § dicendum—omnes veteres ſolis verbis dixerunt fieri conſecrationem maldon ieſ diſp de euch pag 134 nè formae ignoratione turpiſſime peccetur ab euangeliſtis apoſtolis docemurillam eſſe formam catechis rom de euch num 18 tenet sacerdos ambaous manibus hoſtiam profert verba conſecrationis diſtinctè hoc eſt corpus meum miſſal rom iuſſu pij quinti pont edit rubrica canonis aquinas part 3 qu 60 art 8 ſay councell florence trent moreouer alſo alleage purpoſe publique catechiſme romane miſſall authorized councell trent command pius quintus pope see marginals whereupon vſe attribute ſuch efficacie word pronounced priestly intention change bread baker ſhop wine vintner cellar body blood chriſt summa angelica tit euchariſtia num 25 de p • ne sacerdos conſecrans ex intentione eccleſiae vnâ vice poſſit conficere tot hoſtias quae ſufficerent toti mundo ſi neceſſitas effet eccleſiae summa angelica ſpeaketh largely concerning bread challenge bvt chriſtopherus archbiſhop caeſarea booke dedicated pope sixtus quintus written profeſſedly vpon subject commeth compaſſed clowd witneſſes reaſons proue chriſtoph de capite fontium archiepiſe caeſarien tract var ad sixtum quintum pont pariſ 1586—cap 1 non ſolùm thomas ſed omnes ante caietanū theologi fatentur chriſtum cùm benedixit conſecraſſe nec ullum verbum ut ait alphonſus à caſtro eſt pud euangeliſtas quo conſecratio ſignificetur praeter verbum benedixit vel per verbum gratias egit quod ibi pro eodem ſumitur—cap 5 ad formam à chriſto inſtitutam obſeruandum vrget praeceptum imitationis nempè hoc facite—d iacobus miſſâ ſua poſt recitationem verborum viz hoc eſt corpus meum accedit ad benedictionem quod eſt argumentum firmiſſ non credidiſſe eum ſola verborum illorum prolatione conſecrationem fieri eodem modo clemens miſſa ſuâ dionyſ cap 7 hierarch dicit preces eſſe effectrices conſecrationis ergo non ſolùm verborum iſtorum prolatio—lindanus probat ex luſtino ſine precibus conſecrationem nullam eſſe amalcharius praef lib de offic apoſtolos ſolâ benedictione conſectare conſueviſſe idem habet rabanus— cap 6 certum eſt graecos ſuſtinere non iſtis verbis ſed sacerdotis benedictione ſeu precatione conſecrationem fieri—nullus ex antiquioribus eccleſiae doctoribus per ſola quatuor verba chriſti conſecrationem fieri dixit—irridet eos scotus qui ſupernaturalem virtutem de novo creatam verbis iſtis ineſſe putant—scotum ſequuntur scholaſticorum turba landolfus pelbertus mart brotinus nic dorbellis pet tarraretus catharinus—lindanus de iuſtino ait quòd negat apoſtolos iſtis verbis u • o ad conſecrandam euchariſtiam de baſilio aſſerit quòd priſcos patres dicit non fuiſſe contentos ſolis iſtis verbis greg l 7 ep 63 morem fuiſſe apoſtolis ad ſolam dominicam orationem oblationem conſecrare hier sophon 3 solennem orationem sacerdotis precantis euchariſtiam facere ambroſ conſecrationem incipere ait ex eoloco canonis viz quam oblationem tu deus benedictam c visſcire inquit quibus verbis coeleſtibus conſecratur accipe quae ſint fac nobis hanc oblationem c idem tenet odo camerac—etiam bern audi quid sacerdos conſecratione corporis chriſti dicat rogamus inquit hanc oblationem benedictam fieri c leſt ſhould obiect apoſtles obſerve narration right order chriſts act hee addeth omnes nunc prouoco lectores ad legendos miſſales libros liturg iacobi clementis bafilij chryſoſt eccleſiae latinae videbunt niſi ſibi oculos eruere velint quàm conſtanter omnes unoore aſſerant teſtentur chriſtum dando euchariſtiam apoſtolis dixiſſe hoc eſt corpus meum poſt verba accipite manducate hier epiſt ad hebdid q 2 panem quem fregit chriſtus dedir que diſcipulis eſſe corpus domini saluatoris dicens accipite comedite hoc eſt corpus meum haec ille nota quòd ait chriſtum dixiſſe ad apoſtolos non ad panem hoc eſt corpus ergò non per iſta verba panem conſecrauit—si mihi opponant authoritatem pij quinti catechiſ qui poſt conc trid factus eſt ego opponam illi non minoris authoritatis ſanctitatis eruditionis autem nomine maioris innocentij tertij ſententiam oppoſitum ſentientis—et dico librum illum catechiſmi non definiendo ſed magiſtraliter docendo factum eſſe hactenus ex archiep caeſarien conſecration vſed sauiour performed bleſſing prayer preceded pronouncing thoſe word hoc eſt corpus meum bodie c purpoſe hee bold averre thomas aquinas catholikes caietane confeſſed chriſt conſecrate benedixit bleſſed saint iames dionyſe areopagite conſecrate word prayer aſſureth v greeke church maintained conſecration conſiſteth benediction prayer repetition word aforeſaid hee produceth ſubtileſt schooleman scotus accompanied diver others derided thoſe attributed ſuch ſupernaturall vertue forme word ſteppeth lindan avoucheth iuſtin one ancienteſt father denying apostle conſecrated euchariſt thoſe word hoc eſt c affirming conſecration could without prayer pleaſed peruſe marginals ſhall find alleadged teſtimonies pope gregorie hierome ambroſe bernard aſcend higher liturgy clement baſil chryſostome romane church ſelfe gainſaying conſecration word institution pretend end draweth two pope contradicting one point hath meanes ſtint iarre whereas authoritie equall thinke iuſt yeild rather better learned whoſoever requireth may ſatisfied reading booke itſelfe ſuffice ſay alſo vſe prayer romiſh liturgie queſtion meerely praying wherein forme benediction conſecration properly doth conſiſt none ſay conſecrateth prayer belieueth ordained conſecration may furthermore take hold way teſtification mr tract maſſe pag 105 brereley romiſh prieſt baſil chryſostome calling one part calix benedictione ſacratus alloweth benediction haue beene conſecration thereof armie witneſſes better meteor imaginarie figure battailes aire anſwere bellarmine may goe warrant wit pronuntiation theſe word hoc eſt corpus meum imply hee verba haec hoc eſt corpus meum pronuntiata à sacerdote cùm intentione conſecrandi sacramentum continent implicitè invocationem bellar lib 4 de euch c 14 § quintū arg ſaith invocation prayer word man may perceiue chriſt ſpake ſupplicatorily vnto god declaratiuely vnto apoſtles accordingly text ſpeaketh hee ſaid unto alſo well see former teſtimony letter g obſerved foreſaid archbiſhop caeſarea saint hierome none preſume dare ſay chriſt invocate diſciples theſe word therefore declaration invocation romiſh doctrine conſecrating reciting theſe word bodie c divine colen vehemens prorſus inſania eſt quòd nune arbitrantur ſe conſecrate hoc sacramentum ſine prece quam canonem appellamus abſque invocatione ſuper dona ſed tantùm recitatione verborum c talis recitatio non eſt cōſecratio—alitèr profectò erat eccleſia orientali occidentali—hactenùs eccleſia doctum fuit piece quâ sacerdos ſic invoca • hanc oblationem quaeſumus domine acceptabile facere dignetis c antididag de cath relig per canon eccleſ colonienſ tract de miſſa p 100 § ſine prece haue iudged fierce madneſſe repugnant eaſterne westerne church haue heard diver weſterne authours ſpeake giue leave eaſterne archbiſhop deliuer minde quod autem ille ſermo domini ſufficiat ad ſanctificationem nullus neque apoſtolus nec doctor dixiſſe yeares ſince ſatisfying alſo teſtimonie chryſoſtome obiected contrarie miſerable intolerable anſwere others see teſtimonie letter g towards end ſaid evangelist haue obſerved right order christ action chriſt maſſe contradicting ſence next word inſtitution brake sect iv brake evangeliſts doe relate act chriſt plainly noteth hee brake bread diſtributing ſame vnto diſciples command manifeſt ſaying well behalfe reſt doe prieſt indeed breaketh one hoaſt three part vpon conſecration thereof queſtion fraction breaking diſtribution people contrarie canon romane maſſe ecce coena chriſtus fregit panem tamen eccleſia gatholica modò non frangit ſed integrum dat salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 34 § nam p 275 behold ſay chriſt brake catholike church meaning romane doth breake giueth whole pretend doe reverenceſake leſt amulto tempore non uſupatur fractio ſed ſinguli pane ſeu minores hoſtiae conſecrantur ad evitandum periculum decidentium micarum lorin ieſ act 2 42 bonâ ratione nè micae aut particulae panisſacri pereant salmeron quo ſuprà aliquantò poſt ieſuite ſaith ſome crummes bread may fall ground neither direction prieſt breake bread either conſecration romane maſſe eſpecially diſtributed people challenge bvt ſee wee pray abſolute confeſſion owne fregit nimirùm tot particulas quot erant apoſtoli manducaturi praeterſuam quam chriſtus primus accepit et ut quidam non indiligenter annotavit quemadmodùm unum calicem communem omnibus tradidit ad bibendū ità unâ palma panem 12 buccellas fractum manibus ſuis diſpenſavit salmerquo ſuprà tract 12 § sequitur p 77 apoſtolus act 2 vocat euchariſtiam fractionem panis ob ceremoniam frangendi panem tot particulas quot ſunt communicaturi ut chriſtus fecit coena quem morem longo tempore eccleſia retinuit de quo apoſtolus panis quem frangimus nonne communicatio corporis chriſti domini qua fractione pulchrè repraeſentatur paſſio corporis chriſti idem ieſ tract 35 § vocat pag 288 infractione panis act 2 indicat fractionis nomen antiquam conſuetudinem partiendi pro aſtantibus ſive manu ſive cultro quià panis azymus glutinoſus ità facilius dividitur lorinus ieſ eum locum p 138 col 2 benedictionem ſequitur hoſtiae fractio fractionem ſequitur communio—hunc celebrandi morem ſemper eccleſia ſervavit tàm graeca quàm latina quarum liturgiae etſi verbis aliquandò diſcrepent certè omnes eo conveniunt quòd partes omnes miſſae chriſti exactè repraeſentent nihil de eſſentialibus omittentes vſus autem eccleſiae eius celebrandi ordo no docent qualis fuit chriſti miſſa quo illam ordine celebravit▪ archiep caeſar var tract pag 27 doctor whereby witneſſed firſt chriſt brake bread twelve part secondly act breaking bread ſuch principall act whole celebration sacrament hath thence appellation given apoſtles called breaking bread thirdly church christ alwayes obſerved ſame ceremonie breaking bread aſwell greeke latine conſequently romane church fourthly breaking bread symbolicall ceremonie betokening crucifying chriſts bodie vpon croſſe alſo common participation thereof repreſenting vnion myſticall bodie christ church communicating together one loafe many graines one loafe ſo faithfull communicant vnited one head chriſt apoſtle teacheth 1 cor 10 thus bread breake communion bodie chriſt many one bread adde moſt ſpeciall reaſon breaking diſtribution thereof apply repreſentation bodie crucified bloud ſhed heart ſoule every communicant bread given broken v ſo chriſt crucified v yet nevertheleſſe church contrarily profeſſing although chriſt breake bread yet behold ſhe doth ſo elſe ſtarch face inſolently confront chriſt command bold countermand ſee effect ſaying doe second challenge truly called catholike church yourſelves doe grant vnto v chriſt firſt inſtitution practice apostle ancient univerſall cuſtome whole church chriſt aſwell greeke latine ceremonie breaking bread continually obſerved may vnto v probable argument church rome doth falſly uſurpe title catholike better countenancing authorizing novell cuſtomes although neuer ſo repugnant chriſt cuſtome truly called catholike church next place pretence notbreaking becauſe reverence ſay hem ſcilicet quanti eſt ſapere chriſt apoſtles could foreſee neceſſitie namely diſtributing bread breaking ſome little crummes muſt cleaue ſometimes vnto beard communicant elſe fall ground though alteration called reverence rather arrogance making yourſelves wiſe chriſt inſtituted apostle father primitiue time continued ſame breaking bread therefore contempt breaking peremptorie breach chriſt inſtitution neuer regarding scripture ſaith 1 sam 15 22 obedience better sacrifice indeed true reverence mother obedience elſe devotion meere deriſion command chriſt doe third romiſh tranſgreſsion canon chriſt maſſe contradicting ſence next word chriſts command viz —gave vnto sect v followeth canon chriſt maſſe hee gaue vnto euen hee ſaid take yee eate yee pluralitie perſons excluded private maſſing foraſmuch high prieſt chriſt ieſus inſtituting adminiſtring sacrament would alone ſaid hereof circumſtances doe contrarie canon romane maſſe holy synod ſaith miſſas illas quibus ſolus sacerdos ſacramentaliter cōmunicat—probar atque adeò commendat concil trid seſſ 22 cap 6 councell trent doth approue commend maſſes wherein prieſt doth sacramentally communicate alone church challenge bvt ſhall iuſtifie commendation alonecommunicating prieſt may iuſtly condemne liberall sunt qui miſſa communionem requirunt ſic fateor à chriſto inſtitutum fuit ita olim fieri conſuevit eraſ concord eccleſ verſ finem act 2 erant communicantes oratione communicatione fractionis panis id eſt euchariſtia non minùs quàm oratione lorinus ieſ act 2 46 odo camera cenſ canonem ſcribit miſſas ſolitarias antiquitùsi • vſu eccleſiae non fuiſſe—et hunc fuiſſe antiquum eccleſiae rom morem • plures de eodem sacrificio participent doctiſſ •• quique agnoſcunt—itáque hac noſtra aetate r pater vir doctiſſ▪ ioh hoffmeiſterus verbis ſuam ſententiam declaravit re inquit clamat tàm graeca quà • latina eccleſia non ſolùm sacerdotem ſacrificantem ſed reliquos presbyteros diaconos necnon reliquam plebem aut • altem plebis aliquam partem communicâſſe quod quomodò ceſſavit mirandum eſt—et aliquos cùm sacerdote adfuiſſe qui ſacrificia laudis offerebant sacramentorum participabant canonis romani verba manifeſtè ſignificant viz quot ex hac altaris participatione ſacroſanctum corpus ſanguinem filij tui ſ • mpſerimus c item proſint nobis divina sacrificia quae ſumpſimus teſte g caſſandro conſult art 24 pag 216 217—223 c confeſſions owne doctor grant firſt according inſtitution chriſt ſaying plurall secondly practice apoſtles communicating together prayer breaking bread act 2 46 ſay aſwell euchariſt prayer thirdly ancient cuſtome whole church greek romane fourthly neither two idem ioh hoffmeiſterus quomodò inquit ordo antiquus ceſſauerit mirandum eſt ut bonus ille uſus reuocetur laborandum nunc verò poſtquàm communionis ordo à nobis obſeruari deſijt id que per negligentiam tàm plebis quàm sacerdotum ut ait hoſpin—ex canone quodam cone nannetenſis sacerdos ſolus miſſam celebrare vetatur abſurdum n eſt ut dicat dominus vobiſcum surſum corda gratias agimus deo domino noſtro cùm nullus eſt qui reſpondeat aut ut dicat oremus cùm nullus adeſt qui ſecum oret—et ſimile decretum reperitur conc papienſi ut nullus presbyter miſsam celebrare praeſumat—cur autem canon noſter speaking forme romane maſſe alijs ſuperſtitionem alijs contemptum adductus ſit cauſa potiſſimum eſt mutatio priſci ritus georg caſſand quo ſup councels one called nanetenſe papienſe decre • ing againſt priuate maſſe fiftly name true act 2 42 erant communicantes▪ c vſus fuit quondam frequentandae quotidiè euchariſtiae non minùs quàm orationis— 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſumitur pro uſu iſtius sacramenti 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 eadem eſt vi etiam vocis 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 pro congregatione fidelium ut interpretatur baſilius prayer vſed euery holy maſſe collectae per figuram dicebantur preces ab ipſa celebratione miſſae quum ad eam populus colligebatur bellar l 2 de miſſa cap 16 § poſt ſalutationem called collectae collect becauſe people vſed collected celebration maſſe ſelfe sixtly see aboue b canon romane maſse ſaying plurall sumpſimus haue receiued thereupon ſeuenthly repugnant complaint owne men againſt abuſe calling ioynt communion inſtituted chriſt generaliter autem dicendum eſt quòd illa eſt legitima miſ • qua ſunt sacerdotes reſpondens offerens que communicans ſicut ipſa precum compoſitio que communicantes caſſand quo ſupra legitimate maſſe doe wonder prieſts ſole communicating euer crept church alſo deplore contempt priuate maſſe hath brought vpon church hitherto ſee marginals owne beene obiected complaint chryſoſtome ſc fol 222 reaſon ſaith hee onely probable euident although affirme dayly celebration maſſe yet doe denie daily communion afterwards ſeeketh originall beginning priuate maſſe priuate monachos plus alioqui iam ſatis grauatos invidiâ primo prinatarum miſſarum authores fuiſſe quidam faciunt eſpenc ibid fol 227 non eſt quòd ex publicarum miſſarum monachis cùm interdictione colligamus privatarum ab eis inventionem ib fol 228 monastery yet able ſatisfie himſelfe commeth length debate controverſie wherewith many perplexed wit could bee ſaid prieſt alone lord anſwere made ſaid prieſt alone thy spirit end propoundeth many dominus vobiſcum c quarè ſalutatio non cleri modò ſed plebis fuit ex horum verborum occaſione mota olim iam tanta quaeſtio quâ non alia ſit hodiernis de religione controverſijs grauior au • magi agitata—gratianus roſpondet piè credi angolorum miſſa praeſentiam nobis orantibus aſſiſtentiam ad angelos igitur cum deeſſent homines ſalutationem hîc videtur retuliſſe ecquò n aliò melius referret vel ad lapides ut videtur ante illum odo cameracenſ epiſc ad id canonis et omnium circumaſtantium cùm poſtea inquit mo inolevit ſolitarias miſſas maximè coenobijs fieri ubi non habeant quàm pluraliter collectam ſalutent nec plures mutare poſſunt ſalutationes convertunt ſe ad eccleſiam dicentes ſe eccleſiam eccleſia ſalutare corpore totum corpus colloqui exercuerat ante ho cardinalium decanum à fratribus eremitis propoſita quaeſtio utrum ſingulares cellulis orantes iuxta morem eccleſiaicum ſibimet dicere deberent dominus vobiſcum quando nemo ſit qui reſponde • quidam etiam inter ſe ſic rationabantur hoc lapidibus▪ aut tabulis dicendum reſpondet peculiari opuſculo quod ideò inſcriptum dominus vobiſcum—ca 4 docuit ſeruandam eccleſiae conſuetudinem hanc sacerdotalem ſalutationem nec per traditionem permutari licere eccleſia ſiquidem chriſtiana tanta charitatis inter ſe compage invicem connectitur ut pluribus una ſingulis ſit per myſterium tota unaquae que electa anima per sacramenti myſterium plenum eſſe credatur eccleſia thus far eſpen quo ſup fol 212 213 gerſ tract qu • ſtion cum reſp quid sacerdos gerit stooles elſe deane cardinal teaching heremite alone ſay lord ſpoken himſelfe imaginarie foolery ſo vnworthy conception reaſonable men may feare held inconſiderate ſhould indeavor confute ſay leſſe much extreame madnes muſt wee iudge men either talke themſelues el metamorphoſed thing whereunto ſpeake vnto formes ſtones ſtooles like concluſion heare ſaid deane romane cardinal sacerdos dicit pax chryſoſtomi cypriani atque hieronymi eadem conſuetudo invaluit et hieronymꝰ ſcribit praefat lib 2 ad gal eccleſijs vrbis romae quaſi coeleſte tonitru audiri populum reboaniem amen bellar lib 2 de verbo dei cap 16 § sed neque tempore apoſtolorum cùm celebratetur sacrificium hoc sacerdos dixit hoc eſt corpꝰ meū populus reſpondebat amen—et hic uſus manavit totam eccleſiam uſque ad mille amplius concerning sacrament vſed ſay amen much need require concerning judgement practice true antiquitie cuſtome rather doubt ſuppoſe vniverſalitie thereof becauſe vſually goe farther dictate teach becauſe generally three generall knowne tongue hebrew greeke latine therefore divine ſeruice celebrated thorowout church one theſe three becauſe theſe could vulgar language euery chriſtian nation muſt follow ſay bellar lib 2 de verbo dei cap 15 16 ſo others alſo people moſt nation vnderſtood publike prayer vſed ſeverall church perſwaſion doe doctor locke vp conſciences falſe beleefe vniverſall cuſtome vnknowne ſervice god may eaſily vnlocke againe ſhall vſe key one obſervation viz three common tongue namely hebrew greeke latine although alwayes vulgar language yet knowne language commonly thoſe people vſed divine service one animadverſion fully demonſtrate vnto v truth cauſe denyed three language hebrew greeke latine primitiue age moſt tres hae lingua vniuerſaliſſimae ità ut hebraica per totum fere orientem omnes enim chaldaicâ aut syriacâ hebraicâ ſed corruptè ioquebantur graeca per totam graeciam aſiam minorem olim ac varias provincias latè patebat latina autem per magnam europae partem vagabatur ledeſima ieſ defenſ bellar vniuerſall inſomuch hebrew ſpoken albeit corruptly thorowout almoſt whole eaſterne church greeke currant thorow whole greeke church alſo leſſer aſia latine diſperſed ouer great part europe fully ſufficient know moſt theſe language certainly knowne publike worſhip vnto vſed publike sermon preaching owne church howſoever ſhe decreed praying yet doth ſhe forbid preaching vnknowne tongue therefore ioyne beſeech eye body mind together beholding pondering marginals ſhall finde firſt ſpeake concionatus eſt graecè chryſoſtomus apud antiochenos apud caeſari • nſes baſilius apud alexandrinos athanaſius apud hieroſolymi • ano cyrillus thus conſtantinople antioch throughout aſia greeke language univerſally knowne greeke language generall knowledge thereof even among vulgar people church antioch caeſarea alexandria thorowout aſia secondly latine may behold anciently familiar knowledge thereof church rome whereof st see letter hierome hath teſtified people heard church rome reſounding thundring amen church vnmixt thirdly mixt congregation greeke latine cum eccleſia rom de latinis graecis eſ • et permixta ſingulae • ectiones de utra que lingua recitabantur nam ab una lingua recitantes ab utriuſ que lingua populis intelligi non poterant rupertus de diuin offic l 3 c 8 seruice ſaid greeke latine fourthly owne generall confeſsion yeelding common knowledge latine tongue people great part europe wee ſay alſo africke inſomuch auguſtine doth openly teach auguſtini ſunt plurimi tractatus sermones ad hipponenſes ſuos hee rather choſe ſpeake oſſum o end ſhould underſtand lib retract cap 20 pſalmum qui ijs caneretur per latinas literas feci propter vulgi idiotarum notitiam idem sermon 25 de verb apoſtol punicum proverbium eſt antiquum quod quidem latinè vobis dicam quia punicè non omnes nôſtis well latine knowne vnto item tert ad vxorem ſcripſit latinè ad mulieres de habitu ad foeminas de cultu ad virgines de velo directing ſame writing thus dei servae conſervae sorori meae c cyprianus ſaepe ad martyres plebem latinè latine tongue better knowne africanes punicke although natiue language alſo curabant romani ut provincijs plurimi loquerentur latinè ita ut hiſpanias gallia latinas prorſus fecerint veteribus illarum gentium linguis abolitis vives aug de ci dei l 19 c 7 noſtri per totum • erè occidentem per septentrionis per africae non exiguam partem brevi ſpatio linguam romanam celebrem quaſi regiam fecerunt—noſtra eſt italia noſtra gallia noſtra hiſpania germania pannonia dalmatia illyricum multae aliae nationes valla praeſat l elegant certè teſtimonium ex hilario ductum videtur omninò cogere ut credamus gallia fuiſſe conſuetudinem ut populus eccleſia caneret etiam antè ambroſij tempora bellar l 1 de bonis operibus unto man may learne confeſſions ieſuites others apoſtolus praecip ut preces ad aedificationem fiant quemadmodùm probatur rom 15—plus lucratur quoad intellectum affectum qui non ignorat quae orat—qui non intelligit non aedificatur quantum non intelligit ſpeciali licet generali intelligat—ad fructum devotionis conducibilius intelligendo orare aquinas 1 cor 14 iubet apoſtolus ut ad ae dificationem abundent melius eſt orare mente diſtinctè intelligente ea quae orat quàm confuſè et ex hac doctrina habetur melius eſſe ut publicè preces eccleſiae noſtrae audiente populo lingua clericis populo communi dicantur quàm latin • caietan cardin eum locum 1 cor 14 paulus vult omnes homines orate etiam mente fa • er stapulenſ eundem locum quid proficit populus non intelligendo ea quae orat lyran 1 cor 14 né benedicens sacerdos diceret ego quidem intelligo gratias ago peregri • â linguâ reſponde • apoſtolus sed alter non aedificatur id eſt indè nulla ae dificatio eccleſiae cujus inprimis ratio habenda erat ità ut nolit ullas preces publicas eccleſia celebrari ignoto prorſus sermone—qui non ſit graecis graecus hebraeis hebraeus latinus latinis nam magna ex parte haec idiomata ab ijs qui ſunt babyloniſh confuſion cannot conſent minde affection quomodò dicet amen cum quid boni dicas non intelligit ni • benedicas tantùm aquinas hunc locum 1 cor 14 adde sander de viſib monarch ad ann 1563 si benedixeris ſpiricu quomodò dicat amen significatur de precibus eccleſiaſticis • ateor quas ſpiritu hoc eſt dono lingua peregrinae recitari nollet ut latina eccleſia hebraeam aut graeca perſicam quià deëſſent plerunque viri docti periti illius lingua qui populo interpretari poſſent thus apoſtle granteth prayer uſed people interpretation although hee ſay deus honori • ic entiùs colitur perlinguam doctam quam per indoctam vulgarem though reſpect perſons god yet ſhould reſpect tongue aquinas ſhall ſay amen vnderſtandeth good word thou ſpeakeſt knoweth thou bleſſeſt thus one tranſgreſſion commit double sacrilege wit robbing god due honour men ſpirituall grace comfort conclude theſe premiſes doe prove among many thouſands people aſſembled romane maſſe ignorant service ſuch one miſerable caſe language example italie romane corupted invaſion enemy diver language end became italian c yet publike service altered continued romane argument à facto ad jus one reaſoning à baculo ad angulum like ſome ſhould conclude becauſe stewes allowed rome therefore juſtly licenced wee demand men made language rather language men firſt men bound learne language latter language uſed knowne ſerve beſt edification conſolation god people worſhip sixt challenge doctrine antiquitie although prepoſterous exact v proofe antiquitie condemning service ſtrange tongue ſeeing hath beene confeſſed primitive practice wholly v therefore abuſe thoſe time could occaſion ſuch reproofe yet ſhall better illumination offer unto ſome expreſſe suffrage ancient father wee ſhall ſatisfied obiections pretended make defence saint augustine ſaith people safetie conſiſteth vigour underſtanding ſimplicitie believing indeed doth aug de bap l 6 c 24 multi irruunt preces etiam ab haereticis compoſitas per ignorantiae ſimplicitatem non valentes decernere utuntur ci plerunque precis vitium ſuperat precantis affectus—non quià iſta corrigenda non ſint ut populus ad id quod planè intelligat dicat amen idem de catechizand rudibus c 9 teſte caſſandro liturg pag • 0 • augustine forewarne people although knew ſingle word prayer heretickes yet might poſſibly deluded obſcuritie hereticall sences difference neſciens quid dicitur neſcit finem orationis non reſpondet amen verum ut confirmetur benedictio per ho n qui reſpondent amen impletur confirmatio precis ut omnia dicti veri teſtimonio conf • rmentur mentibus audientium—sed alius non aedifica • ur si igitur ad aedificandam eccleſiam convenitis ca debent dici quae intelligant audientes nam quid prodeſt ut quis lingua loquatur quam ſolus ſcit ideò promiſcuam pleb • intelligit monſtrat que non leue impedimentum eſſe ſi non intelligat omnia ad aedificationem aedificare n architecti eſt opus per omnia proximum juvare—si n aedificandi gratiâ non controuerſie thus whoſoever thou art ſaith obſecro ſi ſi quis ad convivium vocatus manus quidem laverit accubuerit paratuſque diſpoſitus ad menſam fuerit tamen nihil ciborum guſta verit nonne inferet convivatori contumeliam à quo fuerat vocatus nonnè ſatiùs erit ei quitalis eſt omnino non comparuiſſe ità tu quoque qui adveniſti hymnum ceciniſti cum omnibus reliquis ex eorum te numero eſſe qui digni ſunt hoc ipſo confeſſus e quòd non cùm indignis abſceſſiſti quomodò cùm manſeris de menſa iſta non participas indignus e igitur eâ communione quae precibus 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 chryſoſt h • 3 nemo eſt qui participet nullus cui communicetur—quid ſtas ſi è numero e poenitentium—tu tamen hîc interim perſiſtis impudens ex ijs non e ſed inter eos qui poſſint eſſe participes eſpēc de miſſa particulae ſupereſſent mo erat ut puori impuberes qui eccleſiam frequentabant accerſerentur ut ea conſumerent suarez ieſ quo ſuprà diſp 46 sect 6 p 557 cone matiſconenſi advocantur innocentes parvuli poſſunt quià nō utuntur sacramento ut sacramento ſed ut communicibo propter carentiam diſcretionis summa angel p 148 pueris exhibitae ſed ut ſic dicam perfunctoriè ne ut credo corrum perentur primitive age quòd ſi remanſerint craſtinum non ſerventur ſed cùm timore tremore sacrario conſumantur clemens p apud gratian de conſecra 2 pope clement witneſſeth although time extreme perſecution antiquitie secondly pleaſe reveile unto u firſt birth owne romane custome grant untill hiſt mediolan anno 1404 circumferri coeptum c quàm proceſſionem tantâ laetitiâ conſenſione ac laetâ ſolennitate proſecuta eſt latina eccleſia nam de graeca nihil mihi conſtat eſpenc de euch c 8 p 47 may adde extat ſuch circumgeſtation greeke church thouſand foure hundred yeares chriſt muſt called laudable cuſtome whereby may ſo ſpeake beardleſſe noveltie doth take place ſage grayheaded antiquitie thirdly diſcuſſing end deſtinated saviour chriſt grant primarius finis ſervandi euchariſtiam ſemper fuit manducatio ſervatur enim ad viaticum infirmorum bellar l 4 de euch c 5 § deinde sacramentum per ſe eſt dandum propter ſuum primarium effectum non aliâs suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 62 sect 4 § secunda sent primitive principall end preſcribed chriſt sacramentall eating sacrament given primary effect yet notwithſtanding bring pompous oſtentation noteating call laudable cuſtome argueth little congruitie betweene practice chriſts inſtitution much leſſe laudable appeare conſider groſſe intollerable abuſes proceſsions diſplayed owne authours noting foolery ità romani factitabant aliae pleraeque gens à quibus ad no proculdubiò ritus hujuſmodi manavit—nam supplicationum noſtrarum pompas ſolent ludicra quaedam praecedere ubi effigy aliqua magnis mali de hiſcens dentibuſque ſonitum faciens aliae circumgeſtationis uſus etiam cùm ecccleſiae lucro omitti poſſe cùm ſic recens diu abſque ea circumgeſtatione sacramē ſuus honos conſtiterit plerunque non devotioni ſed pompae oſtentationi inſervit itaque vir ſummi iudicij albertus crantziuslaudat nic cuſanum legatum per germaniam quòd abuſum eius nimis frequenti per ſingulas feria circumgeſtatione ſuſtulerit conſtituerit quòd niſi infra tempus feſti sacramento dedicati publicum non deferetur quia inquit eius sacramentum inſtitutum eſt ad uſum non ad oſtentationem caſſand conſult art 22 tit de circumgeſtatione pag 174 thinking may omitted innocent 1 rom pont epiſt 93 ad conc milevet con pelag reſpondebat quòd parvulos aeternae vitae praemijs etiam ſine baptiſmatis gratia poſſe donari perfatuum eſt niſi 〈◊〉 manducaverint carnem filij hominis non habebunt vitam ſeme • ipſis qui autem hanc el ſine regeneratione defendunt videntur etiam mihi baptiſmū caſſare velle cùm praedicant no habere quod eos creditur non niſi baptiſmate conferendum whence eſpencaeus thus mirum ejus temporis pontifex ex euchariſtiae neceſſitate baptiſmi ejus praecurſoris urgere neceſſitatem niſi idem ex eodem tùm loco tùm innocentij argumento authoritate aduerſus eoſdem hoſtes urgeret auguſt epiſt 106 con pelag—contra apoſtolicae ſedis authoritatem ubi de hac ipſâ cùm ageretur hoc teſtimonium exhibitum eſt evangelicum nè parvuli non baptizati vitam poſſe habere credantur si autem cedunt sedi apoſtolicae vel potiùs ipſi magiſtro domino apoſtolorum qui dicit non vitam habituros niſi manducaverint biberint c eſpen de adorat euch l 2 c 12 pag 58 afterwards hee bringeth many teſtimonies auguſtine ibid pag 59 proveth retract opinion ejus haud dubiè ſunt contra iulianum libri quo valentiorem habuit aduerſarium neminem quem etiam ſcribendo mortuus eſt ac proindè ſententiam non retractâſſe videtur quibus iulianum obruit maiorum praeiudicio ab innocent • rom pont exorius qui parvulos ait definivit niſi mandacaverint carnem filij hominis vitam prorſus habere non poſſe eſpen ibid little ſheweth looſnes aquinas solution albeit auguſtine conſtant opinion may gathered bede collectanies 1 cor 10 nulli aliquatenùs dubitandum c although childe doe participate yet baptiſme made partaker ſignifieth eſpencaeus alſo proveth large expreſſe writing pope innocent yea greatly approved binius volume councels dedicated pope paul fift binius tom 1 conc ex reſcriptis innocentij papae ad conc milevit epiſt 25 illud vero c hinc binius hinc conſtat innocentij ſententia quae 600 circiter annos viguit eccleſia quam que auguſtinus ſecutus euchariſtiam infantibus neceſſariam fuiſſe conc trid rectè decrevit eam non ſolûm non neceſſariam infantibus ſed nè quidem decere ut eis diſtribuatur—quidam viri non vulgariter docti exiſtimârunt innocentium hunclocum niſi manducaveritis c baptiſmi ſumptione interpretari sed decepti ſunt quòd vim argumenti quo pontifex utitur non ſunt aſſecuti ille n ut pelagium qui docebat baptiſmum infantibus parente fideli prognatis peccatum originale non contrahentibus neceſſarium non eſſe convinceret hāc ratiocinatione eſt vſus quibus neceſſaria eſt euchariſtiae ſumptio ijſdem baptiſmi ſumptio magi eſt neceſſaria infantibus omnibus eſſe neceſſariam euchariſtiae ſumptionem probatur per verba iohannis niſi manducaveritis c quae expoſitio praxi eccleſiae nunc repugnat de auguſtini contrary opinion concerning romane maſſe day euen day alſo ieſuite haue v vnderſtand meaning church non quòd infantes ſunt incapaces huius sacramenti • ſed quià hoc nunc magi expedit ad decentiam reverentiam quae aliquali vtilitati parvulorum praeferenda eſt suarez tom 3 diſt 61 sect 3 § quocirca infant capable sacrament eucharist challenge vvhereunto wee oppoſe authority conc carthag 3 euchariſtiam catechumenis mortuis dari prohibet conſequenter pueris qui utri que ſunt divini illius cibi incapaces ut quidam ratiocinantur quià tale non poſſint accipere nec comedere—et lateranenſ conc ſub innoc 3 praecipit ut tantùm cùm ad annos diſcretionis pervenerint euchariſtiam accipiant—quià verò propria ſpiritualis manducatio bibitio eſt ſine qua sacramentalis non prodeſt fruſtrà pueris sacramentum cùm periculo porrigeretur—non igitur ſatis eſt quòd puer poſſit naturaliter edere quia hoc poſſit trinus quatrimus praeſtare ſed opus eſt ut poſſit sacramentaliter edere 1 cognoſcere ibi circa conſecrandum ſacrificandum tamen apoſtolꝰ 1 cor 11 refert quóque ad ſumptionem ſive laicorum ſive sacerdorum quod cyrillus facit ioh l 1 • c 58 et baſil moral reg 21 c 〈◊〉 ut hoc facite pertineat ad totam actionem euchariſtiam à chriſto factam tàm à preſbyteris quàm à plebe poſteà faciendam eodemque verbo imprimis poteſtas conſecrandi offerendi deinde etiam mandatum ſumendi tàm sacerdotibus quàm alijs fidelibus detur cum utrumque ſuo modo licet prius exactius sacrificium quàm ſumptio memoriam mortis dominicae contineat alan l 2 de eucha cap 37 p 646 doth ſticke tell ancient father command doe declared saint luke applyed saint paul receiving kind aſwell people prieſt virtue ſame command chriſt greeke church hath alwayes obſerved uſe kind unto day hee juſtifying contrary conſequence euen alſo laici adulti tenentur ex inſtitutione chriſti communicare iure divino hoc thomas probat ex luc 22 hoc facite commemorationem mei quae habent vim praecepti non tantùm de celebrando ait scotus ſed etiam de adminiſtrando sacramentum populo coſmus phil de offic sacerdot tom 1 de sacrif miſſae lib 2 c 2 coſmus philiarchus defendeth confirmeth ſame aquinas scotus two moſt eminent doctor church holding laicks chargible celebrate euchariſt virtue command chriſt ſame word inſtitution doe ſecond evaſion next although nec quicquam valetquod obijcitur similitèr calicem quià non dicit similiter calicem dedit ſed ſolùm accepit bellar ibid § nec quicquam ſay ſaid like manner chriſt tooke cup namely tooke bread yet word similitèr likewiſe hath relation taking giving challenge flatly repugnant goſpell chriſt theſe word saint luke 22 20 luke likewiſe tooke cup appeare saint matth 26 27 matthew relation aſwell chriſts giuing taking cup thus ieſus tooke cup gave thankes gave vnto ſaying drinke yea saint luke text obiected ſo cleare needeth comment tooke bread gave thankes gave unto ſaying c likewiſe cup precedent word expreſſing chriſt act tooke gave cup ſhould ſeeke comment upon theſe word hee could find none direct learned aria montanus b ianſenius like manner ſaith similiter calicem id eſt qualia fecit circa panem talia circa calicem accepit gratias egit dividendum dedit atque praecepit ut biberent ab co omnes quae omnia lucas complexus eſt dicens similitèr calicem ianſen epiſc concord cap 131 pag 905 similitèr calicem poſtquàm coenavit c id eſt accepit porrexit omnibus dicens hic eſt calix c ari •… montan 1 cor 11 25 bread ſo cup tooke gave thankes gave unto drinke saint luke comprized theſe word like manner tooke cup third evaſion although ſaid drinking cup doe remembrance mee yet word doe ſay pòſt panis conſecrationem abſolutè ponitur hoc facite pòſt calicem verò idem repetitur ſed cum conditione hoc inquit facite quotieſcunque bibetis c certè non ſine cauſa spiritus sanctus modum loquendi mutavit ſignificans non ut calix debeat dari neceſſariò ſed modum praeſcribens ut id fiat ad memoriam dominicae paſſionis bellar quo ſup cap 25 § iam ſpoken abſolutely bread conditionally cup namely often ſhall drinke vpon conceit doe two ieſuites raiſe inſultation mirabilis eſt dei providentia ſanctis literis nam ut non haberent haeretici juſtam excuſationem ſuſtulit eis omnem • ergiverſandi occaſionem nam lucas hoc facite poſuit pòſt datum sacramentum ſub ſpecie panis poſt datum autem calicem non repetivit ut intelligeremus dominum juſſiſſe ut ſub ſpecie panis omnibus diſtriburetur ſub ſpecie autem vini non item bellar quo ſup c 25 § reſp mirabilis singularis dei providentia ut intelligamus minimè expedire ut ſinguli fideles ſub utraque ſpecie communicent valent ieſ tract de euch c 2 § et certè p 483 ſaying behold wonderfull providence god whereby taken heretikes colour excuſe u proteſtants challenge anſwere concluſions owne doctor aſwell new old schooles praecepit igitur chriſtus verbis lucae ut ipſâ ſumptione commemoremꝰ paſſionem cius non tantùm ut quoties illud ſumeremus paſſionem ipſius memoriam revocaremus ac proindè praecepit ut opere aliquo commemoratio fiat alicujus beneficii accepti ex modo ipſo praecipiendi praecepit etiam ut fiat opus ipſum quis hoc non videat vaſquez ieſ 3 thom diſp 113 cap 2 verò non eſt negandum eſſe praeceptum ſimplicitèr faciendum alioquin non haberemus fundamentum praecepti celebrandi eccleſia soto 4 dist 12 q 1 art 12 ieſuite vaſquez new judgement antiquity cyprian con aquarios epiſt 63 admonitos no ſcias ut calice offerendo traditio obſervetur neque aliquid fiat à nobis quàm quod pro nobis dominus prior fecerit ſomewhat divino magiſterio non recedamus cyprian confuteth aquarij heretikes uſed water chalice example chriſt inſtitution becauſe nothing done u celebrating myſtery done christ dayes pope iulius anno 337 aroſe many giddie ſpirits violated holy inſtitution chriſt sacrament ſome conſecrated milke inſtead wine others ſopped bread cup third ſort ſquiezed grape thereinto theſe like holy pope condemne pretence cuſtome obligation chriſt example inſtitution sacrament theſe word following julius p apud gratian de conſecrat ca cum omne audivimus quoſdam schiſmaticâ ambitione detentos contra divinos ordines apoſtolicas inſtitutiones lac provino divinis officijs dedicare alios intinctam euchariſtiam populo pro complemento communionis porrigere quoſdam etiam expreſſum vinum sacramento dominici calicis afferre alijs verò pannum lineum muſto intinctum per totum annum reſervare tempore sacrificij partem eius aquâlavare ſic offerre quod cùm ſit evangelicae apoſtolicae doctrinae contrarium conſuetudini eccleſiaſticae adverſum non difficilè ab ipſo fonte veritatis probatur à quo ordinata ipſa sacramentorum myſteria proceſſerunt cùm onim magiſter veritatis verum ſalutis noſtrae sacrificium ſuis commendaret diſcipulis nulli lac ſed panem tantùm calicem ſub hoc sacramento noſcimus dediſſe legitur enim evangelica veritate accepit ieſus panem calicem benedicens dixit diſcipulis ſuis ceſſet igitur lac ſacrificando offerri quià manifeſtum evidens veritatis exemplum illuxit quià praeter panem vinum aliud offerri non licet illud verò quod pro complemento communionis intinctam euchariſtiam tradunt populis nec hoc prolatum ex evangelio teſtimonium receperunt ubi corpus ſuum apoſtolis commendaret ſanguinem ſcorſim enim panis ſeorſim calicis commendatio memoratur becauſe theſe contrary ſaith evangelicall apoſtolicall doctrine eccleſiaſticall cuſtome eaſily proved fountaine truth whence sacrament firſt ordinance maſter truth commended diſciples gave none milke bread cup doth goſpell mention ſopping bread giving bread apart cup alſo apart c pope iulius thoſe alſo offered bread cheeſe together sacrament confuted inſtitution chriſt appointed bread ſaith artotyritae panē caſeum offerunt qui excluduntur per hoc quòd chriſtus hoc sacramentum inſtituit pane aquinas part 3 quaeſt 24 art 1 aquinas direct abſolute yet dare men obiect contrarie romiſh obiection anſwered emmaus luke 24 chriſt meeting certaine diſciples taking bread bleſſing thereby manifeſting himſelfe ſaid immediately breaking bread vaniſhed ſights ergò may lawfull ſaith ex luc 24 30 vbi chriſtus apparens duobus diſcipulis emmaus accumbens accepit panem benedixit dedit eis quo facto aperti ſunt oculus eorum evanuit ex oculis c hence doth bellarmine conclude thus oſtendi • hoc exemplum quòd minimè exiſtimandum ieſuite reſpondendum eſt eam actionem eſſe illis ipſis imperatam per illa verba hoc facite hoc ipſo enim quod juſſi ſunt conſecrare ſub ſpecie panis conſequenter intelligi debet eos juſſos eſſe conſecrare ſub ſpecie vini nam hoc exigit neceſſariò natura sacrificij sacramenti ſi enim una ſpecies abſque altera conficiatur ſacrilegium committitur quamobrem conc trident abſolute dicitur sacerdotes juſſos eſſe offerre utramque ſpeciem illis verbis hoc facire commemorationem meam quae forma verborum ſolùm uſurpata fuit à chriſto circa panem valent ieſ de uſu euchariſt c 3 § antiquitie vniverſalitie thereof sect v wee ſhall ſay thing ſelues primitive cuſtome vſing kindes adminiſtration sacrament extent thereof longitude continuance latitude vniverſalitie ready heare farre owne doctor yeeld vnto v theſe point touching publike vſe kindes hearken vnto marginals ſhall finde ieſuites others vttering theſe voyces olim per multa ſecula ſub utra que ſpecie porrigibatur laicis ut ex multorum sanctorum ſcriptis didicimus alfonſ à caſtro hac ipſa controverſia pag 158 vſus utriuſ que ſpecici à primitiva eccleſia comprobatus fuit poſteriori etiam eccleſia multi latini occidentales illum retinuerunt graeci quo que hodiè orientales licitè ſanctè quod ad ipſum ritum attinet cum obſervant salmeron jeſ tom 9 tract 37 pag 308 minimè negamus quin utra que ſpecies frequentiſſimè olim etiam adminiſtrata fuerit utapparet ex paulo athanaſio cyprian hier leone hiſt tripart ex greg paſſim ex alijs veterum teſtimonijs item que ex thoma qui etiam ſuo tempore aliquibus eccleſijs adminiſtratum calicem fuiſſe ſignificat valent ieſ de uſu euch cap 8 § alioqui pag 496 ingenuè tamen apertè confitemur morem generalem extitiſſe communicandi etiam laicis ſub utra que ſpecie ſicut hodiè fit apud graecos olim erat poſitum apud corinthios africa dequo loquitur cyprian athanaſ dionyſ etiam probatur ex eccleſia latina que hunc uſum erant olim calices miniſteriales paterae ad differentiam calicum paterarum quibus sacerdotes offerebant salmeron quo ſup tract 35 § ingenuè p 294 b gregorius sexcenta huiuſmodi proferri poſſent—vſus utriuſ que ſpeciei à chriſto apoſtolis à primitiva eccleſia qui illum uſurpârunt comprobatus fuit poſteriori etiam eccleſia multi latini occidentales illum retinuerunt graeci quo que hodiè salmeron ib tract 37 § deinde satis compertum eſt
