yeares inhibiting either prieſt laick communicating kindes duly prepared receive sacrament example vſually obiect force ob conſuetudinem euchariſtiam domum deferendi c sol reaſon perſecution paucitie miniſters afterwards aboliſhed church miniſtration thereof infant ob communio olim laicis data poenam gravis delicti bellar l 4 de euch cap 24 sol puniſhment laicks communion could ſignifie partaking one kinde confuted durant lib 2 de ritib cap 55 nonnulli crediderunt laicam communionem appellatam quòd ſub unica ſpecie etiam clerici imò sacerdotes ipſi non conficientes communicant nunc ſub una ſpecie quare verius eſt laicam communionem dictam quia extra ſacratiorem locum ubi sacrificium fit ubi sacerdos conficiens tùm miniſtri communicabant pamelius cyprian epiſt 152 laicum communicare nihil aliud eſt quam inter laicos e extrâ cancellos—hoc eſt extra chorum ut hodie loquimur lorinus ieſ act 2 reverà diſtinctio non ſpecie utra que una eſſe videtur quoniam utra que ſpecies concedebatur nempe laicis ſed deſtinato loco ſeparato p • clericis two puniſhments prieſts anciently 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 privari clericatus honore 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 excommunicari ob ritus erat ut communio praeſanctificatorum eſſet ſub una ſpecie die paraſcevis corpus ſine ſpecie ſanguinis sol word ſelfe plurall 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 praeſanctificata confuteth obiection ſo doe lyturgies proved either private illegitimate falſe reſpectively hitherto primitive cuſtome notwithſtanding romane church boaſt contrary cuſtome aftertimes telling v councels cuſtome adminiſtring euchariſt one kinde rightly obſerved cuſtome hath beene diutiſſimè obſervata moſt long continuance many yeares paſſed ſaith conc conſtant de uſu unius ſpeciei cum huiuſmodi conſuetudo ab eccleſia ſanctis patribus rationabiliter introducta hactenús diutiſſime obſervata ſit habenda eſt pro lege eodem modo conc baſil penè eiſdem verbis deinde latam legem quamplurimis retrò annis conſuetudo iucundiſſima effecerat gaſp cardillus apud act conc trident p 220 222 223 villalpandius moſt preciſely ieſuite secundum certum eſt eccleſiam praeſentem quae illam praeceſſit per trecentos aut ducentos annos laicos ſub altera ſpecie multis eccleſijs communicare conſueviſſe ut docet thomas ioh verbis secundùm antiquae eccleſiae conſuetudinem omnes ſicut communicabant corpore ità ſanguine quod etiam adhuc quibuſdam compertum eſt univerſalem chriſti eccl • ſiam hunc uſque diem occidētalem autem ſeti romanam mille amplius à chriſto annis ſolenni praeſe • tim ordinaria huius sacramenti diſpenſatione utramque panis vini ſpeciem omnibus chriſti membris exhibuiſſe—atque uti • à facerent inductos fuiſſe primo inſtituto exemploque chriſti qui hoc sacramentū corporis ſanguinis ſui duobus hiſce panis vini ſymbolis diſcipulis ſuis fidelium communicantium perſonam repraeſentantibus praebuit tum quià sacramento ſanguinis peculiarem quādam virtut • gratiam hoc viniſymbolo ſignificatam eſſe credebant tūm ob rationes myſti • huius inſtituti quae à veteribus variè adducuntur viz ad repraeſentandam memoriam paſſionis chriſti oblatione corporis ſanguinis effuſione iuxta illud pauli quotieſcunque comederitis panem hunc calicem domini biberitis morrem domini annunciatis donec venerit item ad ſignificand • integram refectionem ſive nutritionem quae • igbo potu conſtat quomodò chriſtus inquit caro mea verus eſt cibus ſanguis meus verus eſt po • u item ad deſign • ndam redemptionem tuitionem corporis animae ut corpus pro ſalute corporis ſanguis pro ſalute animae quae ſanguine eſt dari intelligatur ad ſignificandum quoque chriſtum utramque naturam aſſumpſiſſe corporis animae ut utramque redimeret caſſand conſult art 2 • pag 166 167—chriſtus licet totus ſub una ſpecie tamen adminiſtrari • oluit ſub duplici primò ut totam naturam aſſumpſiſſe ſe oſtenderet ut utramque redimeret panis enim ad corpus refertur vinum ad anima • —si altera tantùm ſumer • tur—tum mortem ſuam ad alterius ſalutem valere magna penuria valent ibid salmeron jeſ tom 9 tract 34 § ad quintum pag 279 roffenſ like manner bellar alſo addeth another reaſon movit eccleſiam uniformitas ut concordia populi chriſtiani sacramento hoc percipiendo quod eſt sacramentum pacis unitatis propter eos apud quos vinum inveniri non poteſt ut ſunt aliquae provinciae boreales ubi vinum non invenitur qui exiſtimarent ſe chriſto curae non fuiſſe aut non ità ut alias provincias quandò sacramentum inſtituit lib 4 de euch cap 28 many northerne country deſtitute wine therefore one kinde uſed concord vniformityſake anſwered ſelves aquinas tertio loco obijciunt eccleſiae ſapientiam antiquitatem atque poteſtatem aiunt enim eccleſiam primitivam quae antiquior ſcientiâ atquè vitae ſanctitate praeſtantior erat utráque ſpecie uſam fu • ſſe noſtra igitur illam imitari debet praeſertim cū eandem atque illa habet poteſtatem eiuſmodi legibus poſitivis ſiuè abrogandis ſiuè diſpenſandis reſpondemus non eſſe dubium quin eccleſia primitiva noſtrae maiore charitate ac proindè uberiori ſapientia praecelluerit nihilominus tamen interdum cō tingit minus ſapientem aliquo meliùs ſapere quàm al •• abſolutè ſapientiorem saepe etiam accidit minùs p •• fectum hominem vitare aliquem errorē quem melior non vitat salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 38 § tertio loco p 320 although primitive church ſay exceed zeale wiſdome charity nevertheleſſe falleth ſometimes wiſer may ſome thing leſſe wiſe another anſwere conſider many reaſons heard father give uſe kind conſonant practice thereof vilifying authority ancient father indeed ſaying put upon foole like anſwere two ieſuites made practice apoſtles ſaying church ſame ſpirit hath ſame power alter custome whereas wee proved ground apoſtles lay cuſtome inſtitution chriſt romane church alleageth meerely pretence plenitude owne authoritie impoſſible therefore ſo great contradiction ſhould ſame spirit intollerable arrogancie romane ſpirit bewrayeth theſe thirdly vpon conſideration contempt apoſtolicall primitive antiquity cauſe wee finde romiſh prieſts condemned manifeſt perjurie alſo forme oath profeſsion romiſh faith every prieſt eccleſiaſticke ſworne forma iuramenti per bullam pij quarti apoſtolicas eccleſiaſticas traditiones admitto—ego ſpond eo juro c admit apoſtolicall eccleſiaſticall tradition alſo hold coetera omnia à concilio tr • dent declarata confirmata firmiſſimè • eneo ibid romanam eccleſiam magiſtram eſſe ecclefiar u •… c councell trent hath decreed cuſtome adminiſtration kindes hath beene acknowledged apoſtolicall cuſtome alſo remayned eccleſiaſticall profeſſion practice thorowout thouſand yeares ſpace church rome notwithſtanding councell trent whereunto likewiſe ſworne hath altered perverted doth evidently involve prieſts ieſuites notorious unavoydable perjury fourthly note fooliſhneſſe mad folly ſeene take upon ſerious defence cuſtome ſatisfaction others yet ſo unſatisfied among themſelves ſo obiections urged proteſtants againſt abuſe fortified alſo reaſons refuted either direct teſtimonies owne doctor common principle tenents church elſe abſurdities conſequences iſſuing reaſons anſweres diver leſſe groſſe objecting antiquity generality particular romane church leſſe three hundred yeares preferre confeſſed vniverſall primitive cuſtome compaſſe thouſand yeares continuance fiftly laſt note blaſphemy name contempt chriſt laſt teſtament muſt need deſerve greater contempt contrary chriſt doe concerning kind profeſſe sacrilegious diſmembring holy sacrament gelaſius pope himſelfe anciently condemned blaſphemous enough ſuppoſing chriſt indeed commanded conſecration kindes upon divine right yet notwithſtanding hold probable ſaith ieſuite licet gabriel quidam alij ſentiant divini juris eſſe ut sacerdos utraque ſpecie ſacrificet nihilominùs tamen opinantur authoritate rom pontificis fieri poſſe ut una tantùm ſpecie ſacrificet viz conſecratione panis fine vino quià putant multa eſſe juris divini quae remittere relaxare pótifex queat ob publicam aliquam gravem neceſſitatem ut videmus votum iuſiurandū matrimonium ratum nō conſummatū authoritate pontificis relaxari diſſolvi et ità hac quaeſtione prima puto probabilius verius eſſe ut dixi iuris eſſe divini ut sacerdos duplici ſpecie ſacrificet et nihilominùs exiſtimo valdè probabile authoritate pontificiâ ob publicam urgentem neceſſitatem praedictum jus divinum relaxari poſſe sed▪ quià nunquàm eſt relaxatum ego confilium darem ut nunquam relaxaretur azorius ieſ tom 1 instit moral lib 10 cap 19 § tertium pag 857 azorius authority pope may diſpenſe therewith becauſe divine right never yet diſpenſed 1 ſaith hee would give counſell never may ieſuite thus deale chriſt command ieſuite made bold pope doth chriſt himſelfe ſaying unto decree holy father may diſpenſed ieſuite societie yet becauſe ieſuite hath taken upon hitherto ſo much counſell none decree euer diſpenſed withall pope wee ſuppoſe albeit would thanke man counſell ſo yet doubtleſſe would hee reward welcome office holy inquiſition judgement thinke lawfull ſo doe namely leave diſcretion every ieſuite diſpenſe papall decree notwithſtanding ieſuites suppoſe wee may depoſe romiſh licence one kinde diſpenſing rather deſpiſing ordinance chriſt wee already wearied citing manifold vilde odious irreligious poſitions diſputers proctor cauſe yet one pretence may pretermitted leaſt might ſeeme contemne wit zeale ieſuite salmeron againſt uſe sacrament kindes uſe kind ſaith diſpenſandus non eſt utriuſque ſpeciei uſus haereticis quia non ſunt dā da ſancta canibus nec anſwere ſaying theſe word moſt evidently relate chriſts body evidently ſaith alſo ieſuite malloun late reply againſt doctour vſher pag 204 malloun one pointing booke ſhould ſay booke challenge theſe opinators number many name moſt part great eſteeme aſſertion opinion full aſſurance delivered hearer onely catholique reſolution yet behold one whoſe name alone hath obtained authority equivalent almoſt cardinall argumentum eorum qui volunt pronomen hoc demonſtrare corpus eſt abſurdum quod huiuſ modi propoſitionibus quae ſignificant id quod tunc fit cum dicitur pronomina demonſtrativa non demonſtrate quod eſt ſed quod erit et ponunt exempla ut ſi quis dum pingit lineam aut circulum dicat haec eſt linea hic eſt circulus quomodo etiam exponi debet pronomen illis verbis domini ioh 15 hoc eſt praeceptum meum—haec explicatio non videtur ſatisfacere propter duas cauſas primò quià etſi pronomen demonſtrativum demonſtrer rem futuram quandò nihil eſt praeſens quod demonſtretur ut exemplis allatis tamen ſi quis digito aliquid oſtendat dum pronomen effert valdè abſurdum videtur dicere pronomine illo non demonſtrari rem praeſentem atqui dominus accepit panem illum porrigens ait accipite edite h e c videtur igitur demonſtraſſe panem neque obſtat quod propoſitio non ſignificat niſi ſine totius prolationis nam etſi ità eſt de propoſitione quae eſt ratio quaedam tamen demonſtratiua pronomina mox indicant certum aliquid etiam antequam ſequantur coeterae vox et ſane illis verbis bibite ex hoc omnes valdè durum eſt non demonſtrari id quod erat ſed id tantùm quod futurum erat secundò ſi pronomen hoc demonſtrat ſolùm corpus verba ſpeculativa erunt non practica bellar lib 1 de euch cap 11 § nota ſecundò bellarmine ſpeaking ſame opinion referring word body christ doth flat tearmes call absvrd without good ſolid reaſon according principle romiſh schooles wit becauſe laſt ſyllable laſt word meum pronounced body chriſt yet preſent word cannot demonſtrate thing abſent vſurpavit ut math 26 apud te facio paſcha cum dicipulis • id eſt confeſtian facio paſcha salmerō ieſ • om 9 tran 13 § secunda—si eſt proptie accipiatur pro exiſtere durum eſt ut vniat ſubiectum cum praedicato pro futuro tempore quià falſa eſſer propoſitio non ſolùm orationibus ſpeculativis ſignificativis ſed etiam practicis factivis ut ſi quis volens facere circulum rogatus quid eſt hoc coſtâ dicere potuit haec eſt mulier quamuis cum pronunciaſſet pronomen haec nondùm fuiſſet mulier ac ſignificaſſet cùm ità locutus fuiſſet limūnon eſſe hominem coſtam mulierem ſed limum hominem ut corpus chriſti ſit corpus chriſti quià ità ſemper ſuit nec ut panis ſit corpus chriſti id enim fieri nequit ſed efficitur ut ſub ſpeciebus illis ſit corpus chriſti ſub quibus anteà etat panis hoc non demonſtrat panem vel corpus ſed contentum ſub ſpeciebus bell l 1 de euch c 11 § eſt igitur bellarmine ieſuites doctor church b sixteene number ſufficient concluſive reſolution point touching proper expoſition word chriſt concerning pronoune challenge vvhich subtilty notwithſtanding diſcuſſed diſcloſed exploded learned archiepiſc caeſar ſivè chriſtopherus de capite fontium var trac demonſtrando corpus genere neſcio quid—dictum velis cū non individua generibus ſuis ſed genus individuis demonſtrentur pronominis natura eſt ſola ſingularia demonſtrare—ideò ſi generi addas pronomen hoc demonſtras non genere ſed individuo rem ipſam—conceptus communis non latet ſub ſpeciebus nec manibus portari poteſt—propoſitio vera dicitur ex eo quod re eſt vera velnon eſt vera ergò non verborum diſpoſitio conſideranda venit—rapiunt iſti à rerum conſideratione lectorem ut non re ipſas ſed intelligibiles formas loquendi contempletur—quibus dixerim revertiminiad iudicium ô viri duas tantum re corpus ſc panem conſiderate quarum alterum tantùm demonſtrari neceſſe eſt quià pronomen vice nominis proprij poſitum proſolo ſingulari ſumi poteſt cum scriptura duarum tantùm ſubſtantiarum quae demonſtrari hîc queant meminerit viz panis corporis neſcio cur fingunt tertiam aliquam quae nec panis ſit nec corpus quo magnam vim scripturae faciunt infarcientesilli ex ſuo cerebro tertiam illam rem cujus nullam habent mentionem quâ poſitâ propoſitio eſſet fal • archiep caeſar quo ſupra p 12 si enim chriſtus ità loqueretur de pane ante illius tranſubſtantiationem mentiretur—non enim haec dici poſſunt de pan • conſecrando quod ſit corpus chriſti ibid p 17 solam illam ſubſtantiam ſingularem demonſtrabat quae erat chriſti manibus quae erat aut panis aut corpus ejus tertiam igitur quaerere vaniſſimus labor eſt abſurditate plenus thus farre archbiſhop archbiſhop ceſarea ieſuite vulgata opinio eſt illud pronomen hoc ne que demonſtrare corpus chriſti ne que panem ſed accipi vagè pro eo quod continetur ſub accidentibus quod priùs eſt panis deinde corpus chriſti quae ſententia non videtur mihi probabilis eſſe quià etſi vocabula ſolent aliquandò habere vagam indefinitam ſignificationem tamen aliud eſt loqui de ſignificatione verbi aliud de acceptione quam dialectici vocant ſuppoſitionem illa quae dicuntur individua vaga ſignificationem habent vagam indeterminatam ſed ſuppoſitionem habent ſemper certam determinatam nam etſi hoc pronomen hic haec hoc quantum ſe eſt non magi ſignificat hunc hominem quam illum tamen cum ponitur propoſitione ut hic homo diſputat non poteſt accipi niſi determinatè pro hoc homine ergo neceſſe eſt ut illud pronomen hoc accipiatur determinatè autpro pane aut pro corpore chriſti—nulla re poteſt eſſe niſi determinate aut haec aut illa ergò non poſſunt haec pronomina ſi ſubſtantiuè accipiantur niſi pro hac vel illâ determinata accipi maldon ieſ de sacram euch tom 1 § tertius error pag 216 217 maldonate opinion falſe full abſurdities 1 chriſtus ſemenerat verbū dei ego ſum oſtium verbum ſubſtantivum ſit interpretandum pro ſignificat aut figurat non ei id accidit ex naturâ ſuâ aut per ſe ſed quoniam petra illa aliter cum chriſto corpus chriſti frangitur quia ipſi modi qui ſignificantur verbis non conveniunt corpori chriſti sacramentalis locuti • eſſet ſi corpus chriſti dicer • tur frangi aut dentibus teri haec enim non poſſint niſi sacramento tenus intelligi quia non propriè corpus chriſti frangitur ſed sacramentum mald ieſ de sacram gener tom 1 § quapropter p 144 com matth 26 frangi cum dicitur eſt metaphorica graecus textus effunditur non eſt negandum morem eſſe scripturae eam dicere jam eſſe quae futuraſit ut hîc effunditur quià paulò poſt crace effundendus salmer ieſ 1 cor 11 p 154 salmeron manner scripture ſpeake thing done done place ſhed becauſe ſhortly ſhed upon croſſe figure enallage againe cup new teſtament bloud hearken hic calix eſt novum teſtamentū non poteſt accipi proprio ſenſu ſed eo quem clariora verba matthaei marci indicant exigunt sivê enim calix fumatur pro poculo potorio fivè synecdochicè pro ſanguine poculo contento non poteſt conſiſtere ut ijs verbis ſit propria locutio—nemo enim dixerit propriâ locutione vaſculum illud potorium fuiſſe teſtamentū novum cum incertum ſit adhuc extet illud poculum novum teſtamentum eſt aeternum ſed nec • ſanguis calice contentus poteſt eſſe novum teſtamentum quià lex evangelica epiſt ad hebr dicitur novum teſtamētum apud matthaeum marcum ſanguis dicitur novi teſtamenti vnicum eſt novum teſtamentum ergo non eſt novum teſtamentum ianſen conc cum locum pag 910 biſhop theſe word cannot taken properly whether cup taken veſſell uſed drinking temporall thing therefore could testament chriſt eternall elſe whether take matter within cup figure synecdoche blood new teſtament could properly teſtament ſelfe yea ieſuite salmeron pointeth ſame word double figure subeſt duplex meronymia 1 quia continens ponitur pro contento id eſt poculum ſiue calix provino eò quòd vinum ipſo continetur 2 eſt eò quòd contentum poculo foedus vel teſtam entum dicitur novum cum ſit eius ſymbolum propter ſpecies—teſtamentum hoc loco poteſt ſumi prolege evangelicâ quae veteri legi opponitur vel vtrem teſtamento legatam teſtatamuè ſignificet quemadmodum haeres dicere ſolet hic fundus eſt teſtamentum patris mei id eſt port • sanguis chriſti à sacramentum fidei fides eſt—sicut de ipſo baptiſmo ait conſepulti ſumus per baptiſmum mortem chriſti non dicit ſepulturam ſignificamus ſed prorſus ait conſepulti ſumus sacramentum igitur tantae rei non niſi eiuſdem rei vocabulo nuncupavit interpreting called fidei sacramentum ſaith reſpondetur parvulum baptizatum credere propter fidei sacramentum saint auguſtine many place may unto v inſtar multorum eate fleſh chriſt ſaith figurative ſpeech againe banquet chriſt gave diſciples ſigne body yet againe chriſt doubted ſay body gave ſigne body laſtly unanſwerably proving sacrament agree point herein euchariſt hath prerogative reſt sacrament ſaith similitude likeneſſe thing whereof sacrament doe often take name thoſe thing doe ſignifie sacrament chriſts body ſaith certaine manner called body chriſt hee addeth hee meant ſtop mouthes oppoſites ſaid apostle baptiſme buried baptiſme death chriſt ſaith wee ſignifie buriall abſolutely ſaith wee buried therefore hath called sacrament signe ſo great thing name thing ſignified thereby even ſame found like himſelfe following paſſages booke eſpecially ſhall handle manner eating christ body auguſtine afterwards chap 3 § 6 challenge figuratively meant ſhall take farewell latine father teſtimony biſhop iſid hiſpalen panis quem frangimus corpus chriſti eſt qui dicit ego ſum panis vivus c vinum autem ſanguis eius eſt hoc eſt quod ſcriptum eſt ego ſum vitis vera sed panis quia confirmat corpus ideò corpus chriſti nuncupatur vinum autem quià ſanguinem operatur carne ideò ad ſanguinem chriſti refertur—haec autem ſunt viſibilia ſanctificata tamen per spiritum sanctum sacramentum divini corporis tranſeunt l 1 de offic c 18 iſidore give owne reaſon chriſt called bread body bread ſaith becauſe ſtrengtheneth body therefore called body christ wine becauſe maketh blood therefore referred christ blood theſe two ſanctified holy ghoſt changed sacrament body blood chriſt ſo ſay accordingly tertullian leaſt may cavill ſome doe ſentence abovecited wee adde ſentence wherein tert adverſ marcion l 3 p 180 • er 11 venite mittamus lignum panem eius vti que corpus ſic enim deus evangelio panem corpus ſuum appellans ut hinc iam intelligas corporis ſui figuram panem dediſſe cuius ret • ò corpus panem propheta figuravit ſheweth chriſt called bread body ſaying body prophet ieremy called body bread ſaying let u put againſt figurative sence anſwered firſt obiection sect nothing uſeth properly ſimply ſpoken ſay primum argumentum ſumitur à materiâ eſt enim materia de quâ hic agitur pactum sacramentum teſtamentum novum fuiſſe à domino inſtitutum patet ex illis verbis hic eſt calix novi teſtamenti ſanguine meo—i verò nihil ſolet magi propriè ſimplicitèr aut exquiſitè explicari quàm teſtamentum nè viz detur occaſio litigandi pacta ſeu foedera ſunt etiam ex codemgenero quae exquiſitiſſimè proprijs verbis explicantur nèlocus ullus relinquatur cavillis sacramentum hoc effe de quo agitur nemo negat—sacramentum autem ſolere à deo inſtitui proprijs verbis ut corum uſu non erretur bellar l 1 de euch c 9 § primùm § deindè § porrò sacramentum word teſtaments covenant ergò teſtamentary phraſe muſt taken literall sence challenge figurative ſpeeches never uſed covenant teſtamentary language therefore ſufficient perſpicuity figure raſh laviſh aſſertion ſelves doe teach ipſâ scripturâ dicitur teſtamentum inſtrumentum—quia pacta dei foedera inita nobiſcum continent ut patet pacto circumciſionis cum abrahamo—ante omnia praefamur scripturam uti metaphoris non ſolum ob utilitatem noſtram ſed etiam propter neceſſitatem à pluribus patribus traditur sacram scripturam de deo de trinitate de patre filio spiritu sancto proprie loqui non poſſe—quandò ſermo eſt de vitâ aeternâ praemio filiorum dei claris rebus comparatur per tropos eſt explicandus—ut auguſt ait nullogenere locutionis quod conſu • tudine humanâ reperitur scripturae non utuntur quià utique hominibus loquuntur salmer ieſ clara cogere poſſint hominem non protervum tranſubſtantiationem admittere bel lib 3 de euch c 23 § secundò trent tranſubſtantiation collected ſole true proper signification theſe word body challenge vvherein ſhew ſelves men great faith rather credulity little conſcience teaching undoubtedly true whereof notwithſtanding yourſelves render many cauſes doubting firſt scotus quem cameracenſis ſequitur—dicunt non extare locū scripturis tàm expreſſum ut ſin • declaratiore eccleſiae evidentèr cogat tranſubſtantiationem admittere atque hoc non eſt omninò improbabile quià à ſit dubitari poteſt church becauſe could find ſo full evidence proofe tranſubſtantiation word chriſt driven ſo hard ſhifts hoc eſt pro tranſit bonaventura docet idem ferè habet occam holcott infinuat etiam waldenſis—volunt propoſitionem illam non eſſe ſubſtantivè ſed tranſitive interpretandam ſc ut ſit ſenſus hoc eſt corpus id eſt tranſit corpus—sed hoc corrumpit ſignificationem verbi eſt quod ſi called fancied romiſh change tranſubſtantiation beene romiſh faith concerning substantiall change bread body chriſt haue ſhaped u anſwere namely etſi veteres eccleſiae doctores non ſint uſi vo •• doth taxe want reading either ieſuite coſter cardinall perron ignorant antient learning scotus el gave ſmall credit councell cited bellarmine gregory viith ieſuite ſaith direct tearmes ante trecentos tranſubſtantiatione card per enſa harangue au tier eſtats p 33 witneſſeth p preſton alias widdrington diſcuſs conc later part 1 § 1 pag 12 beene councell laterane might lawfull impugne hee plaine acknowledgement doctrine faith councell even scotus affirmed purſue chaſe yet ſhew article tranſubſtantiation defined councell laternae vnder pope innocentius iii sect iv owne learned romiſh venêre multa conſultationem nec decerni quicquamtamen ptè potuir cò quòd pontifex quo profectus eſt tollendae diſcordiae gratiâ mortuus eſt peruſij platina vita innocentij decerni nihil apertè potuit edira ſū • quaedam c nauclerus anno 1215 meaning councell ad feſtum sanctae andreae protractum nihil dignum memoriâ actum niſi quod orientalis eccleſia c godfridus monumetenſis math paris hiſtor minor concilium illud generale quod primâ fronte grandia prae ſe tulit riſum ſcomma deſijt quo papa omnes accedentes iudificatus eſt illi enim cum nihilin eo concilio geri cernerent redeundi veniam petierunt thus farre widdrington alias preſton booke cited prieſt long time priſoner name widdrington produce many hiſtorians viz platina nauclerus godfridus monumetenſis matth paris others teſtifie followeth many thing fell conſultation councell nothing openly defined pope dying per • ſium inſomuch ſome theſe author ſticke ſay generall councell ſeemed promiſe bigg mighty matter end ſcorne mockery performing nothing wee might adde ſuppoſed act councell publiſhed vntill two hundred yeares marvell ſome scholaſtici quidam haue doctrinam de tranſubſtantiatione non valde antiquam eſſe dixerunt inter quos scotus gabriel biel suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 50 § 1 schoolemen among scotus biel held tranſubſtantiation beene antient another synaxi ſerò definivit eccleſia tranſubſtantiationem diù ſatis erat credere ſivè ſub pane ſive ſub quocun que modo adeſſe verum corpus chriſti eraſ 1 cor 7 pag 373 lately determined church nay breerly opinion credit among ſticketh ſay mr breerly liturgie tract 2 § 11 pag 158 tranſubſtantiation compleat forme matter determined vntill laſt councell trent ſay untill yeare lord 1560 doe ſee much licking ougly beare beaſt came formed yet appeare monſtrum horrendum take beſt proved full diſcouering palpable falſhood thereof chap iii definition tranſubſtantiation church rome falſhood thereof sect councell trent ſaith conc trid dicit fieri converſionem totius ſubſtantiae panis id eſt tàm formae quàm materiae subſtantiam corporis chriſti bell lib 3 de euchariſt chap 18 § si objicias concil trid seſſ 13 cap 4 cardinall hath defined converſion whole subſtance bread well forme matter substance chriſt body first proofe falſhood doctrine tranſubſtantiation contradiction defender thereof whereby bewray nobeleefe article opinion doctours church concerning nature converſion reduced theſe two manner namely either production ſubstance bread el adduction body christ unto forme bread challenge vvhatſoever ſeeme profeſſe never ſhall perſwade u doe indeed believe either pretended formes tranſubstantiation firſt production becauſe ſame productio eſt quandò terminu • ad quem non exiſtir ideò vi converſionis neceſſariò producitur ut aqua vinum adductiva auterm c bell ibid § secundò notandum—productiva non eſt quià corpus domini praeexiſtit idem ibid § exhis cardinall truely argueth converſion production thing produced yet extant christ converted water wine wine extant produced ſubstance water body christ alwaies extant therefore ſaid produced ſubstance bread productive manner tranſubstantiation could beleeved ieſuites de rarione tranſubſtantiationis non eſt ut subſtantia quam dicitur fieri tranſubſtantiatio producatur aut conſervetur perillam imò qui hoc modo defendunt tranſubſtantiationem sacramento ad quod dam genus philoſophiae excogitatum potius quam ad verum neceſſarium rem reducere videntur vaſq ieſ 2 diſp 214 c 4 vaſquez praeter adductiuam converſionem evidentèr refutavimus omnes modos converſionis qui vel dici vel fingi poſſunt suarez ieſ tom 3 qu 7 • diſp 50 § 5 § tertio principaliter fiſher reioynder talketh fondly reproduction careaſes converted men change one may ſee much produced extant duſt fleſh ſince cannot apply reproduction tranſubſtantiation bread body chriſt anſwer impertinent may produced idle diſputer suarez hath beene confuted change production muſt follow tranſubstantiation demonſtrable ſelfe becauſe next manner inſiſt vpon cannot poſſibly ſerue turne second manner name adduction si terminus ad quem corpus chriſti exiſtat ſed non co loco ubi terminus à quo e panis tum ui converſionis adducetur ad eum locum indè vocatur converſio adductiva nam corpus chriſti praeexiſtit antè converſionem ſed non ſub ſpeciebus panis converſio igitur non facit ut corpus chriſti ſimplicitèr eſſe incipiat ſed ut incipiat eſſe ſub ſpeciebus non quod per motum localem è coelo adducatur ſed ſolùm quià per hanc cōverſionē fit ut quod ante erat ſolùm coelo iam fit ſub ſpeciebus panis nec haec accidentalis converſio ſed ſubſtantialis dictum eſt quià ſubſtantia panis definit eſſe ſubſtantia corporis chriſti ſuccedit pani proindè subſtantia subſtantiam tranſit talis eſt converſio cibi hominem per nutritionē nam anima non producitur ſed tantùm per nutritionem fit ut incipiat eſſe ea materia ubi anteà erat forma cibi bel lib 3 de euch cap 18 cardinall defineth bread late crept opinion ſome whereby created new faith flat contrary faith councell trent defined change whole ſubſtance bread substance body christ councell heard change subſtance subſtance common bread eaten turned substance man fleſh matter bread made matter fleſh adduction ſo far frō bringing subſtance bread subſtance christ body profeſſeth bring body christ ſo much unto bread outward accident formes bread yet figment ſome favourers fuerunt huius ſententiae alenſ bonavent marſil—dicunt per hanc cō verſionem corpus non accipere eſſe ſed accipere eſſe hîc necmultum diſcordat thomas deni que moderni ſubſcribentes contra haereti • o libentèr hanc ſententiam amplectuntur quià facilitatem quandam prae ſe fert ut videre licet apud ioh heſſels claud guil paris bellar witneſſeth suarez qu • ſup diſp 50 § 44 p 635 cùm panis ſubſtantialiter mu • etur à ut deſinat eſſe haec converſio eſt subſtantialis non accidentalis 2 corpus chriſti eſt ſubſtantia quae ſuccedit pani proindè propriè converti ipſum per conſequens fit vera carnem tranſmutatio alan lib 1 de euch cap 34 schooles marvell therefore aroſe ſome owne church impugne deluſion calling dixi converſionem panis corpus chriſti eſſe adductivam quod dictum video à nonnullis eſſe perperàm acceptum qui indè non tranſubſtantiationem ſed tranſlocationem colligunt sed dixi corpus chriſti non deſeruiſſe locum ſuum coelo ne que incipere eſſe ſub ſpeciebus ut loco ſed ut ſubſtantia ſub accidentibus remotâ tamen inhaerentia bellar recog lib 2 de euch p 81 cardinall himſelfe witneſſeth tranſlocation onely tranſubstantiation truely ſhould called tranſacceſsion tranſſucceſsion rather ſay put hand glove made lambskin lambe long ſince dead conſequently ceaſing therefore hand tranſubstantiated body lambe yet example meere succeſsion substance ieſuite suarez allow per ſolam adductivam actionem reverà non explicatur vera converſio subſtantialis tranſubſtātiatio ſed • •• trāſlocatio quaedam quandò una subſtantiaſuccedit loco alterius non poteſt propriè dici unam converti aliam suarez loco citat p 639 tranſlocation wee conclude ſeeing converſion whether production adduction ſo plainly proved ſelves contrary truth therefore poſſible beleeve doctrine ſo abſolutely repugnant owne knowledge obſerve way gainſay productive teach adductive yet doe deny locall mutation à termino ad terminum paradox wee tenet romiſh schoole ever ſince doctrine tranſubſtantiation hatched contrary owne device converſion adduction wherein firſt dico corpus chriſti ex pane fieri non tanquàm ex materia ſed tanquàm à termino à quo ut mundus ex nihilo confuting himſelfe e • iam ut ex aqua vinum ex nihilo pr • ſenti negotio converſio non eſt productiva panis enim cō vertitur corpus chriſti praeexiſtens ergò corpus chriſti factum ex pane ex carne eſt idem bell lib 3 de euch cap 24 § ad tertium confoundeth himſelfe ſecondly opinion hath beene ſcornfully reiected owne learned doctor nothing leſſe witneſſeth ieſuite origenes cyprianus chryſoſt auguſt hieron epiphan beda euthym theoph genimen vitis ad ſanguinem chriſti referunt—maldon ieſ com eum locum hee addeth perſuadere mihi non poſſum haec verba ad sanguinem eſſe referenda—hoc patres ſed alio ſenſu à calviniſtis qui dicunt chriſtum vinū appellâſſe quià vinum erat ſed patres vocaruntſanguinem vinum ſicut chriſtus carnem 10 6 vocabat panem maldo eund locum haec nè illi calviniſtarum errori affinis eſſe videatur maldon ibid maldonate one father produced contrary anſwering ſaith hee cannot thus perſwaded marke great boaſters accordance antiquity yet manner anſwering father moſt familiar ieſuite proceedeth telling father notwithſtanding call wine thinking wine even chriſt hee called fleſh bread iohn 6 addeth follow expoſition theſe father thus interpret give reaſon aduertiſement leſt expoſition ſaith may ſeeme agree opinion calviniſts anſwere calviniſts▪ much beholding ancient father hath made bold reiect authority alſo pervert plaine evident meaning teſtimonies declare underſtood naturall subſtantiall wine novum promiſit id eſt novum quendam modum ſumptionis regno id eſt poſt reſurrectionem quando cibum ſumpſit corporalem theoph matth 26 bibite ex hoc omnes non bibam amodò c quâ parte inveni • u vinum fuiſſe quod ſanguinem ſuum dixit vndè apparet ſanguinem chriſti non offerti ſi deſit vinum calic • ▪ cyprian ad cecil epiſt 63 paulò ante medium epiphan contra encratit qui aquam ſolùm adhibuerunt euchariſt •… ut dicant vino quoque utendum hoc ſermone domini inquit redarguuntur non bibam defructu hujus vitis epiphan tom 2 lib 2 non bibam degenimine hujus vitis chriſtus poſt reſurrectionem n • putaretur phantaſia comedit undè apoſtoli dixerunt act 10 comedimus bibimus eum eo sed cujus rei gratiâ non aquam ſed vinum bib ad pernicioſam haereſin radicitus evellendam eorum qui aquâ myſterijs utuntur ex genimine vitis certè vinum non aqùam producit chryſoſt eum locum hom 83 marginals doe manifeſt ſo plainly affirme wine chriſt dranke hereby practice heretiques aquarij confuted would drinke nothing water euchariſt wine ſaith auguſt de dogmat eccleſ c 75 vinum fuit redemptionis noſtrae myſterijs cum dixit non bibam auguſtine uſed mystery redemption even wine bleſſed ſaith clem alex quòd vinum eſſet quod benedictum fuit oftendit rurſus dicens non bibam de fructu vitis lib paedag 2 cap 11 ſub finem clemens alexandrinus owne biſhop cum matthaeus marcus nullius alterius calicis fecerint mentionem praeter ſacri quòd dicitur de genimine vitis nullus alius calix intelligi poteſt ab ijs demonſtratus quàm cujus meminerant—et omninò videtur ex matthaeo marco dictum hoc poſt conſecrationem ianſen epiſc concord cum locum p 914 col 2 ianſenius doth confeſſe theſe word chriſt former proofe confirmed analogie betweene bread chriſts body naturall myſticall sect vi 1 cor 10 16 17 bread breake ſaith apoſtle communion body christ many one bread one body much wee partake one bread sentence word bread hath double relation firſt chriſt body naturall thus joynt participation bread called communion body christ analogie reſpect excellently expreſſed panis quià confirmat corpus ideò corpus chriſti nominatur vinum autem quià ſanguinem operatur ideò ad ſanguinem refertur haecautem duo ſunt viſibilia ſanctificata autem per spiritum ſanctum sacramentum divini corporis tranſeunt although grant reaſon chriſt available prove owne body spirit fancy true body even onely argument sence touching conſequentie chriſt • affirmativè ſumpta hoc pa patur hoc videtur ergo eſt corpus optimum fuit quià ſenſus non fallitur circa proprium obiectum ita que neceſſariò quod videtur tangitur corporale eſt negativè hoc non palpatur nec videtur ergò non eſt corpus dominus non fecit mala eſt non falluntur senſus noſtri cum no album quid rotundum ſolidum ſentire arbitramur quae ſunt propria objecta sed cum panis subſtantiam ſub illis accidentibus latere denuntiant falluntur dominus ſolùm probare voluit ſe nō eſſe inane ſpectrum ſeu phantaſma ſed verum corpus id quod ex teſtimonio ſenſus tangendi optimè probavit illud autem corpus eſſe humanum idem quod anteà fuerat non probavit dominus hoc ſolo argumento ex tangendi ſenſu deſumpto quod ſine dub • non erat ſufficiens ſed multis alijs modis loquendo mandueando teſtimonio angelorum miraculo piſcium allegatione scripturarum tertul de animâ cap 7 ad finem quid agis academice procaciſſime totū vitae ſtatum evertis ipſius dei providentiam excoecas—non licet dubium senſus iſtos revocare nè chriſto de fide eorum deliberetur nè forte dicatur quod falſò patris vocem audierit de ipſo teſtificatam aut deceptus ſit cum petri ſocrum tetigit aut alium poſteà vnguenti ſenſerit ſpiritum quod ſepulturam ſuam acceptavit alium ferebatur monachus ſub unguibus venenum habuiſſe quo calicem hoſtiam infecerat mox obijt imperator beneventi animam deo reddid • anno 1313 cuſpinian valater lib 23 ut refert zuingerus 4 quod vermis generantur ex sacramento dubium non eſt cum experimentis conſter difficultas ergo circa modum eſt suarez ieſ tom 3 qu 77 art 5 diſp 57 pag 427 alij ex aere vermis generari dicunt thomas refert hanc • pinionem ſed dicit eam eſſe contrariam ei quod ad ſenſum apparet quod reverà ità eſt ſatiſ que ab ipſo quatuor rationibus confirmatur suarez ibid 5 generatio nutritio fit ex quantitate panis quae divinitùs locum tenet materiae panis ut thomas explicat greg de valent ieſ lib 2 exam myſtag calvin pag 446 nullam eſſe neceſſariam materiam ſed ſolam quantitatem ſufficere ut ſubſter formae ſubſtantiali advenienti ſive de potentia eius educatur ſive per nutritionem varietur sic thomas alij fundamentum huius opinionis eſt quià conveni • ntèr hic modus eſt ſine novis miraculis haec opinio videtur falſa mihi om ninò incredibilis—dicendum eſt neceſſariam eſſe omninò aliquam materiam ex qua generatio fiat quià deratione eſſentiali huius compoſiti eſt ſubſtantialis materia propter quod ariſtoteles dicit impoſſible eſſe subſtantiam componi à non ſubſtantiâ ergo impoſſibile eſt ut quantitas aleretur ad proprium munus materiae ſubſtantialem cauſalitatem eius suarez quo ſupra diſp 57 art 8 § 〈◊〉 p 733 algerus guitmundus waldenſis dicunt ex ſpeciebus nutritionem generationem fieri non poſſe suarez ibid vtrùm materia generationis ſit eadem quae fuit antèa ſub ſpeciebus panis vel alia thomas eandem eſſe negat ne multiplicetur miraculum finè neceſſitate 6 mihi tamen videtur eandem numero eſſe—etiam iuxtâ quorundam veterum sententiam alenſ bonavent innocent nec maius eſt miraculum ſivè eandem ſivè materiam novam facere suarez ibid ſelves diſcerned ſometimes sacrament theſe firſt cup doth inebriate make drunke secondly hoaſt taken great quantity doth nouriſh thirdly poyſoned poyſoneth fourthly beene long reſerved engendreth wormes bred alſo fed ſame fiftly matter generation nouriſhment subſtantiall contrary opinion falſe incredible sixtly matter whereof wormes creari hoc verius suarez quo ſupra miraculous converſion new creation every teach none conceipt miracle sacrament without neceſſary cauſe poſſibly perſwaded neceſſary cauſe god ſhould worke miracle excuſe yea oftentimes ſome deviſed comment deny alſo feigning apply ſome apt ſence unto vniuerſitie guiſe profeſſed art schooles uſe wit delude oppoſites diſputation great confidence ſhall ſincerity anſwering let u leave bertram teſtification commendation abbot bertramus preſbyter qui divinis scripturis valdè peritus non minùs vitâ quàm doctrinâ infignis multa ſciripſit praeclara opuſcula de secundum—panis iſte non effigie ſed naturâ mutatus omporentiâ verbi factus eſt caro et ſicut perſona chriſti humanitas apparebat latebat divinitas▪ ità sacramento viſibili divina ſe effundit eſſentia de sacram gen c 17 〈◊〉 18 sacramenti inſtitutionem ne que ad pontificem ne que ad ullam creaturā pertinere nec hoc ſolum ſed etiam c—propter ſolam ſignificationem gratiae quain sacramentis omnibus communem diximus debebant eriam vetera sacramenta determinari per appplicationem n • ortis chriſti quià licet quidem creaturis ad ſignationem effectuum ſpiritualium aptitudo quaedam ſit • men iſta aptitudo non niſi à divinainſtitutione determinatur ad peculiarem effectum habet enim aqua ex natura ſua ut munditiem ſignificet ut determinatè purgationem animae à peccato originali ſignificet hominis ſanctificationem repraeſentet divinaetantùm inſtitutionis eſt per quam elevatur creatura haec ſupra naturae conſu • tudinem non ſolùm quoad vim operandi ſed etiam ſignificandi non poteſt sacramentum niſi à ſolo deo ordinari quià habent sacramenta supernaturalem effectum ut veterilege quae dabant munditiem legalem theſe hee ſaith hee ſpeaketh ex theologorum sententia telleth although apt ne every creature beare ſignification ſome ſpiritall effect yet cannot aptnes determinately applyed vnto peculiar effect n • ſo much ſignifie outward cleannes man body sacramentally without divine reader saint chryſoſtome saying long heare wee thinke although christ ſpeech ſaith chryſoſt matth hom 83 etiamſi ſenſui cogitationi noſtrae abſurdum eſſe videatur quod dicit ſuperatque ſenſum noſtrum rationem ſermo ipſius quaeſo quod omnibus rebus ſed praecipuè myſterijs faciamus non illa quae ante no iacent aſpicientes ſed verba tenentes nam verbis eius defraudari non poſſumus ſed ſenſus ſaepi • fallitur quoniam igitur ille dixit hoc eſt corpus meum nulla dubitatione teneamus ſed credamus nihil enim inſenſibile traditur à chriſto nobis ſed rebus ſenſibilibus omnia verò quae tradidit ſunt inſenſibilia ſicut baptiſmo per aquam donum illud conceditur—regeperatio intelligitur quià eſt nam ſi incorporeus eſſes incorporea tibi tradiſſet dona quoniam verò anima conjuncta eſt corpori ſenſibilibus intelligibilia tibi tradidit chryſostome may ſeeme abſurd vnto senſe reaſon iexhort notwithſtanding eſpecially myſteries looke unto u obſerve chriſts word cannot diſappointed ſaith sences may deceived wherefore becauſe ſaid body altogether beleeve hee deliuereth ſenſible thing unto u delivereth thing ſenſible inſenſible even baptiſme gift regeneration granted u intelligible thou wert without body thing unbodily ſhould given unto thee becauſe thy soule ioyned body therefore thing ſenſible hath chriſt delivered unto thee thing intelligible chryſoſtome chryſoſtome ſaith bellar non po • uiſſet ſanè chryſoſtomus loqui clariùs ſi calviniſtā aliquem habuiſſet quem hor • ari ad fidem voluiſſet ibid quo ſupra cardinall could ſpeake plainly ſome calviniſt meant exhort faith meaning faith tranſubſtantiation hath beene confeſſed doctrine faith untill thouſand yeares chriſt returne chryſoſtome whoſe sentence may compare nut conſiſting shell kernell shell wee may call figurative phraſes kernel may terme orthodox meaning section following rhetoricall hyperbolicall phraſes chryſoſtome sect vi begin shell firſt know hyperbole rhetoricall trope figure may defined exceſsive ſpeech ſignifying truth vntruth ſay something darke darkneſſe ſelfe ſtrictly taken impoſſibility vntrue doth imply truth namely thing wonderfully extremely darke secondly chryſoſtome moſt frequent figure poſſeſſion man man yet farre effectually afterwards appeare firſt manifeſt romiſh diſputers doe odiouſly ſlanderouſly unconſcionably vilifie sacrament euchariſt celebrated protestant sect iii bellarmine others chriſtus nihil eſt illis niſi fruſtum panis vini portiuncula salmeron ieſ epiſt pauli diſput 11 § septimo euchariſtiam eſſe tantùm figuram haereſis eſtantiqua haec calvini haereſis bellar de eccleſiae c 9 § quorundam malè cocta buccella myſterium carnale nihil divini portentat—refigit inquiunt memoriam chriſti meritū eiuſque generi noſtro collata beneficia auguſtū ſanè nihil deterius ipſa praeſtat oculis noſtris inſpecta imago crucifixi weſton de 3 hominis officio c 16 patus putus panis piſtorius merum meracum ſiue vinum cauponarium eſpenc de adorat lib 5 c 9 p 188 obiect againſt proteſtants ſaying sacrament nothing elſe cruſt bread pittance wine againe morſell bread ill baked proteſtants repreſent unto memory death chriſt benefit thereof goodly matter ſo doth crucifix make sacrament signe ancient hereſie heard doctrine proteſtants teaching euchariſticall bread bare bread sacramentall ſigne evangelicall ſigne ſacred seale yet exhibiting instrument body chriſt therein devout receiver theſe outragious spirit read owne cardinall witneſſing proteſtants teach doect calvinus symbola corpus chriſti licet loco inter ſe plurimùm diſtent tamen coniuncta eſſe non ſolū ratione ſigni quia unum eſt ſignum alterius ſed quia per ſignum deus verè nobis exhibet ipſum corpus verū ſanguinē quo animae noſtrae verè alantur bellar lib 1 de euch c 1 et calvinꝰ affirmat ſaepiùs chriſti corpus eſſe praeſens sacramento quatenꝰ ibi animis noſtris verè vnitur cōmunicatur ſubſtantialiter ſic enim loquitur ſecundū ſubſtantiam non modò ſecundū effectum et fortunatus calviniſta dicit sacramēto corpus chriſti verſari realiſſime que percipi valent ieſ tom 4 diſp 6 quaeſt 3 punct 1 § 7 pag 9 idem sadäel beza ſentiunt idem ibid haec eſt eorum ſententia licèt chriſti corpus corporaliter eſſentialiter ſit coelo nihilominus duplici modo hoc sacramento verè percipi ſpiritualiter ſacramentaliter ſpiritualiter quidem ore mentis non dentis id eſt per fidem coniunctionem virtute spiritus sancti animo communicantis ſacramentaliter etiam ore quidem corporis ſumendo non ipſum quidem corpus eius ſed ſignum corporis eius panem vinum quae dicit eſſe ſigilla certa quibus promiſſio redemptionis corpore ſanguine chriſti fidelibus obſignatur valent quo ſupra although body chriſt ſtill heaven yet received sacrament first sacramentally bodily mouthes receiuing bread ſigne chriſt body god doth truly albeit sacramentally deliver unto faithfull reall body chriſt ſecondly ſpiritually mouth ſoule faith ſo truly really participate ſubſtance body blood chriſt bellarmine concerning proteſtants ſo plainly profeſſed calvin booke intituled defenſio calvini de sacramento auguſtana confeſsio ſacrâ coenâ verè dari cum pane vino ipſum corpus chriſti ſanguinem huic conſenſum noſtrum praebemus abſit verò ut no vel coenae symbolo ſuam auferamus veritatem vel pia anima tanto privemus beneficio defenſ pag 28 huius rei non fallacem oculis figuram proponi dicimus ſed pignus nobis porrigi cui re ipſa veritas coniuncta eſt quod ſcilicet chriſti carne ſanguine animae noſtrae paſcantur ibid pag 44 sacram unitatem quam no habemus cum chriſto ſenſui carnis incomprehenſibilem fatemur eſſe ibid 45 spiritualem cùm dicimus fremunt quaſi hac voce realem ut vulgò vocant tollamus no verò ſi reale pro vero accipiant ac fallaci imaginario opponunt barbarè loqui mallemus quam pugnis materiam praebere scimus enim quae non deceant logomachiae chriſti ſervos ibid p 46 quaſi verò nobis cum swinkfeldió quicquam ſit commune qui nudum ſignum docuit ibid defenſ 2 pag 35 figuratam eſſe locutionem fatemur modò non tollatut figurae veritas hoc eſt modò re quoque ipſa adſit ibid pag 43 subſtantiâ corporis chriſti anima noſtras bene paſci fateor tamen ſubſtantialem praeſentiam quam imaginantur repudio ibid pag 55 nec aliter ſanctae memoriae bucerum ſenſiſſe luculentiſſimis teſtimonijs probare mihi ſemper promptum efit ibid pag 61 veteri teſtamento nondum carnem induerat filius dei modus igitur edendi patribus à noſtro diverſus quia subſtantialis hodiè manducatio quae tunc eſſe non potuit nempe dùm carne pro nobis immolatâ chriſtus no paſcit ut vitam ab eius ſubſtantia hauriamus ibid pag 83 calvin himſelfe would make romiſh adverſary bluſh former calumny hath abandoned ſhamefaſtneſſe ſelfe challenge thus may ſee hitherto ſo pleaded exiſtence subſtance bread dubitatione alenſis gabriel palacius suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 55 § 2 pa 710 doubted diver together thomas aquinas thomiſts author alleged ieſuite suarez denyed ſaying dicendum eſt huiuſmodi apparitione non videri chriſtum ſe ita thomas omnes thomiſtae suarez ibid quandò apparet talis ſpeci • quidam dicunt quod eſt propria ſpecies chriſti corporis nec obſtare dicunt quod aliqua tantùm pa • carnis aut quod ſpecies pueri appareat quià poteſt chriſtus qua vult ſpecie apparere propria ſive aliena ſed hoc eſt inconveniens quia ſpecies chriſti non poteſt propria ſpecie videri niſi uno loco quo definitive continetur undè videatur propria ſpecie coelis non videtur hoc sacramento legitur quando que multorum epiſcoporum concilio pixide reſervatum quod nefas eſt de chriſto propria ſpecie ſentire aquinas par 3 qu 76 art 8 quis facile credat quando viſus eſt ſanguis ab hoſtia ſluere illud eſſe ſanguinem chriſti vel quando calix viſus eſt repleri chriſti ſanguine ibi eſſe chriſti ſanguinem extra vena corporis ita vt tangi aut bibi poſſit et ſimile eſt quandò appareat quaſi fruſtum carnis quod illa fit vera chriſti caro nam per ſeſe apparent indecentia ſive multo ſive parvo tempore duret et nulla eſt neceſſitas tot multiplicandi miracula experientia docet mutari tabeſcere id quod videbatur caro ſanguis quod non poteſt ulla ratione carni chriſti attribui dicendum eſt id quod huiu • • di apparitionibus videtur non ſolùm non eſſe ca • nem ſanguinem chriſti ſed non eſſe verum ſanguinem • ut veram carnem ſed colore tantum figurâ suarez ieſuit quo ſuprà ieſuite sillivitius senenſis moral quaeſt tom 1 tract 4 cap 4 5 num 142 101 iſtis apparitionibus non videtur caro ſanguis ſe ſed tan • ùm figura color illam referens ſuch apparition true fleſh true blood chriſt reaſons firſt becauſe chriſt ſay cannot appeare owne proper forme two place secondly becauſe hainous wickedneſſe incloſe chriſt boxe appearing owne forme thirdly becauſe christ blood iſſue ſprinkle veines eaſily beleeve fourthly becauſe undecencie reſerve ſuch reliques experience teaching doe putrifie thus owne schoolemen produced approved suarez ieſuite whoſe concluſion reſolution fleſh thus appearing onely fl • ſh chriſt even true fleſh onely colour signe thereof ſee different faith owne hiſtorians owne divine namely thoſe hiſtorians vncleane beaſts ſwallow downe firſt whatſoever commeth mawes thoſe divine like cleane creature doe ruminate diſtinguiſh truth falſhood ſound reaſon iudgement prove author ſuch apparition flat lyars reporter uncredible writer beleevers ſtarke fooles romiſh anſwere free former pretended miraculous apparition ſuſpition figment illuſions vnſufficient sect iv albeit theſe apparition true fleſh ſay quamvis non fiat • vera ca • chriſti vel reverà vera car • ut reſpondent thomiſtae ſed tantum color figura cius tamen quod ſit ext • ema ſpecies ſive imago divinitùs facta ſufficiens eſt ad confirmationem veritatis suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 55 sect 2 ſome doctor yet ſuch apparition miraculouſly wrought ſufficient demonſtrations chriſts fleſh euchariſt ſhould yeeld credit thoſe schoolman ſay alenſ gabriel palacius dicunt quod miracula fiunt veris non apparentibus ſignis figuris—aſſerunt talem apparitionem non eſſe factam virtute dei ſed daemonis suarez ibid hee addeth hoc ab ijs gratis dictum eſt true miracle uſe made true ſignes ſuch ſeeme onely ſo becauſe ſeeming ſignes wrought art divell take aſſurance ieſuite giveth v poteſt daemon repraeſentare figuras quarum libet rerum ut argenti auri • pularum quemadmodum peritiſſimi sculptores pictores varias formas figuras rerum ità fingunt ut interdum verè eſſe videantur sed verè propriè miraculum id dicitur opus quod omnis naturae creatae vim que potentiam excedit et una differentia qua vera miracula poſſunt à falſis diſcerni haec eſt quòd falſa ſunt phantaſtica ſimulata ideo que non diuturna vel ſunt planè inutitila perer ieſ ex • 7 diſp 4 num 34 5 n 36 38 tertia ratio ſumi poteſt ad confirmandam veritatem corporis ex dignitate perſonae corpus aſſumentis quae cum ſit veritas non decuit ut eius opere aliqua fictio inſit aquin part 3 qu 5 art 2 divels painter make ſuch ſemblances similitude true miracle diſcerned falſe falſe miracle carie onely likenes thing unprofitable furthermore p aquinas proveth againſt heretikes senſe chriſt true body becauſe could agree dignity perſon truth ſhould fiction worke thus ſtand ſtill confuted owne domeſticall witneſſes wee may adde reaſon could reſemblances truth becauſe perſonall apparition ſaid infant childe ieſus albeit chriſt aſcenſion world marcus recorded irenaeus adverſus haereſes lib 1 ca 9 marcus purpureum rubicundum apparere facit ut putaretur ea gratia ſanguinem ſtillare calicem per invocationem irenaeus faigned make mixed wine cup num 38 much moved metaphraſtes ſaith foreman inqueſt better eſteeme ſhall one thinke whole packe teſtimony name amphilochius obiected coccius theſaur cath de euchariſtia coccius writing life baſil mentioning like apparition fleſh make account doe two sed haud dubio falſa vel ſuppoſititia lib de script eccleſ tit amphilochius card baron ad ann 378 num 10 cardinal reiected suppoſititious baſtardly suggeſters theſe apparition matter obſervable ordinarily prieſts together either old men weomen ſometimes young girles whereſoever ſuperſtition raigneth knowne moſt prone thereunto ſay himſelfe another biſhop againe baptized hope profi • water font preſently vaniſhed away aug de civit lib 22 cap 8 medicum podag • icum non ſolùm dolore quo ultra ſolitum cruciabatur verūetiam podagrâ caruiſſe nec amplius quamdiu vixiſſet pes doluiſſe auguſtine telleth phyſitian vexed extreamly gout baptiſme freed paine ſo continued life long baron ann 984 num 19 baronius reporteth another child fallen little well prepared men age baptized held drowned opinion byſtanders prayer damaſcus aroſe bottome whole ſound theſe miracle happened dignifying matter water baptiſme nature sacrament ſelfe albeit voyd corporall preſence chriſt tell tanta fuit evangelii authoritas ut etiam codex ipſi miracula ediderint ut greg turonenſis vitâ patrum narrat de gallo qui evangeliorum codice accepto civitatis incendium reſtinxit ut martinus eccleſia anaſtaſiae ſlagrante teſte nicephoro li 5 cap 22 durant de ritib lib 2 c 23 num 22 durantus know miracle wrought booke goſpell extinguiſhing fiers firſt obſtacle removed way paſſage ſo much eaſier following diſcourſe chap iii romiſh manner corporall preſence chriſt sacrament manifoldly impoſsible sect ſooner doe heare proteſtants talke impoſſibility manner preſence church preſcribeth preſently cry upon vpon blaſphemous detractor omnipotencie god meant abſit ut fidelis quiſpiam aurem accōmodet impijs sacramentarijs qui excoecatâ mente omnipotentiam chriſti hoc sacramento vel comprehendere detrectant quod tanquam peſtem lethalem vitare intellectum noſtrum obſequium chriſti captivare debemus theologi colon provinc conc tract de sacram euch fol 92 tie god rule nature author pleaſed ſuggeſt wee hold neceſſary therefore remoue ſcandall thus caſt way ſimple people ſtumble upon wee conveniently proceed maine matter wee ſhall endeavor doe certaine propoſitions iudgement ancient father ſome thing reaſon contradiction may called impoſſible without impeachment omnipotencie god yea th great advancement thereof sect ii propoſition accordeth iudgement ancient father ſhewing aug de civit l 5 c 10 dicitur deus omnipotens faciendo quod vult non faciendo quod non vult quod ſi accideret nequaquam eſſet omnipotens unde proptereà quaedam non poteſt quia eſt omnipotens non poteſt mori non peccare non falli ambroſ lib 6 epiſt 37 ad chromat non poſſe mori non infirmitatis eſt ſed virtutis chryſoſt ioh nihil impotentius rationibus fuerint victi greg nazianz orat 51 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 sic ariani ab orthodoxis convicti chriſtum deum non eſſe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 eò confugiebant ut docerent per omnipotentiam dei hoc eſſe factum qui error confutatur ab auguſtino qu 79 vct novi teſt potentia inquiunt dei haec eſt ut falſa ſint vera mendacis eſt ut falſum dicat verum quod deo non competit sanctuary heretiques give inſtance arrians denying chriſt beene god eternall beleeved beene created god time poſſible ſhould made god whoſe property eternall onely pretence god omnipotencie make falſe thing true wherein proved themſelves greateſt lyars take unto ſecond propoſition ii doctrine ſame impoſſibility reaſon contradiction doth magnifie power god univerſall conſent romiſh doctor diver example impoſſibility concerning bodie sect iii owne ieſuites doe lay ground dicendū deum omnia poſſe facere quae ullo modo fiant omnes theologi dicunt deum eſſe omnipotentem quià poteſt id omne quod nō implicat contradictionem quae ponit eſſe non eſſe ſimul proindè ſi illud fieret fieret aliquid cuius eſſe eſſet non eſſe c bellar lib 3 de euch c 2 § alio igitur idem adverſarij conveniunt hoc id non poſſe fieri quod implicat contradictionem ibid ipſa contradictio cō ſiſtit eſſe non eſſe si deus haberet eſſe coniunctum cùm non eſſe non eſſet deus si non eſſet deus non eſſet omnipotens quare poſſe facere quod implica • contradictionem eſt deum poſſe non eſſe omnipotentem maldon ieſ tom 1 de euch qu 1 p 153 perer ieſ gen 17 initio divine affirme ſay god omnipotent becauſe hee doe thing implyeth contradiction contradiction affirmeth denyeth ſame thing making god himſelfe cannot make thing ioyntly contradiction omnipotencie impotencie effect defect conclude every thing either take away principle ſay farewell learning knowledge without contradiction moſt truely doctor taught truth theſi doctrine ſo manifeſt ſame hypotheſi example impoſſibilities becauſe contradiction namely impoſſibile eſt deum poſſe contineri aliquo loco greg de valent ieſ ii fieri non poteſt divinâ virtute ut ſpiritus exiſtat corporum diviſibiliter bellar lib 1 de euch cap 14 § reſpondeo ad iii non poteſt corpus praedicari de pane quia ita diſparatum affirmarctur de diſparato quod implicat contradictionem bell quo ſupra iv impoſſibile idem eſſe praeſens duobus temporibus ſimul cum tempora fluunt bel ib v rem eandem produci bi aut ter diverſis locis non habet duo ſubſtantialia nec ſubſtantialiter diverſa proinde non poteſt • novis productionibus produci vaſq ieſ 1 thom 2 diſp 76 c 6 vi impoſſibile eſt per divinam potentiam quantitati ut corpus quantum non ſitaptum occupare locum suarez ieſ 3 diſp 48 § 1 p 583 vii fieri non poteſt quòd corpus chriſti ut ſit sacramento ex uno alium locum venerit ita enim fieret ut à coelo fidelibus abeſſet quoniam nihil movetur niſi locum deſerat è quo movetur catechiſ rom de euch nu 31 p 187 viii dicere deum facta infecta reddere quis non videt idem eſſe ac dicere deum poſſe facere ut quae vera non ſint vera salmeron ieſ 2 tim 2 diſp 3 impoſſible god contained one place secondly spirit divided part thirdly bread body chriſt ſame instant bread fourthly ſame thing preſent together diver time fiftly one thing twice produced diver place sixtly body quantity able poſſeſſe place seaventhly impoſsible chriſt body sacrament come one place another eighthly impoſsible vndoe done becauſe make true falſe ieſuites others iii doctrine calvin moſt traduced point accordeth former iudgement ancient father sect iv new calumny againſt calvin impugned omnipotencie god queſtion sacrament calvin himſelfe refute lifetime profeſſing farre ſubiecting power god man reaſon order nature beleeving even sacrament exceedeth naturall principle chriſt doth feed men ſoules blood exception againſt impoſe upon god power contradiction better infirmity ſelfe calumniatur weſtphalus nobis dubium vocari dei omnipotentiam—at rerum omnium converſionem fieri poſſe à chriſto no quo que fatemur verùm inde ſi quis coelum converſum eſſe terram colligat ridiculus erit veritatis aeſtimator calv admonit ad weſtphal—rurſus no ita addictos rationi humanae eſſe iactant ut nihilo plus tribuamus dei potentiae quam naturae ordo patitur dictat communis ſenſus tam improbis calumnijs provoco ad doctrinam ipſam quam tradidi quae ſatis dilucidè oſtendit hoc myſterium minimè rationis modo metiri nec naturae legibus ſubijci obſecro ex phyſicis didicimus chriſtum perinde anima noſtras ex coelo paſcere carne ſuâ quod naturaliter non fieri omnes dicunt dicent doctrina noſtra fidei ali ſuperato mundo tranſcendit coelos cur inquiunt non faciat deus ut corpus idem plura diverſa loca occupet ut nullo loco contineatur▪ inſane quid à deo poſtulas ut carnem faciat non carnem perinde ac ſi inſtes ut lucem faciat tenebras—convertet quidem quando volet lucem tenebras tenebras lucem ſed quòd exigis ut lux tenebrae ſint non differant quid aliud quam ordinem sapientiae pervertis eadem eſt carnis conditio ut uno certo laco ſit ſua dimenſione conſtet calv inſtit l 4 c 17 § 24 item beza adverſus heſſ • uſium wee ſaith hee ſo addicted naturall reaſon panis corpus eius calix ſanguis iſ • fratres ideò dicuntur sacramenta quiain eis aliud videtur aliud intelligitur quod videtur ſpeciem habet corporalem quod intelligitur fructum habet ſpiritualem iſta thus bellar lib 3 de euch cap 3 body chriſt albeit heaven yet ſay ſubſtantially many place earth even whereſoever hoaſt conſecrated next maſter brerely booke liturgy maſſe pag 150 becauſe calvin inſtit 4 cap 17 § 10 ſaith etſi incredibile videtur ut tanta locorum diſtantia penetrare ad no poſſit chriſti caro ut ſit nobis cibum c brerely laboureth earneſtly draw calvin profeſſe poſſibility chriſts bodily preſence diver place contrary maſter caluins plaine expreſſe profeſſion ſame chapter directly confuteth romiſh doctrine madneſſe ſaying thus ſame calvin ſame chap 17 § 24 cur inquiunt non faciat deus ut caro eadem diverſa loca occupet ut nullo loco contineatur ut modo ſpecie careat inſane quid à deo poſtulas ut carnem ſimul faciat eſſe non carnem perinde ac ſi inſtes ut lucem ſimul lucem faciat ac tenebras ibidem § 26 corpus chriſti ex quo reſurrexit non ariſtoteles ſed spiritus ſanctu • finitum eſſe tradit coelo contineri uſque ad ultimum diem et § 30 cuius • rgo amentiae eſt coelum terrae potius miſcere quàm non extrahere chriſti corpus è coeleſtiſanctuario ſeeke chriſt bodie ſhould many place leſſe madneſſe require god ſhould make body fleſh fleſh one time whereas ariſtotle spirit god ſaith hath taught u body contained heaven untill last day afterwards calvin inveigheth againſt folly church acknowledge preſence chriſt sacrament except locall earth ſaith ſhe would pull chriſt sanctuary heaven laſt ſaid obiected ſentence hee explicateth himſelfe § 31 chriſtus illis praeſens non eſt niſi ad no deſcendat quaſi v • rò ſi no ad ſe evehat non aequè eius potiamur praeſentia § 36 ut chriſtum illi • rite apprehēdāt piae animae coelum erigantur neceſſe • ſt untruly alſo doth alleage bucer beza farel p 237 ſame ſence calvin maſter foxe ſaid chriſt liſt teſtimony againſt calvin ſence owne conſcience irkeſome ſee fury wherewith diſputers carried againſt proteſtants amongſt wee ſee againe maſter see former allegation brerely impoſing upon beza ſame opinion preſence chriſts body heaven earth one time although notwithſtanding fieri poſſe ut chriſti corpus poſſit eſſe pluribus locis ſimul praeter hunc poſtatam nemoinficiatus eſt quod cum • redere noluit tollit ab omnipotenti virtute salmer ieſ tom 9 tract 23 pag 173 ieſuite salmeron bitterly taxeth beza contrarily holding impoſsible one body two place therefore calleth apoſtata beza cum adverſarijs congreſſus ubi calvini myſteria non poſſe • defendere eam prorupit blaſphemiam ut deum neget omnipotentem diſertè enim ſcribit deum non poſſe efficere ut corpus aliquod manente ſubſtantia ſit abſque • oco vel pluribus locis ſimul illud enim angeli axioma apud deum nihil eſt impoſſibile non ſine exception • accipiendum eſſe quod factum fieri nequit infectum—o argutos philoſophos qui dei maieſtatem ad ſuas phyſicas regulas non erub • ſcunt revocare prateol elench haereſ lib 2 tit bezanitae another tearmeth ſame cauſe blaſphemous indeed deny omnipotencie god whereas according former propoſition rather defend becauſe god god truth one truth without contradiction neceſſarily implyed doctrine locall preſence one body many place next place evinced ſame second romiſh contradiction holding preſence one body many place proved nature diſtinct place one time making one one sect iii firſt place hearken aquinas chiefeſt doctor ever profeſſed romiſh schoole catholiciiſti cū thoma quartum diſtinct 14 art 2 hāc rationem cur non poſſit corpus chriſti localiter eſſe c—quod ſi verò non poſſit corpus chriſti localitèr eſſe diverſis locis quia divideretur à ſeipſo profectò nec poſſit sacramentaliter eſſe eadem ratione qui licet dicat hoc non eſſe per l • ci occupationem tamen dicit per realem veram praeſentiam pluribus hoſtijs ſive altaribus quae realis praeſentia • ot altaribus non locis intermedijs non minùs tollere videretur indiviſionem r • bellar lib 3 de euch cap 3 pag 491 quidam catholici atque ci sanctus thomas exiſtimant non poſſe unum corpus eſſe ſimul diverſis locis localitèr quià inquiunt unum eſt illud quod indiviſum ſe eſt diviſum à quocunqu • alio • ellar quò ſuprà poſſible miracle body chriſt locally many place becauſe includeth contradiction confeſſeth doth well concerne sacramentall manner earth aquinas reaſon vnum one ſaith divided ſelfe diver place doth divide one ſelfe conſequently maketh one contradiction doth inferre impoſsibility he▪ earneſtly ſought ſome anſwere inſoluble argument thinke greateſt doctor hath nothing ſay duplex eſt diviſio una intrinſeca ſe altera extrinſeca accidentalis reſpectu • oci itaque cum corpus eſt diverſis locis non tollitur indiviſio ſe ſed extrinſeca reſpectu • oci ut • ùm deus ſit unus eſt diverſis • ocis anima rationalis eſt diverſis partibus corporis una bellar ibid place eſſentiall ſanctarum illarum mulierum—sed optimum eſt ſol • tio moraliter intelligi ut ſi quis dicat talis homo non ſede • ad menſam coenatus eſt enim bellar lib 3 • de euch cap 4 cardinall man ſitteth table hath ſupped fond trifling wilfull perverting truth god argument man ſitteth table hee hath ſupped ſcarce probable conſequence man riſen table ſoone hath ſupped contrarily angel logicke peradventure abſolutes relative determined vnum corpus diverſis locis poſitū unum habet eſſe ſubſtantiale ſed multa habet eſſe localia ex quo fit ut omnia multiplicari debeāt quae conſequuntur eſſe locale illa autem non multiplicantur quae aliunde proveniunt relationes verò ad loca neceſſariò multiplicantur propter dimēſiones locorum itaque erit idem corpus ſurſum deorſum propinquum remotū poterit moveri locum quieſcere alio loco nec tamen implicatur ulla contradictio illa enim dicuntur contradicentia quae conveniunt uni reſpectu eodem eodem tempore modo loco ac ne id mirum videatur anima humana quae tota eſt toto corpore quolibet membro corporis certè ut eſt capite eſt remota à terra ut pedibus propinqua ut brachio quieſcere dicitur ut altero motū movere bellar lib 3 de euch cap 4 § ac primum multiplicātur reſpectu diverſorum locorum unde quae recipiuntur à corpore ſive actiones ſint ſive qualitates ſive quaecunque alia non multiplicantur ratio quia corpus unum eſt non multa ut ſi corpus chriſti uno loco caleſiat alio erit calidum ſi uno loco vulneretur altero erit vulneratum bellar lib 3 de euch cap 4 actus contrarij ut amoris odij aſſenſus diffenſus non poſſunt competere uno ſubiecto diverſis locis quia vitales actiones proficiſcuntur ex potentia naturali ut à principio agente eadem potentia non habet vim naturalem ad efficiendum actus contrarios—ratio inter actus contrarios—tantam eſſe repugnantiam ut etiam per potentiam dei abſolutam non poſſint eſſe eodem ſubiecto loco quia ſeſe omninò deſtruunt ex parte obiecti suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp • 8 § 2 § atque infinita ideo non ſolùm pluribus locis eſt ſed ubique angelus quia eſt virtutis finitae non ſe extendit niſi ad unum determinatum—undè ſequitur quòd non ſit ubique neque pluribus locis ſed uno loco fulgent ad traſimund lib 2 pag 325 spiritus sancti nobis habitatio non localis eſt inhabitat enim trinitas ſuis fidelibus ſicut tota cunctis nec per ſeparatos homines ſeparata loca particularitèr ſeparatur fulgentius reaſon becauſe spirit god dwelleth wholly faithfull ſeparated diver place baſil de sp sancto cap 22 ſub finem reliquae virtutes omnes loco circumſcriptae eſſe creduntur nam angelus qui aſtabat cornelio non erat eodem loco quo cùm aſtaret philippo neque qui locutus eſt zachariae ab altari per idem tempus etiam coelo ſuam implebat ſtationem spiritus sanctus ſimul abaccuc operatus daniele babylonia creditus catarcta cùm ieremia cum ezechiele chobar spiritus enim domini replevit orbem terrarum quo igbo à spiritu tuo et propheta quon • ego inquit vobiſcum ſum spiritus meusſtat medio veſtri baſil thus angell cornelius ſame time philip heaven zachary altar holy ghoſt together prophet daniel babylon ieremy dungeon ezekiel chobar ambroſ de spirit sancto l 1 c 7 cùm igitur omnis creatura certis naturae ſuae circumſcripta limitibus ſiquidem illa inviſibilia opera quae non queunt locis finibus compre • hendi ſubſtantiae tamen ſuae proprietate clauduntur quomo dò quis audeat creaturam spi sanctum appellare qui non habet circumſcriptā determinatam naturam—ideò cum dominus ſervos ſuos apoſtolos deſtinare voluit ut agnoſceremus aliam eſſe naturam aliud gratiam ſpiritualem alios aliò deſtinabat quia ſimul omnes eſſe ubique non poterant dedit autem spirit sanctum qui licet ſeparatis apoſtolis inſeperabilis gratiae mun • infunderet quis igitur dubitat quin divinum ſit quod infunditur ſimul pluribus nec videtur corporeum autem quod videtur à ſingulis tenetur ambroſe thus becauſe apoſtles could every chriſt ſevered giving holy ghost inſeparable none therefore doubt divine eſſence aug cont maxim axian epiſt l 3 c 21 cùm ſic laudetis sp sanctum ut ſanctific fidelibus ubique praeſentem eſſe dicatis tamen negare audeatis eſſe deum vbique ſpoken faithfull hath ſence vbicunque becauſe number faithfull finite place diſtinct abſolutely everywhere augustine confuteth arian biſhop thus prayſe holy spirit ſanctifying faithfull whereſoever deny god didymus alex lib 1 de spirit sancto hieron interprete extat biblioth patrum tom 6 pag 679 ioſe spiritus sanctus ſi unus eſſet de creaturis ſaltem circumſcriptam haberet ſubſtantiam—spiritus autem sanctus cùm pluribus ſit non habet ſubſtantiam circumſcriptam proveth pluribus idem prophetis apoſtolis c didymus alexandria hierome acknowledgeth maſter underſtanding scripture thus holy ghoſt ſeeing many place may thought creature laſtly upon ſame ground cyrill alexandria maketh ſame concluſion cyril alex de spirit sancto quod non eſt creatura quum loco circumſcriptione intelligant quae facta ſunt spi autem sanctus non ſit de quo pſallit david quo igbo à spiritu tuo spirit god creature ſaith hee becauſe thing created one place spirit god written whither ſhall goe thy preſence theſe holy father every one gatholique without exception challenge asyllogiſme theſe premiſes ſet ſtraight aſcribe body omnipreſency power every hereticall ſay body diver place doth conſequently inferre power every place doth demonſtrating holy ghoſt divine spirit therefore attribute body diver place doctrine hereticall implyeth contradiction affirming finite thing infinite adde hereunto former see chap 5 spirituall nouriſhment soules body chriſt ſaid maketh iuſt nothing corporall materiall preſence chriſts body impugne neceſſary body chriſt whereſoever conſiſt diſtinct member proportion bodie sect ii body chriſt profeſſe perfect dimenſions diſtinctions part head expoſed pricking thornes face buffer backe ſcourges eye viſible noddings mockings eares blaſphemies hand foot piercing nayles body confeſſe body chriſt celebrate uſe sacrament remembrance body conſiſting proportion diver part diſtinct one another two magnitudo figura unitae ſunt corpori chriſti naturalitèr inſeperabiliter— chriſtus corpus ſuum carnem vocat ioh 6 certè ſubſtantia ſinè quantitate complexione quadam accidentium caro dici non poteſt—denique corpore chriſti eius animaineſt atqui anima corpore eſſe nequit niſi diſpoſito organizato secundò extenſum eſſe ſe partem habere extra partem proindè ſitum quendam intrinſecum ordinem habere diſpoſitionem partium omninò eſſentiale magnitudini eſt quid enim linea niſi extenſio longitudinem c si tollas igitur extenſionem partes tollis paritèr magnitudinem bellar l 3 de euch c 5 tollere partium diſtinctionem ponit monſtroſam corporis confuſionem ut ibi ſit naſus ubi oculus manus c alan l 1 de euch c 3 p 444 cardinal doe anſwere quantity magnitude proportion extenſion part unſeparably united body christ sacrament elſe ſaith one noſe ſhould ſtand eye eye noſe difficillimum ob humani ingenij imbecilitatem dico corpus domini habere partem extrà partem ſi vox extrà dicat habitudinem ad ſubiectum non ſi dicat habitudinem ad obiectum non ſi dicat habitudinem ad locum reſp nego conſequentiam quià diſtinctio partium ſubjecto eſt eſſentialis diſtinctio quoad locum non eſt eſſentialis ſed impediri poteſt bellar l 3 de euch ca 7 negatur eſſe impoſſibile corpus quantum indiviſibili puncto collocari quin potius impoſſibile eſt corpus chriſti eſſe totum toto quùm ſit etiam punctis terminis quibus partes ſpecierum sacramentalium continuantur suarez quo ſupra p thought impoſſible body hath extenſion part ſhould contained indiviſible point ſame opinion aſcribed ieſuites ancient unto opinio antiqua quae fuit durandi dixit corpus chriſti euchariſtia non haberequantitatē fundamentum huius opinionis fuit quod eſſentia quantitatis eſt habere partes extra partes diſtinctas inter ſe fieri aurem non poſſit ut ſi corpus chriſti habeat partes diſtinctas wee iuſtly retort upon ſelves proving naturall diſpoſition bodie chriſt thus proportionably extended ſelfe muſt ſo likewiſe reſpect place ſpace becauſe three dimenſions body chriſt confeſſed ſtand thus one extenſion length another breadth third depth theſe three diſtinct one another well arme muſt thus farre longer foot legge thus farre thicker finger hand thus farre broader toe accordingly preoccupateth ſaying eo quod dicitur deus ubi que carnali cogitationi reſiſtendū eſt men • corporis ſenſibus amovenda ne quaſi ſpacioſa magnitudine opinemur deum per cuncta diffundi ut aër aut lux omnis enim huiuſmodi magnitudo minor ſua parte quàm roto ſed ita potius ut eſt magna ſapientia etiam homine cuius corpus eſt parvum—nam ſi duo fint homines aequaliter ſapientes quorum alter eſt corpore grandior non plus ſapiuntambo quam ſinguli ſic minore corpore non minor eſt ſanitas cum minora maiora corpus tam ſana ſint—diſpar eſt profecto membrorum molibus quantitas ſed par eſt diſparatis ſanitas—quae non quantitas ſed qualitas eſt non potuit ergo obtinere quantitas corporis quod qualitas aug ep 57 ad dardan nature soule farre different nature body againe ſame holy father bodily part according proportionable dimenſions space finally ſhall affinity opinion bath damnable hereſies perſwade falſity romiſh faith chap viii fift romiſh contradiction againſt word chriſt body marvailouſly palpably abſurd hath beene ſhewen among wee may reckon followeth leaſt prodigious conſequence romiſh corporall preſence wit church rome alloweth doctrine teaching body chriſt glorifyed deſtitute naturall voluntary motion sence vnderſtanding sect ii catholique faith never conceived otherwiſe humane nature chriſt reſurrection able naturally himſelfe hee man performe perfect act men right conſtitution body ſound underſtanding ſuch function iudgement reaſon appetite ſence motion according liberty doctrine 1000 yeers catholike romane faith beleeve followeth concluſions ſet ieſuite suarez suarez ieſ dico ſecundò corpus chriſti ut eſt hoc sacramento poteſt per ſe moveri localiter à deo loquor de potentia dei abſoluta nam iuxta legem ſtatutam ſuppono corpus chriſti nunquam ſeparari à ſpeciebus nec moveri niſi motis illis—ne que hac concluſione invenies theologum ullum aperte contradicentem tertiam tho qu 76 art 7 diſp 32 conc 2 conclu • 3 corpus chriſti ut eſt hoc sacramento non poſſit naturaliter moverilocaliter ab intrinſeco à propria anima interna virtute motiua naturali ne que per ſe ne que per accidens loquor de naturali virtute non ut eſt inſtrumentum verbi operans per virtutem miraculorum effectricem ratio quia non poteſt anima movere corpus ſuum niſi per membra organica quae habent extenſionem locum sed membra corporis chriſti non hoc modo exiſtunt hoc sacramento—multo minus poteſt movere ſpecies sacramenta • e quas nec phyſic • contegere poſſit ne que ad motum voluntatis movere ibid concluſ ult poteſt ut eſt hoc sacramento virtute extrinſeca moveri per accidens quia poſſunt sacramentales ſpecies moveri vt sacerdote elevando sect 3 de ſenſibus exterioribus nominales ci • atidicunt poſſe chriſtum ut eſt hoc sacramento ut deum audire c alij hoc negant sunt nonnulli quinegant id fieri poſſe de potentiâ dei abſolutâ ut corpus extenſum à loco aut ſeipſum videat autalia dico non poteſt nat • raliter exercere actus ſenſuum exteriorum ita tenet thomas alij authores—quia ſenſus cius non poteſt recipere ſpecies ab obiectis externis quia hic actus eſt materialis extenſus ſuânaturâ—quamvis potentia abſoluta poteſt—idem dicendum de ſenſibus interioribus appetitu ſentiente quia nòn uti phan • aſmatibus nec actum ſecundum elicere quia hic actus eſt materialis niſi à materiali extenſo principio non poteſt intellectus eius ſecl • ſo miraculo—acquirere nova ſpecies nec prius exquiſitis uti quia intellectus hoc non poteſt facere niſi ſimul phantaſia operetur cum intellectu non loquor de ſpeciebus infuſis haec suarez naturaliter quia hae exercentur per ſpecies ſubſtantia diviſibili chriſti corpus eſt ſacramento indiviſibiliter c without ſaith contradiction divine church firſt chriſt sacrament hath power naturally auguſtine maldonate noteth beene greateſt enemie heretickes bertram de corp dom p 20 quaeres fortaſſe quam eandem nimirum ipſam quam hodie populus credentium eccleſia manducat non n licet—diverſa intelligi quoniam unus idem que chriſtus qui populum mare baptizatum carne ſuâ pavit eundem que potum petra chriſtum ſui ſanguinis undam populo praebuiſſe—vide nondum paſſum chriſtum eſſe etiam tamen ſui corporis ſanguinis myſterium operatum fuiſſe non n putamus ullum fidelium dubitare panem illum chriſti corpus fuiſſe effectum quod diſcipulis dominus dicit hoc eſt corpus meum bertram followed vobis qui non intelligunt ſed cauſam dixit quare non intelligunt nempè quià non credunt—ut propheta niſi credideritis non intelligetis aliquantò ſuperiùs illi non put • runt illum erogaturum corpus ſuum—ille autem dixit ſe aſcenſurum coelum—certè tunc intelligetis quià co modo quo putatis non erogat corpus—caro non prodeſt quicquam ſicut illi intellexerunt carnem ſpiritualiter intellectum whoſe faith yeare 1059 may beſt knowne oath preſcribed unto berengarius concerning eating body chriſt sacrament oath baron 1059 num 11 eodem anno concilium celebratum eſt ſub nicolao ſecundo generale romae laterano ad quod reus dicturus cauſam berengarius archidiaconus • gavenſ praeſente nicolao coram centum trede cim epiſcopis confeſſionem jureiurando firmavit—quibus verbis conceptum fuit eiuſmodi berengarij iuſiurandum cùm pleno conc deteſtatus eſt errorem fidemque catholicam profeſſus—ego berengarius—ore corde profiteor eam fidem tenere quam venerabilis papa nicolaus haec sanctum synodus tenendam tradidit panem vinum poſt conſecrationem non ſolùm sacramentum ſed etiam verum corpus ſanguinem domini noſtri ieſu chriſti eſſe ſenſualiter non ſolùm sacramento ſed veritate manibus sacerdotum tractari frangi fidelium dentibus atteri—hoc iuſiurandum ab humberto epiſcopo card ſcriptum ab ipſo papa univerſoque conc recognitum atque approbatum anteà fuerat haec ex lanfranco—nicholaus papa ſcriptum iuſiurandum miſit per omnes urbes italiae galliae germaniae ad quaecunque loca quo fama berengarij pervenite potuit hactenus baronius cardinall baronius doth certifie ſtories thoſe time pope nicholas generall councell held rome reviſed approved preſcribed berengarius take abiuration errour concerning manner eating body chriſt ſame oath publiſhed pope authoritie throughout city italy france germanie whereſoever report berengarius ſhould come cannot expect ſuch forme oath muſt truely romiſh either romane pope romane councel could deviſe marke enioyned tenor oath berengarius archdeacon c doe firmely profeſſe hold faith reverend p nicholas holy synod hath commanded hold wit body chriſt sacrament onely sacrament even trueth ſenſibly handled hand prieſt
