decree hath beene lately ratified bull p gregory thirteenth ſame faith embraced afterwards ſome waldenſis ruardus scotus ſine ulla diſtinctione hac locutiones protulerunt nempè ità contrectari manibus frangi dentibus teri propriè dici de corpore chriſti dicere viſi ſunt suar ieſ 3 diſp 47 sect 4 § prima quae schoolemen without distinction vſed ſame phraſe tearing teeth secondly aftertimes quodſi corpus chriſti euchariſtia editur certè frāgitur dentibuſ que fidelium teritur utrum que n cibo quem edimus cōiunctum proprium loc theol l 5 ca ult ſub ſinem canus aſſeverantly inferreth body chriſt eaten certainly broken torne teeth moſt emphatically cardinall tàm miro modo corpus chriſti connectitur ſpeciebus ut unum ex ambobus fiat sacramentum—ex hoc ſequitur ſicut antea per cadem panis ità nunc corpus chriſti à nobis contrectari mandù cari carni noſtrae immiſceri dentibuſ que teri hoc vel illo loco vaſe collocari quae omnia ſive per ſe ſive per accidens corpori chriſti sacramento competant nihil refert modò certâ fide credamus haec tàm verè propriè fieri ac dici circa corpus chriſti quàm ſi propria ſpecie eſſet non minùs quàm ſifierent ipſo pane non minùs quàm crucifixio c attribuuntur domino deo scriptura propter coniunctam humanitatem eadem hypoſtaſi alan card l 1 de euch cap 37 p 435 alan ſaid ſaith torne teeth faithfull leſſe properly ſhould ſaid ſo bread eaten yea 21 § primùm bellarmine proofe tranſubſtantiation hath recourſe unto ſame roman councell ſtileth generall noteth thing defined beene iudgement church ſame iudgement delivered cenſure anathema curſe corpore chriſti fieri nequit salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 20 p 136 reall eating ſaith salmeron requireth reall touch tearing thing eaten body chriſt torne teeth touched eate becauſe herein impartible ieſuite cardinall bellarmine maze ſaying gainſaying may perceive yet notwithſtanding whether muſt perforce confeſſe leſſe ſaith si de ratione mā ducationis eſſet attritio dentibus facta dico chriſti corpus verè propriè manducari etiam corpore euchariſtia non quòd attritio eſt neceſſaria ad manducationem ſatis éſt enim tranſmiſſio ſtomachum deglutiendo sin verò attritio dentibus facta ſit de ratione manducationis dico chriſti corpus propriè manducari non tropicè non enim dicimus corpus chriſti abſolutè manducari ſed manducatur ſub ſpecie panis quaeſententia ſignificat ſpecies manducari viſibiliter ſenſibiliter ac proindè dentibus atteri bellar l 1 de euch c 11 § reſpon corpus body chriſt abſolutely eaten eaten vnder formes bread ſay ſaith formes bread ſenſibly viſibly eaten hee loqui velimus falſae ſunt omnes iſtae propoſitiones corpus chriſti māducatur à nobis corpus chriſti devoratur corpus chriſti frāgitur quià ipſi modi qui verbis ſignificantur non conveniunt corpori verba—quicun que dixerit verbum filium hominis c quod hominibus corpus ſuffeciſſet ad cibum ut▪ vniverſis mundi alimonia fiere • sed propterea aſcenſionis ſu • • minit ut • o corporali intellectu ſum ſpiritus vita spiritus hoc eſt spiritualia hoc enim nihil carnale nullam conſequentiam carnalem habentia 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 —caro non prodeſt quiequam quid hoc nunc de ipſa carne dixit abſit ſed pro carnaliter audire deijs qui car • aliter accipiunt quae dicuntur—quomodò non prodeſt quicquam caro ſinè qua nemo poteſt vivere vide quòd non de carne ſed de carnali auditione dictum eſt chryſoſtome followeth chriſt therefore ſpeake fleſh farre u ſaith ſo thinke ſhall fleſh profit without none life ſaying fleſh profiteth nothing meant carnall underſtanding word chriſt may know abſolutely abandoneth carnall underſtanding chriſts word eating fleſh hee ſaith fleſhly naturall conſequence ergo ſay confutation romiſh beliefe corporall touch chriſt mouthes corporall eating teeth corporall ſwallowing downe throate much leſſe corporall mixture belly gut challenge vvhether therefore capernaites thought eate chriſt fleſh raw roſted torne whole dead alive ſeeing every corporall eating thereof properly taken father held carnall capernaiticall cannot romiſh manner eating ſhould accord iudgement antiquity doctrine chriſt notwithſtanding cite u appeare tribunall antiquity ingreditur imitare centurionem dic non ſum dignus domine c obijc bellar l 2 de euch c 8 nō vidi adverſariorū reſpōſum ad hoc yea reſp orig ibid intrat nunc dominus ſub tectum credentium duplici figurâ vel quandò enim ſancti eccleſiarum antiſtites ſub tectum tuum intrant tune ibidem dominus per co ingreditur tu ſic exiſtimes tanquàm dominum ſuſcipiendum followeth figure cum hic ſanctus cibus incorruptibile • pulum c origen ſay communicant thinke himſelfe vnworthy lord ſhould enter roofe mouth right hee ſaith ſo ſame ſence wherein equivalently ſaid hee entertaineth biſhop spirituall paſtor muſt know chriſt entreth roofe namely chriſt figuratively ii chryſoſtome ſpeaketh higheſt ſtraine ſaith chryſoſt hom 60 ad pop antioch multi dicunt velle ſe eius formam videre ipſe concedit non tantùm videre ſed tangere manducare dentibus terere chryſoſt ibid lingua rubeſcit ſanguine chriſti et lib 3 de sacerdotio hom 47 ioh 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſpiritualia ſunt ſee touch eate teare teeth fleſh tearing fleſh chriſt cannot otherwiſe underſtood sacramentally even concluded ſay see chap 4 § 2 eate chriſts fleſh properly falſe propoſition iii gaudentius ſay ſaith gaudent promiſit corpus ſuum porrigit tibi corpus ſuū corpus accipis ob bellar l 2 de euch c 21 albeit little upon theſe word niſi manducaveritis voluit chriſtus anima noſtras pre • ioſo ſuo ſanguine ſanctificari per imaginem pretioſae paſſionis quo omnes fideles populi exempla paſſionis ante oculos habentes quotidiè gerentes manibus ore ſumentes ac pectore redemptionis noſtrae op indelebili memoriâ teneamus gaudent tract 2 de ratione sacramentorum wee receive bodie chriſt reacheth grant ſaid ſo interpreteth himſelfe ſaying chriſt would ſoules ſanctified image paſſion iv aug l 2 con adverſ legis proph c 9 chriſtum ſanguinem dantem fideli corde atque ore ſuſcipimus ob bellar quo ſupra cap 24 § ſex auguſtine teacheth wee receive body chriſt heart mouth obiector notandū non corde tantùm ſed etiam ore dici—bellar ibid yet followeth immediatly saint auguſtine giving generall rule ſuch ſayings agi omnibus scripturis ſecundum ſanae fidei regulam figurativè dictum vel factum ſi quid exponitur de quibu • liber rebus verbis quae ſacris paginis continentur expoſitio illa ducatur c teaching scripture figurative ſence wherein • •… er horrour turpitude may ſeeme contained noteth notable orall receiving corporally albeit ſame saint auguſtine immediatly expreſſeth ſuch speech vnderſtood figuratively unproperly v pope leo brought ſaying leo serm 14 de paſſione chriſti ipſum per omnia ſpirite carne guſtemus ob bellar quo ſupra c 28 guſtemus pro geſtamus ſpeakes baptiſme lawfully adminiſtred whereby ſaid put chriſt gal 3 ſaith corpus regenerati fiat caro crucifixi place obiected leo grant serm 6 de ieiun 7 men ore ſumitur quod corde creditur ſo ſay wee ore sacramentally guſtamus taſte fleſh fleſh chriſt nay corrupted saying word gestamus wee beare carrie namely baptized expreſſed whereof apoſtle ſaid put chriſt vi pope gregorie ſay ſaith greg papa hom 22 evang qui ſanguis ſuper utrumque poſtem ponitur quandò non ſolùm ore corpotis ſed etiam ore cordis hauritur ob bellar lib 2 de euch c 32 greg little et ſuperliminare domus agni ſa nguinem ponimus quià crucem ill • u paſſionis fronte po •• amus blood chriſt ſprinkled upon poſtes receive heart mouth wee ſay ſpake ſame improprietie ſpeech wherein hee addeth equivalently blood chriſt ſprinkled upon upper postes wee carry forehead baptiſme ſigne croſſe vii iſych lib 6 levit cap 22 per ignoratiam percipit qui neſ • quià corpus hoc ſanguis eſt ſecundùm veritatem c ob bellar quo ſupra yet ſame iſych lib 1 levit cap 2 carnem aptam • igbo fecit poſt paſſionem ſi enim non fuiſſet crucifixus ſacrificium eius corporis minimè concederemus comedimus autem nunc cibum ſ • men • e memoriam paſſionis non • receiveth ſaith heſychius ſave hee perceiveth truth blood even hee himſelfe addeth receiving memorie paſsion viii optatus tels u optat milevit lib 6 cont parmen altaribus membra chriſti ſunt portata—altare ſedes eſt corporis ſanguinis chriſti—immane facinus quandò fregiſtis calices ſanguinis chriſti obijcit▪ bellarm quo ſupra albeit ſame optatus ſame booke iudaeos eſtis imitati illi injecerunt manus chriſto à vobis paſ •… eſt altari member chriſt upon altar altar ſeate body blood hainous thing breake chalice blood efficiens ut perſpicax ſit animꝰ nec materia panis ſed ſuper eo dictus ſermo prodeſt non indignè comedenti et haec quidem de ſymbolico corpore multa por • ò de verbo dici poſſunt quid factum eſt caro verus que cibus quem qui comede • vivet aeternum materiall part ſanctified meate paſſeth draught ſaith ſpeake ſymbolicall bodie c place bellar iſta omnia rectè intelligi poſſunt de euchariſtia—at materiale quod ſece • ſum abit ſunt accidentia non reſpectu formae naturalis ſed ſanctificationis magnitudinis nam magnitudo ad materiam potius pertinet quàm ad formam—et per hoc quòd symbolicum 13 uva agnoſcunt deum ſuum cupa nolun • ▪ quaſi aliquid eos calca • u incluſus offenderit noſter autem panis calix▪ non quilibet quaſi propter chriſtum ſpicis▪ ſarmentis ligatum ſicut illi deſipiunt ſed cer • conſc • ratione myſticus fit nobis non naſcitur proinde quòd nòn ita fit▪ quamvis ſit paul calix alimentum refectionis eſt non sacramentum religionis niſi quòd benedicimus gratiàſ que agimus domino omni munere • ius non solùm ſpirituali verumetiam corporali vobis autem per fabulam veſtram eſtus omnibus chriſtus ligatus apponitur adhuc ligandus veſtris viſceribus ſolvenduſ que ructatibus nam cum manducatis dei veſtri defectione vos reficitis cum digeritis illius refectione deficietis—quomodo ergò comparas panem calicem noſtrum parem religionem dici • errorem longè à veritate diſeretum peius n • decipimus quàm nonnulli qui no propter panem calicem cererem liberum colere exiſtimant—sicut enim à cerere libero paganorum dijs longè abſumus quamvis panis calicis sacramentum quod ità blood chriſt ſonne god auguſtine one fancying nothing leſſe wee ſaith farre god pagan embrace sacrament bread wine ſpake conſecration whereupon occaſioned admoniſh chriſtian reader take heed naſcitur laſt pariſ edition ann 1614 hath foiſted inſerted corpus chriſti albeit ſence full without addition ſignifie common bread conſecration made myſticall sacramentall according auguſtine owne expoſition ſaying wee embrace sacrament bread cup alſo phraſe panis fit corpus chriſti bread made chriſts bodie repugnant common principle chriſtianity never beleeved body christ made bread foreſaid ex qui manducat carnem meam manet ego illo sicut ſi quis liquefactae cerae aliam ceram infuderit alteram cum alterâ commiſceat neceſſe eſt—ità qui carnem recipit cum pſo coniungitur ut chriſtus ipſo ipſe chriſto inveniatur lib 4 ioh cap 17 rurſus chriſtus vitis no palmites qui vitam inde nobis acquirimus audi paulum omnes unum chriſti corpus qui de uno pane participamus—quae cùm ita fiat non • è hoc sacramentum neque haber neque habere poteſt aliam efficaciam circa gloriam animae praeter cam quam habet circa gratiam charitatem ita neque aliter poteſt efficere gloriam corporis quā gloriam animae concludit hoc sacramétum non aliam conferre vitam immortalitatem corporis quàm nutriendo cōſervando gratiā charitatem 3 thom qu 79 diſp 64 § 2 glory bodie depends glorie ſoule happineſſe sacrā tom de euch § sexta quaeſtio maldonate cardinall baronius anno 120 num 22 vſque ad num 36 quae gnoſticiagebant occulto palam facta convertebant chriſtianos nam epiphan haeres 26 foetum iam natum detectum piſtillo tundant omnes contuſi pueri participes facti eſu peracto c irenoeus l 1 c 24 gens videntes quae ſunt illorum haereticorum omnes no blaſphemant avertunt aures à praeconio noſtro veritatis origenes teſtatur opera iudaeorum columnias aduerſus chriſtianos divulgatas lib 1 cont celſum—caecilius ethincus apud minutium felicem obijcit octavium sic iam de initiandis tyronibus fabula tàm deteſtanda quam nota eſt c hac baronius locis ſupra notatis baronius doe witneſſe former theſe fixing credo upon againſt obiected probabile contrarie againe looke teſtimones alleaged obiector ribera jeſ id non ideò dixerat quod ſermonem illum tacere vellet erat enim id id quod hac epiſtola agit valdè accommodatum ſed ut magi illos excitaret ſtudio audiendi intentiores redderet—non deſperat paulus quae ſcripturus eſt poſſe ab illis percipi ſi animum attendant aut certè à nonnullis eorum qui eruditiores erant per quos coeteri etiam paulatim intelligerent com heb 6 num 1 alſo hath theſe lib de script eccleſ • petrus lombardus cardinall collected ſentences divine deſerved called maſter schoolman thus farre perſon christ priest next place enquire prieſtly function function chriſt prieſthood aſcenſion heaven cardinall doctrine ſacrilegiouſly detracting sect vii doctrine cardinall name church bellarm crucis sacrificium non eſt perpetuum ſed effectum ejus—nec dicitur aeternum quòd non jugiter ſacrificatur—non coelis jam sacerdos per ſolam orationem nec mediante oblatione victimae quià tùm neceſſe eſt eum ſemper offerre—ergo euchariſtia sacrificium quod jugiter offertur—oblatio coelis non eſt propriè dictum sacrificium—ergò non eſt verè ac propriè sacerdos cùm verum ac proprium sacrificium offerre non poteſt lib 1 de miſſa c 6 ſparſim and—chriſtus non ſacrificat nunc per ſe viſibiliter niſi euchariſtia bellar ibid cap 25 § quod autem sacrificium crucis reſpecte chriſti • norum ibid cap 20 per miniſtros ſuos perpetuò ſacrificat ſeipſum euchariſtia hoc enim ſolummodo perpetuū habet sacerdotium bellarm ibid cap cod ad finem old prieſthood aaron tranſlated prieſthood chriſt every prieſt ſaith apoſtle muſt ſome thing offer elſe prieſt thus prieſthood called eternall muſt perpetuall offering upon croſſe ſuffice proteſtants ſay preiſthood perpetuall becauſe perpetuall virtue ſacrifice upon croſſe becauſe perpetuall act interceſſion priest heaven preſenting paſſion father heaven whither prieſthood tranſlated certaine chriſt cannot properly ſacrifice himſelfe doth miniſters euchariſt becauſe ſacrifice croſſe reſpect christian inviſible ſeene onely faith although true ſacrifice yet adverſaries ſay onely ſacrifice chriſtian religion ſufficient conſervation thereof againe ſacrificing himſelfe sacrament miniſters • e ſaid perpetuall paſchalis poteſt quidem dici figura paſſionis nam fi agnus ille fuit figura euchariſtiae euchariſtia autem figura paſſionis quis negat agnum iſtum figuram fuiſſe repraeſentationem paſſionis quarè joh 19 videmus evangeliſtam reddere canſam cur non fuerant crus chriſti confracta paſſione quia ſcriptum eſt de agno paſchali o non comminuetis ex eo tamen magi immediatè principaliter ceremonia agni paſchalis potiùs fuit figura euchariſtiae quàm paſſionis lib 1 de miſſa cap 7 § illud—quod celebratio agni paſchalis fuit figura celebrationis euchariſtiae probatur ex scripturis 1 cor 5 paſcha noſtrum immolatus eſt chriſtus itaque epulcmur azymis veritatis—dicent adverſarii impletum fuiſſe hoc cruce—at conſtat apoſtolos coena manducaſſe carnem chriſti—verum agnum paſchalem ad cujus epulum no hortatur apoſtolus 1 cor 5 epulemur c bellarm ibid § quod igitur § dicent cardinall albeit confeſſeth paſchall lamb figure chriſt croſſe yet ceremony thereof ſaith immediatly principally prefigure euchariſt paſſion proved scripture 1 cor 5 paſſeover offered therefore let u feaſt azymes sincerity truth offering fulfilled croſſe evident apoſtle eat true paſchall lambe fleſh chriſt supper apoſtle exhorteth u feaſt ſaying let u therefore keepe feaſt c hee beſtowing large chapter argument wherewith bleare eye leſt ſhould ſee scripture paſſeover offered rather immolation chriſt croſſe euchariſt willingly yeeld unto alleaged teſtimonies ancient father way alluſion analogie doe call euchariſt paſchall sacrifice yet word scripture ſhould properly principally meane euchariſticall sacrifice iewiſh paſſeover rather prefigure sacrifice chriſt maſſe croſſe one tedious worke ſift droſſe argumentation nevertheleſſe becauſe putteth proteſtants unto ſaying u followeth bellarm q • ſuprà § dicent c dicent adverſarii apoſtolum loqui de immolatione cruce facta no probabimus figuram illam propriè impletam fuiſſe c •• na adverſaries ſaith ſay apoſtle ſaying paſſeover offered ſpeaketh chriſts sacrifice offered upon croſſe prove figure properly fulfilled • pper ſhew adverſaries proteſtants ready encounter champion firſt choiſeſt chieftaine owne ſide armed authority chriſt himſelfe ioh 13 1 day paſſeover ieſus knowing howre come muſt paſſe world unto father ſpoken even ſaith job 13 1 antè diem paſchae ſciens ieſus quia venit hora ut tranſiret ex hoe mundo ad patrem hîc mortem tranſitum vocat—alludit ad paſcha ac fi latinè diceret antè diem feſtum tranſitûs ſciens quia venit hora ut tranſiret ipſe ipſe enim paſcha noſtrum immolatus eſt chriſtus—optimus autem terminus tranſitus ejus ex hoc mundo ad patrem tolet ieſ com • um locum tolet cardinall ieſuit came celebrating sacrament body blood laſt supper meant hereby namely chriſt alluded unto iewiſh paſſeover ſaith ſignification ceremony paſchall lambe immediatly properly prefigure euchariſt chriſts paſsion wherein whether muſt adverſary himſelfe ceremony principall sacrifice theſe two viz matter sacrifice sacrificing act oblation offered name ſaith cardinall see teſtimony following notable teſtimony sacrifice maſſe state queſtion ſo good ſet downe state controverſie ſelves inſigne teſtimonium pro sacrificio miſſae mal 5 1 verbis ab ortu ſolis uſque ad occaſum magnum eſt nomen meum gentibus omni loco ſacrificatur offertur nomini meo oblatio munda quià magnum eſt nomen meum gentibus dicit dominus lib 1 de miſſa cap 10 tota controverſia eſt malachias loquatur de sacrificio propriè dicto quale eſt eccleſia euchariſtia verò de sacrificio impropriè dicto quales ſint laudes orationes c bellarm ibid argum 1 propheta utitur voce minhhah quod eſt sacrificium abſolutè abſque adjuncto ut cum dicitur sacrificium laudis c argum 2 vox munda opponitur immundis oblationibus judaeornm quae non dicuntur immundae ex parte offerentium tantum quia opponit illis oblationem non enim munda diceretur omni loco cum pluribus ſint mali miniſtri argum 3 dicitur non accipiam munus à manibus veſtris hinc colligimus non ſolùm mundam eſſe hanc noſtram ſed novam—argum 4 ex antitheſi contemptus hebraeorum erat publicis sacrificiis non privato cultu tantùm ergò gloria oblationum apud chriſtianos erit publico sacrificio argum 5 opponit malachias non omni populo ſed sacerdotibus tantùm veteris legis non omnes chriſtianos ſed certos homines qu • sacerdotibas ſuccedunt ergò non loquitur de ſpirituali ſed de sacrificio propriè dicto whole controverſie whether scripture ſpake sacrifice properly ſo called vnproper sacrifice ſuch prayer thankſgiving c contend proper sacrifice deny grapple together ſhall firſt charge alleaging corrupt tr • nſlation ground falſe interpretation romiſh objection grounded upon falſe text romiſh vulgar tranſlation even judgement ancient father sect romiſh vulgar tranſlation decreed councell trent authenticall thereupon injoyned uſe diſputations bound alſo thereunto oath bull pius quartus tranſgreſſe decree doth deliver u text every place ſacrificed offered name pure oblation c without pronomen hanc demonſtrat ad ſenſum id quod tunc manibus tenemus id autem panis eſt et ſimiles ſunt liturgia non paucae ſententiae quae panem offerri apertè ſanè demonſtrant denique veteres patres opera virtutum non ſunt propriè dictum sacrificia lib 1 de miſſa cap 2 § haec non quae ſola actione conſiſtant ut pſalmodia genuflexio opus quodlibet ad honorem dei factum ib § secundum non quae ſola oblatione fita ut aurum argentum c ibid § secundò non decimae aut primitiae § sed nec patres appellant sacrificium id quod ſolum eſt figura commemoratio sacrificii § tertiò non pia voluntas quia inviſibilis § secundò non eleemoſynae quia non ſoli deo oblatae § tertiò nulla reverentia externa ut genuflexiones preces quia actiones tranſeuntes § sexto paſſiones martyrum alia omnia bona opera largo modo—non autem propriè rigore sacrificia dici poſſunt ibid cap 3 § reſp martyrum workes vertue unproperly called sacrifice workes conſiſt action tranſient bowing ſinging pſalmes ſole panis vini • en lib 4 cap 32 primitias creaturarum offerentes—hanc oblationem eccleſia ſola pura offert fabricatori offerens cum gratiarum actione ibid expoſitione ordinis r • mani exſcriptis greg papae oblationes fidelium fuiſſe tantùm panem vinum—et collectae uſum pauperum velteſtitutionem eccleſiarum opportuno tempore non inter ſolennia miſſarum—quae populi donaria non certè sacrificia—sacrificium autem ficut iſidorus dictum quaſi ſacrum factum quià prece myſtica conſecratur caſſand ibid non ignoramus veteres theologes appellâſſe euchariſtiam sacrificium laudis maldenas nonlatin alphabet 〉 see chap 2 sect 1 concluded proper sacrifice apoſtles abſtained abſtained word prieſt sacrifice apoſtles indeed forbeare ſuch termes ſpeeches concerning chriſtian worſhip whereof theſe forenamed diſputers give u reaſon see former teſtimonie leaſt ſay iewiſh prieſthood yet force chriſtians might ſeeme uſing iewiſh termes innovate iewiſh rite enough ſhew perſwaded abſtained uſe apoſtles thought altar prieſt sacrifice eſſentiall part chriſtian religion neither would ought concealed word name leaſt thereby might ſeemed abhorred proper character chriſtian profeſſion deſcend cyril multò poſt vitae honeſtas ad meliora propenſio eſt sacrificium fragrantiſſimum—et paulus hortatur no exhibere corpus noſtra sacrificium ſanctum rationalem cultum noſtrum deo—igitur etſi judaei manner reſemblance wherein cannot poſſibly erre truth ſelfe guide ſaid doe remembrance namely ſame mee meaning chriſt crucified croſſe apoſtle commenteth ſaying hereby ſhew lord death till come even body death whereunto beare father witneſſe thorowout treatiſe whereby eaſie u diſcerne ſubject sacrifice chriſt reall sacrifice croſſe sacramentall repreſentation commemoration application thereof queſtion propitiatory sect whole difference ſtandeth upon whether ſubject matter repreſentation hand prieſt properly propitiatory sacrifice propitiatory either pacifieth wrath god pleaſeth owne virtue efficacy confeſſe sacrifice chriſt owne ſelfe elſe thing ſaid propitiatory pleaſing god god gracious acceptance indulgence romiſh profeſſe sacrifice maſſe ſuch proper virtue prieſt handleth tridentine finde proper sacrificing act make maſſe properly sacrifice ſo neither ye ſhew propitiating act make properly sacrifice propitiatory prove councell colen si reſpicimus corpus chriſti quod continetur quod eſt ſitum actione sacerdotis ſeu miſſae communicantium aut eccleſiae ſed ratione sacrificii quod cruce oblatum concludeth maſſesacrifice cannot called propitiatory reſpect act oblation prieſt accommodation communicant yet church onely oblation made chriſt himſelfe croſſe oblation abſent ſeeth preſent himſelfe thus thoſe divine driven objective act oblation iv confutation romiſh diſvaluation call chriſts sacrifice sect iv laſt reſpect value chriſts sacrifice croſſe doe chriſtianly eſteeme beene mirum non eſt ſi cùm chriſtus infinitus extitit ejus hoſtia fuit infiniti meriti ſatisfactionis salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 33 pag 265 266 infinite merit satisfaction becauſe offered himſelfe otherwiſe erat infiniti valoris nec enim aliter potuit compenſari injuria deo facta ribera ribera ieſ quoniam quotidiè peccamus quotidiè vi • tutem paſſionis chriſti participamus quod conc trid docuit quo cruentum illud ſemel cruce peragendum repraeſentaretur atque ſalutaris ejus virtu remiſſionem peccatorum eorum quae quotidiè à nobis committuntur applicaretur et hoc catholicis quidem hominibus manifeſtiſſimum eſt haeretici negare non poſſunt quoniam scripturae verbis apertiſſimè truth truth ſaid confirmed laſt councell truth conſented unto heretikes manifeſt truth would looke truth univerſally profeſſed church without exception behold even ſince councell trent greatly tibi offerimus c canon maſſe prouideth application sacrifice made unto remiſsion ſinnes ieſuit teacheth hinc suarez ieſ quia oblatio hujus sacrificii eſt fructuoſa ex opere operato ergò rationi sacerdotis spiritually refreſhed mouth prieſt therefore intreated lend attention inſtant time tell u whether ſpeake reaſon unto antiquity catholike hath beene generally booke 1 chap 2 sect 9 confeſſed ſelves never admitted part maſſe call sacrifice ſuch prepared communicate receiving sacrament ſhut others doores ſay neither would could lawfully done beene romiſh faith beleeve sacrifice propitiatory ſuch devontly attend behold whereſoever sacrifice expiation among iewes law perſons liberty partake thereof thinke argument ſticketh faſt bowel cauſe romiſh church leſſeneth due eſtimation chriſts paſſion applying others increaſing falſlydeviſed unjuſt gaine behalfe prieſt without warrant antiquity sect iv hitherto expected ſome reaſons might move church ſo leſſen proportion chriſts paſsion application thereof remiſſion either ſinnes puniſhments length ieſuit salmeron commeth reſolve u ſaying salmeron ieſ si hoc eſſet infiniti valoris celebrata eſſet miſſa pro redemptione omnium animarū quae expiatorio carcere continentur totum evacuaret purgatorium quod non eſt credendum quia fruſtrà tot miſſae pro u • defuncto celebrarentur tom 9 tract 33 pag 268 de miſſis privatis sacrifice hujuſmodi caſibus non ſecundùm voluntatem miniſtri ſed ſecundùm obligationem quâ tenetur pro hoc vel illo offerre alii volunt obligationem tenere—sed operatur ſecundum intentionem miniſtri quatenùs accordingly ſaith sacrament lord supper reſerved carried lifted worſhipped method muſt treat firſt chriſts inſtitution maſſe next profeſsion antient father romiſh maſſe ſelfe laſtly wee ſhall returne preponderate according weight argument ſhall put either inſtitution chriſt ſhewing therein neither precept adoration sacrament practice thereof sect ii outward adoration sacrament practiſed diſciples chriſt ſay inſtitution thereof confeſſe u take upon give reaſon thereof wit coſter ieſ nec opus erat ut genuflexo ſignificationem novam honoris darent ſumentes corpus dominicū quià cundem habebant piaeſentem corpus ſuum porrigentem quem mente ſemper colebant enchir de euch tit adoratio anſwering objection apoſtoli ultima coena hoc sacramentum non adorabant need apoſtles ſhould uſe outward ſignification honour sacrament becauſe chriſt preſent viſible ieſuite contradicteth owne objection therefore adoring chriſt receiving sacrament becauſe sec hereafter chap 7 sect 2 commeth roofe mouthes neerer approach majeſtie greater uſeth outward humiliation well practice outward adoration apoſtles time appeare much leſſe evidence precept beene word chriſt volume new teſtament ſyllable chryſoſtomi ad hae • adverſarii neque reſpondent neque reſpondere poſſint si enim angeli ad altare aſtant capitibus inclinatis cum horrore ac tremore vix audent intueri propter ſplendorem inde emicantem quis negare poteſt aliud ibi eſſe quam panem et ſi angeli adorant quis homines reprehendere poteſt ſi adorent paulo ſuperius ex hon 4 〈◊〉 ad coriath accedimus ad agnum illum jacentem peccata knew propriety language well viz tertullian ſaying adoro plenitudinem scripturarum adverſus hermog poſt medium pag 350 adore plenitude scripture gregory nazianzene among greeke excellency divine manducat niſi prius adoraverit ob bell alius locus inſignis lib 2 de euch cap 24 § alius none ſaith auguſtine doth eat fleſh chriſt adore teſtimony ſeemeth notable judge indeed able prove divine ſhall communicate sacrament symbole chriſt muſt firſt true chriſtian beleeving chriſt onely man god alſo adore accordingly divine honour well without sacrament receiving thereof even athanaſ contra • spiritu sancto cap 27 c hence know cuſtome ancient church namely euchariſt ſhewne people conſecration ſee done among u invocated upon even plainly conſecration ſaith durantus alſo indeed almoſt doe firſt pleaſe admire wit cardinall ſo framing conſequence abhor decive done applyeth word ſpoken baſil invocation conſecration yet owne doctrine chriſt preſent ſpoken invocation euchariſt conſecration materia deficit non conficitur sacramentum—si non ſit panis triticcus vel fi alioqui corruptus et pag 32 si vinum ſit factum acetum vel penitùs putidum vel de uvis acerbis non maturis expreſſum vel admixtum aqua ut ſit corruptum non conficitur sacramentum miſſall dico ſpecies conſecratae perfect • miſceri poſſunt cum liquore ſpecie diſtincto tum non manet • ub eis ſanguis chriſti ità thomas teſte suar ieſ 3 thom diſp 67 § 4 § dico et durand si plus apponatur aqua quàm vini erit irritum sacramentum lib 4 cap 42 ieſuite theſe firſt bread wheat ſecondly corrupt thirdly wine turned vinegar fourthly ſowre fifthly unripe grape ſixthly ſtinking imperfectly mixt liquor kinde conſecration void ſo neither body blood chriſt preſent ſeventhly yea water wine defect eaſily may happen beyond rata non ſunt ſi dum conferuntur unum tantùm verbum quod ad ſubſtantiam pertiner omittatur imò ſi uniu • ſyllabae omiſſio ſenſum verborū mutaverit • corruperit collatum sacramentum non valet ut ſi sacerdos dixerit hoc eſt cor meum pro corpus meum azor ieſ inſtit moral tom 1 lib 5 cap 28 § animadvert—hoc eſt c si quis diminueret aliquid aut immutaret de forma conſecrationis vel aliquid addat quod ſignificationem mutaret non conficeret sacramentum miſſal rom pag 33 haec ſunt neceſſaria neceſſitate sacramenti quibus ſublatis tolli • ur sacramentum ut nimirùm non peccet sacerdos corrumpendo quas videt vel ſi habe • coram ſe undecim hoſtias intendet conſecrare decem non determinan • quas decem intendit non conſecrat quia requiritur • tentio miſſal ibid prieſt conſecrating ſaith cardinall maſſe leaveth people nothing ſubſtance creature bread wine adored ſtead chriſt ieſus sonne god yet summe reckoned foreſaid defect concerning matter forme conſecration prieſts intention therein elſe poſſible intruſion function conſecrating one prieſt ſuppoſed ordained every defect force ſelfe infer neceſſarily materiall idolatry romiſh maſſe rather ſhall call theſe inſtances odious malicious muſt accuſe owne romiſh church becauſe alleaged teſtimony owne publike romiſh miſſall cardinal ieſuites author privileged church high point chriſtian religion even principall part god royalty divine adoration trifled withall therefore ever ſhew ſelves conſcionable divine freeing romiſh maſſe formall idolatry theſe forenamd reſpects concerning confeſſed materiall idolatry doe ſome ground truth elſe abandon profeſſion moſt damnably idolatrous chap vi romiſh maſſeworſhip formall idolatry notwithſtanding pretence romiſh doctor hath beene made contrary state queſtion sect vpon occaſion ôh summiſts theologues caſuiſts doe beſtirre themſelves vindicating church guilt formall idolatry briefe defence bellarm vbi deeſt vera conſecratio nullum eſt periculum co qui bonâ fide sacramentum adorat adoratio enim potiſſimum ex intentione pendet quarè ſicut qui panem non conſecratum inju • iâ aff • ceret putans conſecratum eſſe graviſſimè peccâſſet chriſtum ſic etiam contra qui panem eundem adorat quòd certo credat non eſſe panem ſed chriſtū propriè formaliter chriſtum adorat non panem lib 4 de euch cap 30 vbi quis ſimpliciter adorans sacramentum non conſecratum eſt actus latriae actus moraliter bonus procedens ex motivo honeſto—sicut quando quis dat elee moſynam homini petenti nomine chriſti ex miſericordia infuſa operatur ſi prudenter exiſtimaverit illum eſſe pauperem quam vi ſpeculativè decipi contingat suarez jeſ tom 3 qu 79 art 8 diſp 65 pag 829 col 1 omnis fidelis rectè adorans hoſtiam conſecratam adorat ſub ea conditione ſi perfecta ſunt circa ipſam ea quae ad proved foure ground romiſh profeſſion firſt definition idolatry sect divine honour honor eſt teſtimoninm excellentiae quod continetur verbo vel facto quae de excellentia alicujus convenientem exiſtimationem illi gignit sic honor divinus eſt quicquid verboruns aut officiorum omninò accommodatum eſt ad gignendam exiſtimationem hujuſmodi quae divinam majeſtatem propriè conveniat hoc duplici modo 1 ut opus ſit n • turâ ſuâ ità praeclarum ut quis illud naturali lumine rationis ſolum deum talus hono • e dignum eſſe judicet quale eſt sacrificium alterum ut tale ſit intentione ejus qui vult de perſons quam honorat talem exiſtimationem excitare quae divinam majeſtatem conveniat licet honor iſte alioqui indifferen ſit greg valent lib 2 de idol cap 3 ſaith ieſuit valentia whatſoever word outward office man doth performe whereby doth intend beget others ſuch eſtimation god unto honoureth proper unto majeſtie god idolatry error underſtanding ſaith ieſuit eſt idololatria divini cultus erg • falſum deum exhibitio colere enim pro deo eum qui non eſt deus aut ipſum laudando aut e • aliquo modo proſternendo idololatrare eſt—idololatria quae eſt falſa adoratio non eſt niſi erro • adorat lib 2 diſp 8 cap 11 pag 389 taught ſignes euchariſt adored ſame honour chriſt therefore panis ſubſtantiam poſt conſecrationem abeſſe probatur quià ſi unà cum domini ſubſtantia panis ſub eiſdem accidentibus contineretur periculum e •• et nē populus ſimpliciter adoraret panem bellarm lib 3 de euch cap 22 initio et alanus lib 1 de euch cap 34 non poſſe ait euchariſtiae duplicem exiſtere ſubſtantiam quià eccleſia eſſet ſummo periculo idolalatriae c ratio eſt quià cùm adoramus id quod deliteſcit ſub ſpeciebus panis ſi eſſet ib • adoraremus salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 16 pag 109 contendit claudius sainctes ex unitate adorationis abſentiam ſubſtantiae panis colligere etenim ſi duplex maneret ſubſtantia sacramento una panis altera chriſti non poſſet citrà idololatriam unica adoratio urram que referri vaſquez ieſ quo ſup bread adored sacrament chriſts body leaſt people able diſtinguiſh body chriſt bread ſhould fall idolatry perſon communicating orally ſay body chriſt mouth adored regularly sacramenta haec ſumente homine quià quandiù eo sacramentaliter ſun • incertum eſt nec regulariter •• c ordinarie ſolent adorari—praeceptor meus joh benedictus magnum dominicani ordinis ornamentum docuit majua eſſe idololatriae periculū ſi chriſtus adoraretur homine quià homo eſt ſubjectum rationis capa • honor eſt autem praemium virtutis ſigna verò ſacra non propter ſe ſed propter re quas figurant exhibent ſunt veneranda ii tantum periculi non ineſt quàm • homines peculiari hoc honore propter ſumptum ſacramentaliter ſic aliquandiù chriſtum eis habitantem proſequeremur sic eniur homines paulatim deos eſſe putaremus 〈…〉 de euch lib 1 cap 6 fol 14 becauſe ſay man capable honour might fall little little ſhould honoured god owne ieſuits others yet doe wrong contemplation chriſt reaſon hypoſtaticall vnion godhead meere creature wholly excepted taught father generall conc epheſ •… tom 1 c 12 § pari neque hominem cum verbo adorandum dicimus ſed unum eu • demque nè illud cùm verbo aliquam diviſionis imaginationem meriti objiciat et tom 4 c 26—adoratione verò non ſeor •… deum nec ſeorſim hominem ſed unum chriſtum councell adore diſtinct nature whole chriſt challenge wee ſuppoſe owne romiſh sect albeit moſt ſuperſtitious would worſhip divine worſhip either signes appearance fleſh prieſt while sacrament mouth without leaſt morall perſwaſion viz may ſo doe without good intent viz well done without habituall condition viz doe ſo knew signes apparance fleſh hee meerely prieſt therefore idolatry adoring theſe thing chriſt certainly much rather caſe idolatry worſhip divine honour bread without chriſt iii romiſh worſhip proved formally idolatrous maſſe conſequence romiſh doctrine touching canonization saint sect iii concerning pope canonizing saint ſee ambroſ catharinus compſae arch • epiſc anno • adverſ nova dogma cajet card ti • de veneratione canonizatione sanctorum pag 126 ob eccleſiam canonizatione sanctorum errare poſſe cathar quòd errare non poteſt docet turr dicens hoc eſſet fidei fundamentum evertere pag 127 adduxi xiſti quarti ſententiam decreto canonizationis bonaventurae ubi confidens de spir sancti ſupren â directione confidenter illum sanctum eſſe pronuntiat fideliter ab omnibus teneri praecipit—quod arroganter feciſſet ſi haec re ad fidem non attineret • ag 128 bonaventuram protuli qui docet horribiliſſimum eſſe eccleſiam hujuſmodi errare poſſe periculoſum eſſe fidei eò quòd ſi unus sanctus vocatur dubium etiam coeteri vocari poſſunt ità periculoſum eſſet invocare sanctos pag 129 adduxi iterùm teſtimonium hieronymī epiſt ad phil hominem non ſanctum sanctorum jungere ſocietati eſſet chriſtum violare cujus membra ſumus ibid ob sat e • univerſali credere canonizationem sanctorum veram eſſe canonizationem hujus aut illius credere non tenemur quià sanct • ſit pendet ex facto utrùm nimirum talis fuerit talia fecerit quo eccleſia errare poteſt quià non eſt error fidei ſed facti pag 132 reſp numquid canonizatio sanctorum ſit genere non particulari de quolibet sancto pag 135 ob nihilominus pi • credendum eſt • errar • non poſſe riſp ego crederem pictatem fidei eſſe divinae revelationis authoritatis non hominum pag 142 ob certâ autem humanâ certitudine ſuadet credere pieta fidei ceita verè divinâ certitudine • ubet credere neceſſitas fidei pag 142 reſp credere vivum eſſe membrum chriſti quod eſt putridum fidem laedit quare eſt error pernitioſus pag 144 et thomas ſi per cultum exteriorem aliquod falſum ſignificetur eſt cultus perniciofus pag 147 acultu divino abeſſe debet omne mendacium quia eo fidem noſtram proteſtamur cum deo agimus io •… mur qui omne falſum fictum vanum abhominatur haec ca • harinus ibid pag 149 marginals ſhall finde common opinion church directeth thinke church cannot erre function chriſtians bound beleeve ſame upon morall conjecturall perſwaſion onely upon divine infallible certitude becauſe ſay one saint may doubted might alſo canonization others called queſtion ſo would dangerous worſhip saint leſt ſhould worſhip dead rotten inſtead lively member chriſt error pernicious ſeeing every lye figment falſhood religious worſhip muſt need abominable unto god archbiſhop others aske maketh queſtion hand give u leave tell challenge ſame archbiſhop catharinus catharin ibid qu • ſuprà ob doctrina haec ſu • detur exemplis hoſtiae non conſecratae quam sacerdos exhibet adorandam ubi nulla idololatria quià fides eccleſiae non ad aut illas ſpecies panis refertur ſed ad hoc quod corpus chriſti continetur ſub ſpeciebus panis quando fuerit rite benedictum patas tu quòd minus poteſt errare eccleſia adoratione hoſ • iae non conſecratae quā cultu sancti pag 132 133 reſp catharin petrus de palude aſſerit nullo modo eſſe dandam hoſtiam fimplicem pro conſecrata quod eſſet idololatria quoniam cum miniſtratur etiam adoranda proponitur et hier ferrar cui quidam objectabat quod hoſtia per quam jurabat non erat conſecrata cui reſpondet ſi ita fuiſſet ſeciſſet populum idololatrare atque ideò tanto magi provocaret ſe iram dei—audi hoſtia conſecrata adoratur chriſtus ut deus non ſimpliciter ſed ut exiſtons ſub ſpeciebus cumigitur ibi non ex • ſtat chriſtus ſed creatura pro chriſto invenitur cui exhibetur latria atqu •… deò idololatria eſt idololatrae enim etiam hâc errant ratione qui coelum puta aut aliquid aliud adorabunt putantes ſe ibi adorare deum quem • imam mundi dicebant juxta varronis theologiam non igitur excuſantur ab idololatria quòd arbitrarentur ſe unum deu • colere ſicut verè erat unus deus ſed quod illum ibi adora • ant ubi non erat • modo quo eſſe exiſtimabant ibid pag 134 135 deduceth neceſſity infallible aſſurance canonization every saint infallibility ought concerning conſecration euchariſt thus worſhipper may deceived deceived taking bread chriſts body hath beene generall confeſſion concluſion muſt therefore may formall idolater iv romiſh worſhip proved formall idolatry conſequence uſed conſecration pope sect iv vera idololatria ib § dicet—si idem cultus exhibetur imagini propter aliud ut aequè colatur creatura atque deus certè eſt idololatria nam idololatria eſt non ſolùm cum adoratur idolum relicto deo ſed ctiam cùm adoratur ſimul cum deo ibid • praetereà—imagini non convenit cultus internus verus latriae nec externus proprius qualis eſt sacrificium ibid § quarta—qui colebant imaginem chriſti divinis honoribus inter haereticos numerantur ab epiphanio auguſtino damaſceno atque iſti cùm chriſtum colerent ſine dubio imaginem ejus propter ipſum colebant non igitur imago licet divinis honoribus colere e cultu latriae etiamſi quis dicat id eſſe facere propter deum vel chriſtum non propter imago ibid § sexta ratio haec bellarminus latria divine worſhip given image becauſe relation hath chriſt romiſh perplexity defect prieſtly intention sect v neceſſitie prieſts due intention conſecrating bellarm lib 1 de sacram cap 27 § quantum ad primum nova haereſis orta eſt hoc tempore cujus author luthe • u non requiri interiorem intentionem miniſtri ad perfectionem sacramenti non tàm inquit conferentis quàm ſuſcipientis fide ſita eſt virtu baptiſmi ſi miniſter joco abſolveret ſi tamen credat ſe abſolutum veriſſime eſt abſolutus et § johanaes calvinus—vt ſi miniſter totam actionem intùs ſubſannans coenā chriſti ritu legitimo adminiſtret non dubitem panem vinum mihi eſſe veriſſima chriſti corporis ſanguinis pignora sic etiam proteſtantes alii—catholicorum ſententia eſt quae eſt conc trid requiri intentionem faciendi quod facit eccleſia et paulò poſt § ad hanc ad hanc haereticorum ſententiam acceſſit ambroſ catharinus quo excepto hac doctrin • mirificè conveniunt catholici doctores cardinall alleageth authority addeth conſent doctor except catharinu • produceth opinion luther calvin condemning romiſ • doctrine condemneth cenſure hereticall wee permit vour diſcreet iudgements whether yeeld oſtentative flouriſh cardinall exact accurate diſcourſe salmeron ieſ intentio duplex publica obſervando formam publicam pronuntiatione verborum c altera verò privata particularis ipſius miniſtri qui aut nihil credit corum quae facit aut deriſoriè facit aut contrariam habet intentionem non conferendi sacramenta—at ejus intentio non eſt abſolutè neceſſaria rat 1 quià cùm intentio intima ſit latens corde ejus inſenſibilis ſequeretur hominum animos • queri ſcrupulis dubitationibus verum ſuſcipiant sacramentum quod ſanè scripturis patribus contrarium eſt qui no firmâ fide sacramentum ſuſcipere adhortantur 2 rat quià ſic hominum falus ex hominum aliquorum arbitrio penderet ſic homines plus nocere poſſent quam chriſtus juvare 3 quià plecterentur innocentes propter hominum malitiam quod remotum eſt à divina bonitate 4 quià ſic liberum erit omnibus dubitare baptizati fint euchariſtiam adorent 5 quià hoc dogma proximum erit donatiſtar • haereſi contra quos diſputat auguſt •… u docens per malos miniſtros conferri ſalutaria sacramenta 6 mirum eſt oli •… eccleſiam controverſia novatianorum donatiſtarum aſſerentium baptiſmum ab haereticis collatum nullum eſſe • debita illa intentione miniſtri ni • il diſputâſſe ergo ſatis eſt publica actio niſi miniſter contra proteſtetur aut aliquo modo vitie • formam sacramenti sufficit eatenus publicus actus ut notarius publicum conficiens inſtrumentum nec poteſt intentione ſua internâ licet deriſoriè agat illud validum reddere pro hac ſententia ſtant multi patres aug lib 1 cont literas petilian oppugnans illud donatiſtarum conſcientia dantis abluit conſcientiam accipientis salmeron ieſ epiſt pauli diſp 2 pag 186 sacerdos deus ac pater domini dei servatoris—qui tibi oblata munera frugum oblationes accepiſti odorem ſuavitatis—ſanctifica anima noſtras poſt sacerdos conſecra • verba conſecrationis adhibet sancte qui ſanctis requi • ſcis—ſuſcipe hymnum incorruptum ſanctis incruentis sacrificiis tuis iames conſecration prayer god accept gift celeſtiall altar even gift called fruit earth party well prieſt people verſione interpretum erratum eodem modo sacreboſc defenſ fid trid salmeron tom 1 prolegem 3 cardinall evaſion better lurking hole ſo ſeemeth two ieſuites azorius qo ſup mihi verò verior videtur eorum eſſe ſententia qui opinantur vulgatam editionem non ſolùm rebús fidei morum ſed coeteris quoque omnibus omni errore carere quia licet aliquando aliqua ſignificantius proprius ac latius reddi potuerit non tamen verius aut ſimpliciter certius azorius greg valent analyſ lib 8 cap 4 § etenim c quod autem eccleſia addit ne ullus illam quovis praetextu audeat rejicere id profecto evidenti argumento eſt omnibus omninò locis quod attinet ad omnes ſcripturae ſententias eſſe hanc ut authenticam e conformem scripturae originali à concilio approbatam secus enim praetextus aliquis ſupereſſet quò non obſtante hac definitione concilii poſſer aliquandò ea editio diſputationibus rejici nempè ſi diceretur hoc certe aut illo loco non eſſe hujus authorem editionis spiritus sancti mentem aſſequntum—in omnibūs igitur locis v •… concilium eam haberi pro authenticâ exceptis erroribus typographorum—vt judic cap 11 pro▪ altera matr • loctum fuiſſe adultera matre ut quidam objiciunt—nam concilium probavit veterem benè typis impreſſam—poſt § porrò nullo modo audiendi ſunt qui poſt concilium tridentinum contendunt editionem vulgatam aliquibus locis quod ad ipſam ſententiam 〈◊◊〉 qui • 〈◊〉 • raeti latine tranſlation even ſet forth pope clem octarus—in 〈◊〉 •… — 〈◊〉 accuratiſſimè mendis purgatus clement moſt accurate edition thus epheſ 1 14 lat vulg spiritu fignati promiſſionis quae eſt pignus haereditatis graecè 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 quem locum hieronym pignus latinus interpres pro arrhabone poſuit arrhabo futurae emptionis quaſi quoddam teſtimonium obligamentum datur pignus verò pro mutuâ pecuniâ ponitur cùm illa reddita fuerit reddenti debitum pignus à creditore aug serm de viſime dei • om 10 pag 1687 accipis codicem ab amico cui da pignus cum reddideris quod accepiſti ille cui reddis habebit tu pignus accipies non enim habebit ambas re ſed quando pretium para dare pro care quam tenes bonae fidei contractu de ipſo pretio da aliquid exit arrha non pignus quod ſit complendum non quod ſit auferendum sed ſi deus charitatem dar tanquam pignus per ſpiritum ſuum cum eam rem ipſam reddiderit quâ promiſsâ pignus dedit auferendum eſt à nobis pignus abſit sed quod dedit hoc implebit ideo meliùs arrha quàm pignus—hoc enim implebitur cum arrha data eſt ſealed ſpirit promiſe pledge inheritance greeke ſealed ſpirit promiſe earneſt inheritance queſtion whether theſe preferred hierome auguſtine ready reſolve herein correcting vulgar tranſlation word pledge one giving abſit • l againſt sence reaſon becauſe giveth pledge taketh againe thing pledged received giveth earneſt continue given ſo god aſſuring choſen spirit doth greater confidence give earneſt pledge thereby advancing god gracious love towards man man faith god love corner pretence errour print doctrine may rejected without prejudice oath errour print ariſeth ſome affinity word theſe word ſound reaſon delivered print returned preſſe thus fond reaſon betweene pignus arrhabo symphony betweene horſe saddle availe exiſtimant patres filios zebedaei temerè reſpondiſſe ego vero credo eos verè eſſe locutos item matth 16 18 non praevalebunt quorum verborum ſenſus non videtur mihi eſſe quem omnes praeter hilarium quos legiſſe memini authores putant item matth 11 11 variae ſunt patrum opiniones ſed ut liberè fatear nul carum aquieſco item matth 11 13 prophetae lex omnes fere • eres ita exponunt ſed non eſt apta ſatis interpretatio item matth 19 11 non omnes capiunt e non omnes capimus sic omnes fere veteres exponunt quibus equidem non aſſentior item iob 6 62 sic quidem expono licet expoſitionis hujus autorem nullum habeo hanc tamen magi probo quam illam auguſtini caeterarumque alioqui probabiliſſima •• quia hoc cum calvinistarum ſenſu magi pugnat indeed ſaid father beleeve contrary item ſeemeth sence 5 diſp 49 quo omnes peccaverunt mariam conceptam originali peccato e • ſi • non ſi • haereſis daninata nempè tam •… ad fidem ſpectat item diſp 51 qua multitudine patrum locum ab autoritate infirmum —pauperis eſt numerare pecus—exod 13 judicio plurimorum non acquieſces ſententiae ut à vero demas multitudinem multitudini opponimus devoti erga virg reſp totam devotionem e • ga illam non conſiſte • e patribus ut bernardo c antiqui reſp quilibet ſenex laudator temporis acti ſed illud aſſerimus quo juniores eo perſpicaciores doctores eſſe hee wrangleth wreſteth ſome ſavings father part celeberrimâ
